The zoom isn't all that great but I don't expect much in a small point and shoot like this.  Very easy to operate too..all the buttons are at your fingertips.  I do wish it had a viewfinder for those sunny days but I think that option is gone on point and shoot digi's.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Travis Danley
Reviews.Content: This camera is awsome, it takes such good pics Above and Below water. expecually with the water mode on, even at 120 feet the pics were great, but the video was amazing under water, very clear and great sound.. I don't think you can get any better with a compact camera

Reviews.Title: SD1300IS First Impressions...
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: Just received this camera about a week ago.  Great deal on Amazon - $[...] (which included $20 off which I think is a Canon instant rebate), plus a free Canon case and 4GB memory.  The case is very nice and classy, although a bit stiff, but I am sure it will break in.  I also see that Amazon is offering free 2-day shipping now, which sweetens the deal.As for the camera, my first impression are that I love it.Physically, it looks sharp in the blue color and but more importantly it has taken great pictures.  There is not much you can manipulate other than using pre-programmed setting and a few other settings, which make it great for those who just want to "point and shoot."  It comes with a USB to RCA cable which allows you to view photos and videos on your TV - and one video I viewed looked great.  I said to myself it looks like you are right there watching everything live.Again, these are my first impressions since I just got it.  The only suggestion I would make is...It is small and the camera finish is smooth, so use the wrist strap to prevent you from dropping it - especially if you have large hands.Also one con: the little flap that covers the USB port/slot is cumbersome - I feel like I am going to break it off each time I open it.

Reviews.Title: Good Compact Size / Great Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Bahiense
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the Cannon Powershot camera. I got it just a few days before my trip and was very pleased with the pictures I was able to take.Its compact design made it easy to carry it all times. I used exclusively the 'Auto' mode as I had not had time to look into the more advanced features.I do not think the use of these options is that intuitive. Still, the quality of the pictures was very good.This camera does not have a printed manual; instead it comes with a DVD that contains the user guide. I wish at least a basic guide of the different programs/features were included to facilitate a comprehensive understanding of the different camera functions.

Reviews.Title: Nice One
Reviews.Author: M. Yakkali "murali"
Reviews.Content: This camera is really awesome. pictures are very good. Low light condition pics also good. I had SD 600, compared to that canon improved picture quality , low light etc a lot. Video quality also good.Only thing is pictures taken with auto mode are very good compared to manual mode, i would expect same picture quality with manual mode too with default factory settings.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Pics & The User Friendliest Of The User Friendly.......But Not The SD1100IS
Reviews.Author: Uncle Bobby
Reviews.Content: This line of Canon Point and Shoots is truly choice.  They all take great pics and I find them super easy to use.  I'm a local Pro in NYC.  I've been exclusively digital for about 7 years, and am always looking for cameras that give me the most practical control.  I have 3 of the Canon PowerShot SD1100IS s' and my sister has the Canon PowerShot SD1200IS.What I like best about these cameras is that it's as simple to adjust exposure as it is on a classic film camera.  Two pushes or so of a button, and your on a screen that gives one a clear option to under or over expose by up to two and a half stops. (Thats opening or closing the camera "eye" to allow more or less light in).  It's incredibly useful in variable light.  As well in constantly changing species of light, the camera easily allows switches between daylight, florescent, cloudy, tungsten and the remaining luminant temperatures.The flash is very easy to turn of and off, as well is it simple to change the ISO/ASA with a few button pushes.  This said about the flash, I use it as little as possible.  The camera takes great pictures in low light, and the image stabilizer works very well.  Even at 1/15 of a second, I'm oft times surprised that the image came out as crisp as it did.I stay away from the full auto mode, but turn it to when I know a less savvy "cameraman" gets hold of it.  My Mum loves the auto mode, and uses it almost exclusively.  She has a full sized 8x10 on her mantle of us 3 (including my Pop) in Paris next the Eiffel Tower, that she is entirely proud of, and it was shot in full auto mode.  Mum has the model 2 generations prior, and it is still going strong.  That example of longevity and ease of use is the reason I'm writing this review.I did notice something quite cool in a camera shop the other day.  I picked up the 1200 and my finger was very close to the lens.  The camera automatically shifted to macro mode, and I could very easily see in detail the grooves of my finger prints on the viewfinder.  I was surprised and  very impressed by the cameras auto intelligence.I have actively used the Macro (close up) setting for photographing some of my artwork on the fly.  I do woodcrafting, and have used the camera on several occasions to show clients my progress.  I do a fair amount of very small pieces, so many a time have placed the subject on the window sill, atop a plain white sheet of paper, and a solid image have I snapped.I'm writing this review with the experience of only the two prior models.  I'm still yet to hold this one in my hand, but if all holds true to form, this camera will be as solid of a performer.I did withhold one star from my review as I've noticed the subtraction of the viewfinder.  I'm a purest in that sense, and a camera that cannot be looked through and fired does not sit well with me.  Granted I use the LCD a lot, I like being able to aim and fire in the classic compact stance.  I feel such a detachment from the image capture, when I'm holding the camera up and staring at an LCD.  It feels pedestrian and unengaged.  That's really just my preference and me being a bit judgemental of the digital age. :)The viewfinder models also allow that the LCD can be turned off, and although I've not done extensive research on this, I feel it helps conserve the battery when your LCD is not constantly on.  I saw another reviewer who claimed his eyesight necessitated a viewfinder, and that this model was not for him.  To you sir, the PowerShot SD1200IS is still available here at Amazon.  It cost about $70 more, but may be well worth it to you.I find that model has a better selection of body colors.  The orange  Canon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Orange)  and green are quite stark.  Of my 3 PowerShot SD1100IS s', my brown one is my favorite.  It's darkness in tone makes it not so noticeable and my subjects don't always realize I have it out.  My wife has the pink one and it is just the prettiest little thing.  We also have a gold one, that we plan to use exclusively with an underwater housing we purchased from the "Fantasea" company.Good luck to you all on your hunt for the perfect camera.  For me I've found it.  Hopefully you need look no further.  Go ahead....... Put it in your cart....... Proceed to checkout....... Place your order......I promise you won't be disappointed.:) :) :)Happy Holidays To AllBPS.  I forgot to mention that I use the video function quite a bit.  My niece and nephew are at such a fun age, and I no longer need to carry around a separate video camera to record their events.  With the current average size of an SD card, I'm able to record birthday song after birthday song and endless minuets of all the laughs we have.  We got the Wii Game Just Dance 2 for the Thanksgiving holiday, and they're great at it.  It's a fantastic game and it's hilarious to see them compete against the adults.  It's so so funny.  I'll write a review about that game when I get some time.  :)

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: ANSSO
Reviews.Content: I like this camera because it is small and it is a Canon.  Since I have had it for only four days I will only say it takes great pictures on the Auto mode with and without the zoom.  I took a few pictures in the dark and they came amazingly clear for this size camera.So far I am a very satisfied customer.PROS: Quality of pictures, size, flash, comes with a battery charger and Amazon gave me a free 4GB card.CONS: No viewfinder but if you want one, you get a camera with it. Battery life is kind of short so I got an extra battery.Will come back later to add to this review.UPDATE OCTOBER 29/2010I have used this camera now since the middle of June and I am still very satisfied with it.The pictures come great, it is portable, easy to use, and it has a reallly big screen for its size.Please keep in mind this camera is meant to be small and will not have some of the features of bigger cameras.I am very happy with it because it is a nice point and shoot camera and fulfills my needs of amateur photographer!!!!If you need or want a much better and/or sophisticated camera, no need to buy this one.  There are plenty others in the market.

Reviews.Title: A big step backwards from my 4 year old PowerShot A530
Reviews.Author: John M. Petren
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for the A530 because I figured in the 4 years since we got it, Canon would've figured out how to make a better camera at this price point.  Well, they somehow have made a worse camera.  Long story short, I think the computer inside the SD1300IS is TOO smart.  On auto, it constantly tries to pick the right ISO setting and only succeeds about 75% of the time.  The other 25% of the time the picture is too dark.  It also has trouble in my family room with the recessed lighting; many times the white walls look yellow.  Yeah, I can go into the settings and switch some things around, but should I really have to?  Finally, the flash is too powerful.  I don't want to turn a dimly lit room into daytime; I just want enough light to take a picture that accurately captures the scene.I'm returning this camera and saving up the money to buy a SLR camera.  Probably not a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great Bring-a-long Camera, Quality, Ease, Price, SURVIVOR
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Kim
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my mother and one for my younger sister and they both love it. I did have an issue when purchasing a camera for someone else: will it survive drops and random acts of negligence?This camera did just that. It only has survived the most brutal acts towards technology and I pity these little troopers. My mother has dropped this item in water and off of a small ledge during a camping trip. It only sustained small scratches on the body but still works excellently.The only problem I had was with the lag it seemed to have. After prolonged use something happens and the camera seems to slow down. When this happens just give the camera some rest, clean the innards, and expend the battery followed by a FULL charge. It seemed to do the trick. Also, I noticed that taking pictures without flash is absolutely horrid. I understand many cameras share that issue but this one seemed to only reinforce that idea. Be wary.Quality of pictures: 4/5Software/flash: 3/5Price: 4/5So durable it can survive a practical barrage of abuse: 100/5

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Jenkins
Reviews.Content: This is the second canon we've bought the first one was a SD1000. My daughter a freshman in college has had it for 3 years now and it still takes great pictures.This new camera is a good deal for the price ($117). So far now I've had it 2 months and it works great. You cannot beat canon cameras for quality.

Reviews.Title: Power hot!
Reviews.Author: Cookie
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price.  High resolution, good zoom, excellent display.  For a point and click with some guts, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Powershot continues to excel
Reviews.Author: Donald Pudim "Don"
Reviews.Content: The Canon Powershot continues to perform as Usual.  This is my third and they only get better.  Canon support is great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but older model better
Reviews.Author: BobLap
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a relative that wanted a simple digital camera.  I had bought my wife the previous model of this series and she loves it, small, compact, fast, and easy to use. So, when my wife's cousin asked for a recommendation for a camera this was the one I suggested.  It still is a great little camera but there was one modification that Canon made that hurts, they did away with the little view finder, now you can only aim the camera using the LCD.The one thing that used to set Canon apart in cameras of this type and price range was the optical view finder, it was a great feature for people that take alot of pictures outdoors in sunlight.  You didn't have to try to use the LCD which gets washed out in strong sunlight.Still a great little camera but Canon should have kept the view finder.

Reviews.Title: A Very Fine Little Camera
Reviews.Author: lindadeal
Reviews.Content: Our company needed a camera for the surveyors.  This camera filled the bill perfectly.  It fits in the pocket.  The battery stays charged during the whole field trip.  Photos come out just right.  It will also be used for the company website photos.

Reviews.Title: Great photos!
Reviews.Author: Glenda Cobb
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use.  I took it to the Amazon for photos on the go.  It was just fabulous!

Reviews.Title: Awesome point & shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: NFlesch
Reviews.Content: If you're looking a simple, point & shoot camera that is easy to use and will produce great pics...I doubt you will find a better one in this price range!  Very impressed!!

Reviews.Title: long lasting
Reviews.Author: canon maniac
Reviews.Content: I've dropped it on the cement 2 or 3 times and it still works with few scratches . I've only had it for 6 months  and i already have fallen in love with it. my mom got it for me for my birthday

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Girliegirl79
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace an HP Photosmart r742 that I gave to my mother.  I really like this camera.  I'm not an expert at all the features this camera has, but so far, all the pictures I've taken have been beautiful.  This camera is easy to use and I've had nothing but success so far.  I love it. No problems here.

Reviews.Title: Good Cannon for my money
Reviews.Author: A. Sosa
Reviews.Content: I got the following camera on sale. It takes nice pics. It takes a little too long to snap a picture at times (on auto when its adjusting to the light) otherwise nice color. Video works great even in a dark setting/areas, i noticed. Works for me.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for your buck.
Reviews.Author: R.C.
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. Easy to use, good quality pictures, nice features and very convenient size.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: R. Freeman
Reviews.Content: I normally shoot with a DSLR, but was looking for a vacation-portable camera that I wouldn't be afraid to carry onto a roller coaster or log flume.  I also wanted a camera that would be family friendly - it had to have a full-auto mode that took decent pictures.  It also had to be substantially better than a cell phone camera, since I already have one of those with me all the time - and in this price range that isn't a given.I picked the SD1300, and I am pretty happy with it so far.  Some general observations:1.  The auto-ISO tends to be pretty aggressive so if you are going to make a big print you might want to set that to manual.  For indoors shots I'd say you're really only getting 2-3MP of real data, and the rest is noise.  That isn't atypical for a camera like this, and the aggressive ISO actually helps make the pictures look less washed out.  My DSLR does the same thing, but the difference is that ISO 400 on an $800 DSLR is a lot less noisy.  Camera makers like to advertise megapixels, but in reality 3MP of good data is plenty for 99% of all the prints people buy, so don't let that turn you off.  If I were planning on 8x10s or larger I'd be using a DSLR anyway, and even this camera will probably be OK for 8x10s even indoors - but not reliably so.2.  The form factor is wonderful.  It is completely flat when off which makes it easy to slip into a pocket, even if wearing jeans.3.  The price tag means that it is almost disposable.  Not going to be upset if it lasts at least a few trips.4.  Full auto mode works just fine in general.  I fully expect to use this most of the time.5.  Shutter is pretty snappy for a contrast-focus P&S.;  Sure, it isn't a DSLR, but I barely notice the lag in even indoor lighting.6.  If you're like me be sure to turn on the face-zoom focusing feature, and the focus review-after-shot feature.  The first feature zooms in faces when you half-shutter which lets you quickly verify the focus.  The latter shows the focus area at 1:1 in an inset when the shot is reviewed on screen which lets you see how it turned out.  No more playing with the playback/zoom buttons to check for camera shake.7.  Face detection is snappy and reliable.  Auto-red-eye seems to be hit-and-miss, but so far I didn't notice any negative effects from having it on.  My last P&S; had this feature and honestly it didn't seem to do much beyond slowing things down, but that was probably the first P&S; to have the feature years ago.8.  The low-light 2MP mode seems to work fine.  Even the 2MP is pretty noisy, but even my DSLR (a few years old) wouldn't have done any better (in fact, the SD1300 might be superior).Overall if you're just looking for a cheap camera that will take good quality shots this is a good fit.  This will not take shots remotely as nice as a DSLR except perhaps outdoor on a sunny day.  You could spend a few hundred more and get something that better handles low-light conditions/etc.  However, honestly if you're that serious about your pictures I'd probably use the dual approach of a cheap portable camera, and a good quality DSLR and flash for serious/demanding work.  Or, buy this camera for $110 right now, and then in two years buy another camera at the same price and it will probably do everything a $350 camera does today - that's just the nature of P&S; cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Marilyn
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit of a geek, and people frequently ask my opinion on electronics.  Whenever they want a point and shoot camera, it's always the Canon SD's that I recommend - I have several friends that own them, all are pleased with their purchases.  I just bought this one for my brother.  With 3 kids he needed something small that would power up quickly to take a nice picture.  He especially loves the video mode on it.  They have so many new features on them I'm almost wishing my old camera would die so I could get a new one.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Mark Fuller
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Small, takes great photos, connects to my Mac with ease and it has a good zoom! Perfect everyday camera!

Reviews.Title: Easy camera for beginners that works well
Reviews.Author: Bruce
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on the amazons best rated digital camera, which price point was around $100. I needed a digital camera for work, which could be easily be used my some non-digital camera savvy employees. To this end, the camera works well and is more than sufficient for point-and-shoot applications (in my case, manufacturing product images).Not a lot of bells and whistles on this camera, but she does the simple job well. I would buy this again for the environment I've placed it in.

Reviews.Title: Amazingly good
Reviews.Author: Nanookh
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera together with the underwater housing and shot more than 2000 pictures during our 3 weeks trip to Indonesia. The quality of the pictures can compete with digital SLR cameras. Also underwater pictures are great. We didn't use the underwater program, because we couldn't find how to get there (manual lacks on that point), but using white balance helped us out and someone told me that UW mode doesn't create pictures as good. We bought a second camera for in case the first one breaks or floods we'll have the other and still can use the UW housing.

Reviews.Title: CANNON CAMERA SD1300IS
Reviews.Author: G. M. Rogg
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with purchase. Great price. I saw the same camera at a leading retail store that likes red bullseyes for about $60 more. The camera is very easy to use and uploading pictures for online viewing is a breeze. Pictures look great on my computer. So far so good!!

Reviews.Title: Easy and decent
Reviews.Author: Anothermom
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little disappointed with this camera.  It seemed to have trouble focusing on the right subject and pictures taken indoors were pretty dull.  But I worked with the settings changing the focus  function to centered and making sure I chose the right picture settings and now I am happier with the results.  I like that there isn't much shutter lag time.  It is super easy to use and it seems pretty durable which is great because I have kids and I keep it in my ever knocked around purse.  Since i figured I was going to have to replace my camera every year or so, I went with a cheaper one and am not disappointed after a short learning curve.

Reviews.Title: Hasn't taken a bad photo yet
Reviews.Author: PassatDoc
Reviews.Content: I upgraded my four year old Canon SD600 (bought December 2006) to this model, my first digital camera with Image Stabilization (IS). I would encourage anyone purchasing this camera to use the MANUAL camera settings. When it's set to Automatic, the images are ok but not outstanding. If you switch to Manual mode, you can change lighting (sunny, cloudy, flourescent, tungsten, etc.) and vary the ISO setting. When these adjustments are made, the camera is free to do its best, and the results are astoundingly clear and rich. While there is significant noise at 800 or 1600, setting the ISO this high may allow you to take photos in very low light without needing (or beyond the range of) the flash. Battery life is superb: took 30 minutes of video plus 200+ photos on one charge. Lack of HD video is a minus, but at this price point ($129), the camera delivers superb value and quality for money spent. Videos shot at the higher resolution setting (480 I believe) are of good quality.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommend!
Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera - especially for the money.  It is easy to figure out how to use and takes very clear pictures.  I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camara for general use
Reviews.Author: Anne Curran
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small lightweight camara to carry with me for the occasional picture or in cae of an accident.... This is just right. A breeze to use, small and light, and good pictures too.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Harold A. Bouton
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better point and shoot cameras. Great price for a versatile small camera. Great backup to my canon Sx20is. I have had good luck with this camera. Picture quality is as good as my SX20is. I do miss the view finder I have on the bigger camera. You can't go wrong with a canon camera.

Reviews.Title: Great simplicity
Reviews.Author: SC-techie
Reviews.Content: Took back the Sony DSC-370W that I bought for my wife as it had the worst shutter response of any point-and-shoot I have used and replaced it with this camera.  The response time is much better even with the face recognition turned on.  Easy to use switching from Auto to Program to video modes.  Inside images are still a touch fuzzy but outdoor shots are quick and sharp.  I would recommend this camera for anyone looking for basic snapshot pictures in an easy to use point and shoot (oh yeah and my wife doesn't care too much about the rest of the stuff - she's just happy its pink!)

Reviews.Title: Cannon just makes great cameras!
Reviews.Author: Creativefreak
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera especially for the price. This is my third Cannon point and shoot and it's just as great as the other 2. everything I've ever owned by Cannon has been top quality. Very intuitive in my opinion. And to anyone who hasn't owned many cameras or isn't used to using SD cards I HIGHLY recommend getting at least an 8GB class 4 or class 6 card! You'll love the fact that you can take a couple thousand pictures and shoot lots of quick video!

Reviews.Title: Solid Choice
Reviews.Author: Brad from ATL
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the Cannon SD1300IS after using it over the Christmas vacation.  I took more than 30 pics and even had a few complete strangers take a few for us.  None of them came out poorly and they all had vivid color and clarity.  For $109 bucks, this is a real steal of a purchase.  Amazon even hooked me up with a credit after the price came down shortly after I purchased mine for ~ $21 more a few days prior.  By this and you won't be disappointed in the least!

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures
Reviews.Author: A. Campbell
Reviews.Content: I received this for Christmas. Took some very nice pictures and videos in low light and like the results so far. Nothing major to complain about. I also have a DSLR (high quality) and so I will mainly use this as a back up. I like that it fits nicely in all my purses (even the small ones).

Reviews.Title: Powerful Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: F. Jimenez
Reviews.Content: Considering it's size, this camera comes well equipped with your P&S; " point and shoot " needs. Has great IS ( image stabilizing ) and although it's just a point and shoot, it shoots well under low light. Now this doesn't mean you can shoot in an alley way with just a lamp-post on and get a SHARP image.I recommend this camera to anyone looking to capture moments and not have to carry the BULK of a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: It's the best for the price at Amazon
Reviews.Author: JJ "DIY"
Reviews.Content: For the paid price plus the free 4GB SD card, it's simply the best pocket camera that I can find in 2010.

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera.
Reviews.Author: Teri J Cooper
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st digital camera.  Amazon was great at providing the info I needed to make a choice.  Once I selected this model I did shop on other sites.  I saved $40 on the package of camera, memory card, camera case & free shipping.  The camera was also on sale for $30 less.  Thank You Amazon!!!!  It takes fantastic photos even close up.  I love the big LED screen.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, great picture quality, awesome features
Reviews.Author: AH
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about 6 months now and like other canon models I have had, it really is a great product that I recommend to my family and friends. This camera has great features, intuitive controls and looks so sleek. It is also small enough to keep it in a pocket or clutch bag, which is  a plus. The colors are vivid, and it snaps a picture fairly quickly after the button is pushed.I found the charge lasts a very long time, my pictures always turn out great, and are so easy to import onto my computer (plug and done). I also love the color select feature and the sepia. The videos turn out great.Remember to grab a memory card to hold your pics and a case to keep it safe from weather and getting dirt in the lens...I destroyed a previous canon (8mp version of this one, which I also loved) by not using a case and just stuffing it in my bags.I don't really have too many complaints, maybe that the screen was a bit bigger?

Reviews.Title: Pleased with look and performance
Reviews.Author: HB Mom "5byC"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 18-year old daughter. She is pleased with its look and performance. It's easy to use and easy to carry, due to it's small size. The image quality is great. We were surprised it did not come with a memory card, however.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, perfect for low lighting
Reviews.Author: D. Rahal
Reviews.Content: With winter here, I tend to keep my little ones home more often than summer so this camera comes in handy because its awesome for indoor pics with low light. Your focal point including the backdrop all come out looking bright. This camera takes really crisp, fresh shots every time. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is the second canon that I have owened the first was the SD 1200 and was lost on vacation so I bought the SD 1300 and am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Susan Ingraffea
Reviews.Content: I previously had an older model Canon PowerShot. I wanted to stick with Canon but wanted something smaller. This one is wonderful! It is tiny - it fits in a small wristlet type purse. The battery life is great, and I am very satisfied with the picture quality. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Pink Camera
Reviews.Author: jaeb
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I wanted something that would be handy to keep with me, and yet do a good picture, this camera fits that description perfectly.  I love how easy it is to use and that it's pink!!  I would definitely recommend this!!

Reviews.Title: Great point and shot
Reviews.Author: Joanna Corraro Daniel
Reviews.Content: This was just what I wanted and needed for my current picture taking.I used to use 35mm, lenses, all of it.  Too much trouble when traveling.Picture quality is very very good.

Reviews.Title: This camera rocks!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: LL84
Reviews.Content: I have never liked the thought of compact cameras but I LOVE this camera! Not only does it take great still pictures and is easy to use (my two year old figures out features on it), the video feature is my fave. High quality video and as easy to do as taking a picture. Sure beats lugging around a camcorder, and you never have that when you need it anyway. Like the other comment poster, I put it in my purse and have it for those great every day shots that I would have missed. And the green color is SWEET! IS feature is great for pics of kids and one of the key reasons I got it. Canon has not disappointed on this or any other product we have gotten from them.

Reviews.Title: Bad Lens
Reviews.Author: Ordinate
Reviews.Content: As soon as I turned the camera on, the lens jammed and would not close. After 2 hours of fruitless conversation on the phone, I sent the camera back.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Nina
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of in-depth reviews available, so I'll keep mine short and sweet.This is my 3rd Canon camera of the digital elph line over the span of four years.I used this camera for two days and I couldn't be more disappointed. It's in the box on it's way to being returned to Amazon.My issues:- The body is extremely flimsy plastic. The flaps (USB port, battery & SD card compartment) feel like they could fall off with the slightest bit of pressure.- The arrow on the toggle between auto, manual and video mode is difficult to see in low light.- The autofocus on the camera is terrible, even when using the half-press to focus technique. At least half of my pictures came out blurry the first time. (Defect?)- The white balance on automatic mode doesn't work. Most of my pictures had a yellowish tint.- The flash is so bright that it whites out colors and facial featuresI compared my photos to a friends photos taken using their new Samsung TL 220 camera. While mine were washed out and blurry, their photos were beautiful and crisp. For a few dollars more, it seems like an obvious choice.

Reviews.Title: Canon is always good
Reviews.Author: Kerry C. Fitzgibbons
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for a former Canon point and shoot.  I would have bought the same camera again, but it has been made obsolete by production needs.  This camera frankly is not as good as the one it is replacing; it has fewer features. While it is smaller and more compact, it does not have the range of options for exposures nor does it have the ease of use as the previous generation.  The price was right and the features could be better.  Nevertheless, it has the predictable canon quality.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Spicy
Reviews.Content: Camera works beautifully, especially in lowlight. Its also fast between shots and has lots of functions for the serious photographer.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD1300IS
Reviews.Author: Merlin808
Reviews.Content: Overall, a very sturdy digital POS camera built to the same standards that I've become accustomed to with Canon products.  This is our fifth overall Canon digital camera and second POS and I've noticed no drop off in quality.  Excellent camera and I would recommend it to those who require a compact digital camera but who seek comparable digital photographs with the high end Canon EOS line.

Reviews.Title: Great little digital camera
Reviews.Author: snoshow "snoshow"
Reviews.Content: This camera is extremely easy to use and produces great pictures under all conditions.  Excellent choice for those who don't wish to invest a lot of time in learning intricacies of digital cameras.  We use it for routine picture taking indoors and outdoors.  Canon PowerShot SD1300IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue)

Reviews.Title: Great, Great, Great
Reviews.Author: Lena Hamilton "Lena"
Reviews.Content: Takes great up close pictures, it shows all the texture in an object. great flash, great zoom quality. What more can I say?WEll. the only thing not to love is that  when you are taking an action shot in normal camera mode, its probably not the camera you would want to take the picture with.I was unsure of my purchase when i ordered it, but after about 3 weeks with it, theres no reason i would ever consider another camera. I use it for everything!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Terry Wolf
Reviews.Content: Purchased two of these for my daughters. They both love this camera. The camera was recommended by Consumer Reports. Takes very good pictures and fun to use. Have had good luck with other Canon digital cameras for years. Easy to hold and use of the controls.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for my underwater housing.
Reviews.Author: DesertRat
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived as promised and was in the condition that was stated in the description. I look forward to using the camera in my underwater housing.

Reviews.Title: Bought it again
Reviews.Author: MS FACS teacher
Reviews.Content: I am a teacher and wanted to have a camera at school to capture the special moments.  I had to purchase a new camera when one of my kids dropped this camera on the floor and I decided to stay with the same camera because I never had any problems with it and it takes good pictures.  Less than 30 days after I purchased this camera another kid, who,had no permission to even have the camera in his hands, dropped and broke the camera.  This time I purchased a different model and won't let any kid touch my camera.  One thing I did learn as I reflected about how I could have a second broken camera in less than 30 days is that this camera is a bit slippery and if kids are trying to hold it is is hard for them to grasp it well.  S if you have kids that use the camera you might want to have them wear a strap with the camera so that if it falls when they are trying to take a picture it will not fall to the floor and bend the camera lens.  If the lens gets bent the camera is shot!

Reviews.Title: 4 years later and still going strong!
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in 2008 and have used it a pretty good amount since then. I'm not a photographer nor am I looking to become one. I just wanted a small-ish camera that would take good family/friend/event pictures. This camera hasn't given me any problems. I don't think I've actually changed any settings except for changing to the "party/indoor", "kids" and "scenic" settings. I don't see that much of a difference from the default setting, but either way the pictures are really nice. When people see the pictures they always ask what kind of camera and remarking on how well the pictures came out. While that is nice, it really passes the test because I'm happy with how they came out, faces are really never blurry (except when I move around alot.... I'm fidgety) and the light and colors seem to be right.If you're looking for a camera you don't have to get too involved with to get really nice pictures, I'd recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Works well. It's not perfect, but it works.
Reviews.Author: T. Chu
Reviews.Content: It's a point and shoot, so don't expect DSLR quality out of this camera. It works well enough for the price and the size, and it came in a pretty pastel blue color. That's all I ask for.The pictures come out a bit white and filmy so I always have to raise the contrast after loading them into my phone. Other than that it's not a big issue. Picasa can easily fix it most of the time. Maybe there's a white balance setting on the camera that I messed up on, but I haven't found it yet.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Syrena_P
Reviews.Content: I love this little thing, I've had it since my China trip last year and it's still like new, I couldn't do without it.

Reviews.Title: As expected and dependable
Reviews.Author: john c
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend it .Easy and fun to use .this is my fourth camera.Fits in your shirt pocket.

Reviews.Title: Nice basic camera
Reviews.Author: Lara
Reviews.Content: This camera is light and makes great basic pictures. A very good point and shoot. I enjoy the ability to also record short clips. Nice colors. Not excellent in low lighting conditions, but better than expected for its class.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 18 months ago to take with me on a trip overseas. I was looking for a low priced camera so that I wouldn't be too worried if it got stolen, that also took decent pictures, had good battery life so that I wouldn't need to hold back with picture taking and that was also reasonably compact.The price is obviously pretty good. I'm not a photography expert, but for this price range I was very happy with the picture quality. Sometimes in low light the camera has trouble focusing properly. But I was mostly taking pictures outside during daytime and so that was quite rare for me. The colour in the picture almost always came out very accurately for what was being photographed (some cameras seem to produce pictures that are more yellow than the object appears in real life, for example... this camera seemed very accurate with colour). Sometimes in low light, I find that the camera modifies the amount of light captured so that the picture comes out looking more light than it actually was. This made the scene a little unnatural looking to me. I solved this by pointing and focusing the camera on a lighter area, and then pointing the camera at the object I actually want to photograph before taking the picture. I found this to be a good solution, and for a low priced camera, I am happy to concede a small fault like that. You have fairly limited control over the picture. However, I found the camera's automatic controlling of all of the parameters to produce a quite good picture about 98% of the time. It also meant that I could take many pictures spontaneously. I think this is a great "point and shoot" camera.I was very happy with the battery life! I think I averaged about 400+ pictures per charge, at full resolution. I kept the flash off all of the time because I think that most flash produces an unnatural looking picture. This would have helped battery life. I took this camera into the arctic circle during February and got more than 800 shots from a single charge. Maybe the cold conditions helped this?This camera has also held together well. I don't think I have ever dropped it, but it has experienced some use in heavy rain and fairly heavy use (average of about 100 shots per day) for about six months. It's still working perfectly and I've noticed no reduction in battery performance. The buttons don't feel like they have worn down in any way.For the price I think this is a great camera and I have been very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for only one year, and only used it occasionally. It was working yesterday, and although I did not drop it or bump it or get dust into it, now the lens will not go back into the body, and just makes a beeping noise and shows "lens error" when I try to turn it on.

Reviews.Title: My iPhone 4 Camera is better
Reviews.Author: Athlonnx
Reviews.Content: I previously had a Nikon point and shoot camera.  The picture quality was acceptable, but it was extremely slow.  So I decided to get a Cannon camera instead.Normally, a person can rely on Amazon reviewers and get a good results.  Oddly, this does not appear to be the case with cameras.  Most reviewers stated that the Nikon camera I had purchased was great, but most of the good reviews failed to mention how extremely slow that camera was in taking a picture.So I looked that this camera, the 1300IS, at the store.  The camera turned on quickly and took the picture very quickly too.  It seemed like a good camera so I bought it from here, Amazon, as it was on sale for around $110 at the time.I was in Las Vegas yesterday.  I tried taking pictures of my family while there.  I was surprised that the camera was so slow, as it had been real quick at the store.  It seems that when focusing on faces / people, the camera slows because it tries to focus.  So I took out my iPhone 4 (not even a 4s), and noticed that the iPhone was far quicker at focusing.  Worse, the quality of the shots from my iPhone was far superior to that of the 1300IS.Some have predicted the end of point and shoot cameras because of smartphones.  I'm beginning to think that perhaps the predictions are true.  I'm reading that the S95 is an awesome camera, but it's $300, and only shoots video at 720p.  I can get a whole laptop for that kind of money.....

Reviews.Title: Slow to focus, miss so many shots
Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to replace an older model (five years old) that stopped working. We miss the old model! This camera is so slow to focus, and slow to photograph. Even when pressing the button halfway to focus, it will still sometimes take three to four seconds before the shutter snaps. It is so frustrating! We have a toddler and have missed so many shots since getting this camera. After just a few months, we are now on the lookout for a new camera. :(

Reviews.Title: Sound Memo
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: I've owned several of the Powershot models and have enjoyed attaching 'sound memo's' to my pictures. The SD 100 and 1000 had that capability, but the SD 1300 does not. I've contacted Canon and they indicate all their current models do not have 'sound memo' capabilty.....A feature I will miss.

Reviews.Title: Great While It Lasted
Reviews.Author: Alleexm
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in brown about a year ago as a replacement for my SD1000. It was everything I expected from an Elph.However, after about a year, the camera got a permanent lens error, for seemingly no reason. (Usually lens errors occur when something obstructs the lens when it tries to extend, and they're usually easily fixable. This was not the case.)Canon said it would cost $130 to repair/replace, because it was one month out of its warranty. Rather than replace it, I bought an SX230 HS instead. I was very disappointed with how long the camera lasted, especially with good treatment.If you ignore the lens error issue, here are my pros/cons:PROS-Small & Portable-Reasonable Battery Life (One charge was probably enough for an hour of mid-quality footage.)-Good Video, visually-ISO up to 3200-Wide Angle Lens-Good color & Resolution-Great Macro-Inexpensive-Easy to navigateCONS-Sound in video mode is muffled-Bad in low light for video, reasonable for stills-No manual shutter speed/aperture adjustment-Flash pictures took unpredictable amounts of time**-Permanent lens error malfunction**When flash was enabled, it would often be up to 10 seconds before the picture went off, leaving subjects awkwardly smiling for quite some time. It was also a pain to take carefully-timed photos, because other times it would take the photo almost instantly.Over all, this camera is great for anyone looking to take photos recreationally, or for someone like me who wanted a portable camera to take places just in case the perfect picture moment arose.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Ivette M. Johnson
Reviews.Content: This camera has been great for me, takes really nice pictures with little expertise required.  It damaged a couple of months after I had bought it and the Canon customer service was amazing me and repaired it under warranty.  I am really happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera... but lens is a problem
Reviews.Author: QuickReviewBuyer
Reviews.Content: We ended up with two of these cameras - one as a gift and the one we purchased on Amazon. Almost a year later the purchased here has a common problem where the lens wont pop out when powered on. After a bit of research on the web it seems this problem is not so uncommon. The camera takes decent pictures. I just the durability of the camera should be better. I'll look for another product next time around.

Reviews.Title: 9 months.
Reviews.Author: Sull.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item via Amazon and the camera doesn't have a serial number on the bottom. This seems weird? Or is it standard for buying through Amazon for some reason?Anyway, I've had it for 9 months and despite my not having dropped it or anything I took a picture, hit the playback button to view it, and received a lens error. The lens will not shut. When I click the power button it continues to tell me that there is a Lens Error and that I need to restart. I can't even request a repair via Canon because there's no serial number. This is very disappointing. I guess for $14 per month I shouldn't be too sad, but it's still a drag to have to get a new camera after only 9 months. Meh.

Reviews.Title: Powershot SD1300 IS
Reviews.Author: photocrazy
Reviews.Content: It's an inexpensive camera but it takes GREAT photos. I had one before but I lost it, and instead of 'upgrading' and getting a newer model, I hunted it down on the internet (since it is discontinued) and ordered the exact same camera. It was totally worth it. Now that I know it's discontinued, I take great care of it and hope it will last me for a very long time.

Reviews.Title: Simply Perfect
Reviews.Author: Juan Fernando Ortiz Gomez "info@juanFortiz.com"
Reviews.Content: I can not ask for anything else for my money, nice, lighweight, battery lasts longer than most models, perfect pictures with vivid colors, very good resolution, video and many more features you can imagine.  The camera is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: Horrible lens
Reviews.Author: alecovic40
Reviews.Content: I would like to tell you this camera is not worth it. I had a canon before and it worked great I got this camera for my wife and six months after purchasing it stopped working because of the lens.

Reviews.Title: Yet Another Quality Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Amanda Stempson
Reviews.Content: I love my blue Canon PowerShot SD1300. I bought it last fall to replace my older Canon PowerShot SD450, which had lasted me five years until I inadvertently smashed it while being attacked by a bee at the National Arboretum. The SD1300 has smart auto settings, but also makes it easy to quickly adjust custom settings. The low light setting is particularly impressive. And, I love the 12.1 MP. I was a little nervous about not having a viewfinder, but getting rid of that makes for a much larger digital display, and I find I don't miss it at all.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for Beginners
Reviews.Author: Julia
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera!  I bought it a few months ago and I've really liked it.  I was also really impressed since I'm not very good with cameras, so if you are a beginner or just want a camera that takes really good pictures without needing much skill, then I'd recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jacob Z
Reviews.Content: This is a great, affordable point-and-shoot. It takes great pictures, the screen is big and bright, the battery life is excellent, and it's very compact and simple to use. Buy it.

Reviews.Title: I am still puzzeled, but the fact is this camera is not for me.
Reviews.Author: G. Hatos
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for about 10 months now and I did everything to like it. I am a big Canon camera (small cameras) fan. My all-time favorite was the SD10 model. That little thing did most often probably accidently, but never the less gorgeous panoramic photos. Unfortunately it broke and for replacement I bought the SD 1300is. The camera suits me just about every way:  size, operation, good looking, great buttery life, etc. My only complaint is that I can't make great panoramic pictures. I have tied every setting that the camera offered, and yet the images all came out acceptable the best.  On the opposite close and micro images are fantastic. For example I made picture of a bee sitting on a flower as the wind blowing like crazy and the image came out pristine clear. Awesome, yet I am incapable to make decent picture of a scenic view. It seems the focus is all over. I can't say the image is blurry, but kind of washed and boring if I may say that. My final decision to abandon this camera came after we have visited a beautiful rocky site and my wife and I both took pictures. She was using an old Apple iPhone 2G camera that I believe takes 2 or less MB images. Her pictures came out fantastic. The color, the sunset, unbelievable. The couple of hundreds that I took with the SD 1300is none one came out great. I can't still believe Canon would produce such a poor camera, but the fact speaks. I am on the search another camera and this time I am open to other brands.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures but Killed by a Grain of Sand!
Reviews.Author: GSK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a 5-week backpacking trip with our brand-new Cannon. On week 3 of our trip (and the 3rd week the camera had been out of the box) we went to a beach in Italy one evening to take pictures and suddenly- LENSE ERROR. The lense came out part-way and stopped and the camera turned off. No more camera for the rest of the trip!  When we got home we were told that it was most likely a grain of sand that got into the lense mechanism. Cannon was very sorry but lense errors are not covered under their 1-year warrantee and it was going to cost more to fix it than we bought it for! Very disappointing since it took great pictures!! Now we have no camera and are out $150.

Reviews.Title: Very dissapointed...
Reviews.Author: Adam B Asherson
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth Canon point and shoot, but it did not compare with previous models. This camera is essentially built to sell at a price point.The features are very limited (it has far fewer preset modes than other Canons)The color is not a vibrantThe photos are softMany photos are out of focusAfter 6 months of ownership I sold it on ebay and replaced with a Canon S95 - at $399 it's expensive, but 1 great shot will last a lifetime...The new 300/500 series and the sd4000 are definitely leagues above the SD1300 as well...In short, spend an extra $50-$250 and get a really good Canon...

Reviews.Title: Fabulous!
Reviews.Author: Addicted-to-books
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  I'm taking pictures and they look like professional shots!  The clarity is unbelievable.  I love the focusing feature.  If you are just looking for a point and shoot camera then let this be your baby!  You will find yourself taking pictures of everything because its so easy and they come out beautifully!.

Reviews.Title: Great camera! Perfect conditon.
Reviews.Author: liz
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with the camera. It's in perfect condition and came with a bunch of accessories it wouldn't normally have. It's lightweight and has great shutter speed for a point-and-shoot. Shipped quickly, too! Thanks for everything.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Tita K. Tucker
Reviews.Content: So far this camera is living up to the description. Battery life is good. It takes good pictures and videos. I have only had it a month. I bought it to replace my Canon SD1100IS in which drained the batteries after a few pictures. I am hoping this one doesn't do the same thing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: David R. Smythe
Reviews.Content: This is not an old style camera (35mm, 4x5, etc) with which I am familiar and I found the shutter only "clicks" after a few seconds, which takes a little getting used to. However, the pictures are excellent and the quality of the camera is also excellent. I read, sporadically, through the manual and explained it to my (teenage) daughter and we took the camera on a vacation to Hawaii. My daughter was in charge of pictures so I ended up with pictures of feet, sidewalks, and stairs, among other "not really interesting items," but the camera also took pictures fabulously at Diamond Head, Pearl Harbor, North Shore, and the Dole Plantation. It is light-weight, easy to charge, the software works well, and I had no problem printing the pictures I actually kept. I am very satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product - Canon PowerShot SD1300IS 12.1 MP DC
Reviews.Author: Linda Skellenger
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD1300IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Green)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: lara zintsmaster
Reviews.Content: I waited a few months to write this review and it looks like the camera has gone up in price a bit. I still feel it's a great value for all it has to offer even at the current price though. I've been a fan of Canon for years, I've had previous PowerShots and my husband has an SLR he uses and loves. He is a concert photographer, so I am not lacking in photos around the house but too often we miss great opportunity for pictures of US, or landscape/not bands - and I needed to get myself a "basic point and shoot" to get the shots I want.This is an excellent point and shoot and goes beyond the basics, bringing diversity, high functionality and great quality shots at a fair price. You can go with the automatic feature, which takes all the guesswork out of a great shot, or you can throw it into manual mode and choose your own settings.Being an avid music fan myself, I go to a large number of music shows where low light mashes with bright stage lights. I have used both the camera and video features on this camera at such shows and I couldn't be happier.My favorite things about this camera:- Rarely need the flash in low light. This is a great feature because many bands don't permit flash, or at least are visibly irritated when people are flashing them every five minutes. Also prevents that washed out look that a flash can bring out.- Video picture AND sound quality are excellent, and work well in low light as well. With my previous (highly outdated PowerShot), the video sound was often muffled, with lots of noise. This is not the case with the PowerShot SD1300IS.- I love how small it is! Great for stashing in your pocket or throwing in your purse/glove compartment in case you come across a great photo opp at the farmer's market or driving down the road.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: thukuntrygrl
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect camera for random photoshoots.  It's small and fits in the cell phone pocket of any woman's purse (a big plus for me).  It also very easy to use and very fast!  If you're looking for a camera that's not complicated, but takes excellent quality pictures, this is it!!

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the Price
Reviews.Author: Ronn R. Yarbrough "Captain Ronn"
Reviews.Content: For a point and shoot, this is a great camera.  Very crisp pictures; even when zoomed to the max.  Easy to operate.  Battery life seems to be quite acceptable.  Nice sized LCD screen. Nice small size and weight.  Even in a carrying case, it easily slips into a pocket.Would purchase it again.

Reviews.Title: Prefect Camera for me.....
Reviews.Author: DALLAS JACKSON
Reviews.Content: The SD 1300 IS AN EXCELLENT CAMERA DOES ALL THAT IT SAID, TAKES QUALITY PICTURES, ALWAYS CLEAR AND EASY TO FOCUS.  I LIKE THAT IT COMES WITH A USB CORD THAT YOU CAN ATTACH TO YOUR PC AND IT BRINGS UP ALL THE PICTURES THAT YOU TOOK.. I REALLY LIKE THAT SPECIAL FEATURE. COMPACT AND EASY TO CARRY AROUND. I LIKE THE CHOICE THAT I MADE WHEN I PURCHASED THE CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Basic Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: laurieloo
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that gets great candid shots of people places and things; very general use. I have been using this in auto mode and it takes awesome pictures. I was pretty much sold on this one when I saw the example shots posted on this site and I am getting the same fantastic results.Program mode is so basic but still has very useful options such as a white balance evaluator. I have no opinion on the video, I don't use it.The quality of build is less than what I expected, and I'm glad I only paid $110 (It's on close out at one of the Marts, sorry Amazon). Despite the looks, it still feels solid and what really matters is whats inside anyway.I was looking at the newer sleeker sexier elph models and ones with more features like fish-eye effect (really?) but none compared to the beautiful life like results I get with the 1300. In this case newer/more is not better, and I'm really glad I got this model before it sold out.

Reviews.Title: Out-of-Pocket and In-Pocket Friendly
Reviews.Author: L.G.C.
Reviews.Content: Canon puts out great products.  This camera is no exception.  I could not believe how low the cost was.  I'm capturing all of my first-born's best work.  It has incredible power and quality packaged in a very small bundle.  The battery life is also amazing.  I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: augsmom
Reviews.Content: It works well for capturing kids on the move!  I bought this for a trip where we would be both inside and outside.  Sometimes the first capture of the picture can be blurry but you just need tobe aware of adjusting the flash acording to where you are.  Overall I think its sturdy yet compact and a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: A Very good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: David Zalkovsky
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give my wife a camera that would take quality pictures and, yet, do the occasional movie of the grand kids.  This camera does all of that very well.The optics are very good for the price.One of the aspects of a camera like this is when you playback sound using the camera, it is less than meager.  However, when you play it back from a computer or playback device, it is quite good.  Also, you need to try different automatic camera settings to get the one that works best for you.  For example, setting the ISO to 200 is a good move for us.Would recommend this camera for anyone to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: AMAZNshopper
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesistent on purchasing the pink Cannon powershot because there are so many different shades of pink. When I got it (which was very quick) it completely matched the color in the picture! A frosting color pink.I am a faithful Cannon powershot camera buyer and I knew this one would be just as good as my others. And it is.Takes great pictures, near and far! A very nice size screen to view pictures and very clear! If you are thinking about getting this camera....do it! You will love it!

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: D "D"
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on my last cruise vacation and it was easy to carry around because it small and you can pull it out at any moment. The settings work great and the picture quality is amazing. It looks like you took the pictures with an slr camera. Stunning quality. Tried another canon camera the 14megapixel one, and this beats it for. Sure and is cheaper which is a bonus. I would def recommend it if your looking for a simple digital camera, that can do advanced photos with little effort.

Reviews.Title: Great price, easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: ACB883
Reviews.Content: After researching various digital cameras around the same price point, I am extremely happy with my purchase. The functions are all very easy to use and easy to navigate and set. The large display screen is also a great feature. It is light weight, compact and exactly what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: R. Reese
Reviews.Content: This has been a great camera at a great price. I have mainly used the automatic settings and everything has turned out very nice and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Very nice and cheap camera
Reviews.Author: Martano
Reviews.Content: Great for everything.I'm a Nikon DSLR fan. I have all my stuff form this brand, but when I want to purchase a point and shoot camera always choose a Canon one.You get a low price camera with great caracteristics.I found some indoors pics with a blur, but I can think that was my fault and not the camera.Easy camera software. Easy to setup.Good batery lifeVery well manufacturedGreat macroI like it so much

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: purple
Reviews.Content: This camera was actually a gift for my daughter-in-law, not purchased for myself. She absolutely loves it. The color is so pretty, which she loved...and the pictures taken with it @ Mardi Gras were great!I would have to say this was a very wise purchase and I would order it again.

Reviews.Title: Good enough
Reviews.Author: NB
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap camera to capture my children in everyday situations. This camera works just fine for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: Going digital
Reviews.Author: Stormy
Reviews.Content: New concept to me but am amazed at the versatility of this little camera.  Still learning all it is capable of doing (or should I say what I can make it do)?  Having lots of fun taking pictures of everything in my world.Love this product and am glad I chose this one.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!
Reviews.Author: Melissa G
Reviews.Content: Finally, a point and shoot camera that takes quality pictures. I've had a Kodak Easy Share and a Nikon Coolpix; neither of them have come close to this Canon. This past weekend is the first time since buying this camera that I've had the opportunity to use it and I wasn't disappointed at all. The small size is very convenient for carrying in my purse. I also bought a carrying case to protect it from scratches. The price was another plus. I recommend this camera to everyone!

Reviews.Title: So far it's very good
Reviews.Author: Geddy
Reviews.Content: I haven't had much time to play with the new camera, but so far I'm very impressed.  It's so much better than our old one!  I love the large screen, the auto-focus, and the easy to use controls.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: D. Cockburn
Reviews.Content: Ive always like cannon products, and this point and shoot camera does not disappoint me! it has a sleek and cute look and is so small i can even fit it in a small clutch. It is very simple to use and the photo qualities are great! though it did not come with a flash card, you can buy it anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Fast, Easy, High Quality Point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: Lucas J. Mcmurray
Reviews.Content: I had been searching around for a few months for the perfect point and shoot when I found this gem. I searched reviews on amazon, Cnet, etc and just couldn't find a big difference between similar products. I went to Costco, Best Buy and Target to test out the products and still couldn't decide. Then, one miraculous sunny Friday afternoon, this camera went down to $98 and I bought it on the spot. Not only was this a great purchase for the price, but it turned out to be the best camera I could have purchased. I've tried this camera out in low light, fast-moving, and night-time exposures and have loved the quality of every picture. The video recording is great as well. Best of all, this camera is incredibly easy to use! And it fits easily in my pocket. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Taylor
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my sister and I set it up for her before giving it and I took a few test pictures.VERY NICE, I was quite jealous and wanted to keep it for myself.

Reviews.Title: Cannon SD1300 pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: This compact camera performs very well.  It is small enough to occupy a pocket of my Levi jeans while I spend the day working on our ranch here in the Sierra foothills of Calaveras County.  I find it most convenient and always ready--it has gotten a lot of use in the last two or three weeks.  It further performs admirably for either still shots or for videw recording of my guard dogs and goat herd.Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: A great product!
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Thanks a lot for the reviews. I purchased this item and really like it. I would like to recommend it to others. A+

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1300IS
Reviews.Author: Mommy Tham
Reviews.Content: Just bought this camera recently to bring on our vacation.  Loved it!  It was easy to carry around and whip out to take pictures.  Love that it automatically focuses and finds people's faces to photograph.  Can switch to video as well to record those special moments.  I would recommend this camera for those people that wants an easy camera to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS
Reviews.Author: MELANIE
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at the last minute for an European vacation to London, Paris and Rome.  I mainly purchased because of the price.  The price was unbeatable at the time of purchase for a Canon camera of any kind after checking Walmart and Best Buy's websites.  I work in Iraq so there was no way I could shop around too much and I had to make a quick decision.This is the very first digital camera that I have owned because most people's pictures that I have seen from digital camera's were not that great but I was so EXTREMELY SATISFIED with the quality of the photo's and ease of the use of the camera that when I returned back to Iraq I have not stop raving about this camera.  I was in Europe for a total of 12 days and in those 12 days I took almost 500 pictures and the reason is because the camera did EVERYTHING all I had to do was point and shoot.  It's funny because my cousin took along with him this expensive camera that took horrible pictures day and night so he ended up just getting copies of my almost 500 pictures to create his photo album.The CANON POWERSHOT is absolutely fabulous and I would endorse this camera anytime.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot SD1300 IS
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a Pocket Camera, to take that unexpected shot. I have a larger Cannon Camera, that I am very happy with, but it is a bit too big to carry at all times. This little camera has a lot going for it in a small package, I can really recomend it. A really good small camera and a small price, what more could you want!

Reviews.Title: Lovely Point-and-Shoot
Reviews.Author: MimeyNaomi
Reviews.Content: Most important: this camera works great in low lighting without a flash.  I can use it indoors, at night, with only lamplight and no tripod, with better than decent results for a point-and-shoot.  Other advantages: a very quick power up/power down makes it easy to whip out and have at the ready in a few seconds.  Perfect size, shape, and button configuration, easy to use.  Battery holds a VERY long charge.  A+.

Reviews.Title: Camera surprised me
Reviews.Author: Lucy Sotar
Reviews.Content: I have a slight tremor in my hand.  Consumer Reports rated this camera well for avoiding shaking.  It worked!  My pictures came out fine and the camera is easy to use.I do wish something had been said when buying this that one needed a battery. I almost didn't get to take pictures of my grandchildren till we went to the store.

Reviews.Title: great camera, good quailty shots, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Nancy Jo Mitchell
Reviews.Content: This is our second Canon Powershot - it's a great camera, and takes shots that are equal to my Canon EDS, I love the option to take movies with it - excellent qualilty, and easy.

Reviews.Title: Good product good price
Reviews.Author: Caribbean girl
Reviews.Content: I just needed a camera to replace my lost sony and this one just fit the bill and my pocket. For non professional photographers like myself this is easy to use, cute (I got the blue a nice change from my every- piece- of -equipment-I-own- silver) has very decent battery life and takes crystal clear photos with a nice zoom.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD1300IS
Reviews.Author: David Kono
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot, light weight and very sturdy case.  Buttons are a little too close together, but for the price and ease of use, there is no comparison.

Reviews.Title: a great camera for anything
Reviews.Author: UUS
Reviews.Content: this camera was he perfect present i gave to a girl who loves to take pictures of everything who also loves to mess with in photoshop and she loves it alot so i think this camera is great for any pictures and sending them to computers and other devices

Reviews.Title: Neat camera
Reviews.Author: Karyl "luvinarlington"
Reviews.Content: I love having a camera with me wherever I go so I can capture my kids' antics for pictures and making Smileboxes.  Canon Elph is a dream. We have this model, as well as the 1100 and I love them both.  I love how I can stick it in my pocket, capture special moments, both with video and still photos. Pictures always turn out great and it's so easy to upload photos to our Macbook, as well as to Smilebox for making slideshows for the grandparents.  Best little camera around, although I am super loyal to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Cool Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Cindyme
Reviews.Content: Had a PowerShot before and lost it.  I am glad to get this new one which looks great in blue.  Came with only Spanish manual, but I am using the manual from the old camera.  Works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Gift Card Reciepient "Amature Photographer"
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur photographer that uses a Canon Rebel XTI and various interchangable lenses. I bought this for my wife as her old point & Shoot broke. I am pleasantly surprised by the quality of the pictures and ease of use. I actually have used it on occasion when I don't want to carry my bigger camera with me. It obviously does not do nearly what the bigger more expensive camera's can do but for the price you absolutely can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Picture's worth 1000 words...
Reviews.Author: S. Gould "gouldpjaks"
Reviews.Content: I have always preferred Canon camera's in the digital age. I purchased my first Canon Elph many years ago and finally decided that it was time to try the newer version. My sd1000 has 7.1 megapixels, no IS and a 2.5 inch LCD screen. This newer sd1300 has 12.1 megapixels, IS and a 2.7 inch LCD. What they share is Canon quality and design. The 1300 is small enough to take anywhere, feels good in your hand, is well made and easy to use.The most important aspect of any camera is the quality of the pictures it takes. In my opinion, with current technology, most cameras out there today will deliver quality photos in bright light. Dim to dark conditions separate the real producers from the pack. Most small cameras do not have the ability to focus well in the dark. The tiny flash cannot create good enough light to capture great photos. This elph has really got what it takes.I attended my cousin's Bar Mitzvah. It was held in an attrctively decorated, large but dark room and everyone was in constant motion on the dance floor. My photos will tell you why I stick with Canon--see photos.That said, this is still a compact camera and will not deliver what my DSLR can. If I need to shoot rapidly or in raw mode I will use a better camera but for its size and price this is a great addition to my collection.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had my camera for about a month. Still haven't mastered it but so far most of the pictures I've taken are great. They are clear and crisp...I have to admit the blurry ones are mainly due to user error. The speed between shots is fantastic, which is great for taking sequential shots.I have to say I love this camera :)

Reviews.Title: Really good and handy
Reviews.Author: Mindika Dharmabandu
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a small camera with good features and need to be able to handle very Easily. This is the one to buy. it is small and easy to carry and handle very well when I need to take a quick photo. It done has a problem when taking pics of faraway things. But that is not the reason you're getting this, this is a good one to take close pics, quickly.Like I said. it all depends on what you need to do this the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: I luv Gadgets
Reviews.Content: I bought 8 of these for my staff when they were on sale for $100 or so and they all love them.  You can;t beat it.  12.1 mpixel for $100.00.  Features are rich, its fast, portable, sleak, need I say more.

Reviews.Title: Great for  travel
Reviews.Author: Gen
Reviews.Content: This camera is ideal for traveling.  It is small, easy to work with and gives good pictures.  I have a purse that holds a cell phone and this fit into that pocket perfectly so it was at my fingertips where I could get it quickly if I saw something I wanted to get a picture of.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I hoped for!
Reviews.Author: Natalie M. Scelsa "thisandnat"
Reviews.Content: I love the big screen!! I wish these screens had some sort of scratch proofing but I haven't found that with ANY camera on the market at this quality and price. Great buy though and takes great pics!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: G. Horner "Mother of two"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our 8 year old son for a Christmas present.  He was able to take great pictures with it right out of the box! (We'd charged it ahead of time.)  He captured some wonderful photos of our Christmas morning with it.  He was able to figure the camera out on his own and has thoroughly enjoyed it.  The quality of the photos is wonderful.  I would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking to buy a decent camera at this price point!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the Price
Reviews.Author: Abhishek Koundal "AK"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera on good deal of ~90$ compared to market price of 179$. Camera look and feel is nice. Its small factor makes is easy to slide in your pocket. The new advanced auto feature is nice, i took the night shots inside the house in party and Its a BIG change/improvement from the IS780(~4yr old). I didn't select any mode and auto focus was able to capture the moments with good colors. I have to say that I surely felt the lag time when using the flash, its ~2-3sec delay time before you can take the next photo. I haven't tried the camera outside yet and I bet on the sunny day, it will take nice crisp photos. I haven't any bad reviews yet for this model and for the price i paid for the camera even if there is noise @ higher ISO i don't mind.It doesn't have HDMI out, which i would have liked but still the video is of good quality.If you are looking for a point and shoot in the market, this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Very nice!
Reviews.Author: Darrin Tracy
Reviews.Content: I have always loved the Cannon SD series of digital cameras.  This one is small, easy to operate, and takes high quality pictures!  I bought it for a trip to Santa Fe and Taos, NM and it came in very handy.  Much better than taking pictures with my phone!

Reviews.Title: Loyal Canon Fan
Reviews.Author: S. Mathes
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd digital camera, first one wore out.  I read and read reviews on several cameras in this category and this price range then narrowed it down to 2, Canon Powershot SD1300IS and the Nikon Coolpix S3000.  Decided on the Canon, very happy with my camera, still learning all that it can do.  Liked that it came with a free picture card, also glad that I don't have to buy anymore batteries, the charger with the battery is great.  Glad the av cable came with the camera as well, Nikon did not offer that with the S3000.  Will do an update after I take more pictures and learn more things about this nifty little camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Roland Kissoon "Rolls"
Reviews.Content: I went back and forth between buying this and the nikon coolpix which was a few dollars less. both had similar reviews, but decided to go with canon since I already have a canon DSLR and I'm extremely pleased with it.The camera is smaller than I anticipated, but that was a pleasant surprise.It feels solid and well built; I'm comparing  to a vivitar digital that I bought for my 4 year old to play with. But for 3 times the price, I expected nothing less.The pics are very crisp and clear - no complaints. Videos are decent, but is VGA quality, if this is important to you, spring for the higher model which costs about $70 dollars more: you get 14.2 megapixels, wide angle lens and HD video. I just wanted a good point and shoot camera, so went with this model as it supplements my DSLR well.I was uneasy with the Li-ion battery as my personal preference is AAA or AA which I can recharge/replace myself anywhere, but I went ahead and bought a second battery which I will take along with me, so that solves that issue.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot 12 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Rittenhouse "Book lover"
Reviews.Content: My picky son in law went on line to check out the reviews for this camera as I wanted to give it as a Christmas present to my granddaughter.  He wanted to make sure it was appropriate for a young photo enthusiast.  She loved the color and the way it changes from a vertical picture on the view finder to a horizontal one by just turning the camera.  She was delighted and enchanted.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
Reviews.Author: Michelle
