Reviews.Content: I gave to my son for Christmas and he LOVES this camera. It does lots of diffrent things, and I will buy myself one soon.  Great camera..

Reviews.Title: It is worthwhile!
Reviews.Author: Boya
Reviews.Content: Given the priceC it is a worthwhile product.Good shape, smart,and the picture it took is really good.The only thing is it only contains the basic function for picture, if you want a complex one, you should choose 1400 or superior one.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for a Teen
Reviews.Author: Nic
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this camera.  As a young teenager on the go, size and style were as important to her as anything.  I looked for quality and ease of use.  We made a great choice in the Canon PowerShot SD1300IS.  It met all of our requirements.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: coolandon
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and great pictures.  Battery also seems to last for a while and it was great that it comes with the charger and everything you need to get started.

Reviews.Title: Glad I bought a Canon Power Shot
Reviews.Author: M. Frey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my g'daughter for C'mas and she loves it. It's easy to use, has a great picture and she was very pleased with the color. Canon is an all around good product and deserves its good reputation.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't trade it for any other
Reviews.Author: MHC Apple "Apple"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera!  I've taken it to football games and were able to zoom in and take clear pictures, I've taken it to school concerts and was able to get in on my child.  The uploading is easy, carrying it around is very n ice, it stays with me at all times.  Nothing bad to say about it.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD1300 IS is Great
Reviews.Author: Steven Ono
Reviews.Content: I've had 3 other Canon Elf's in the past and have really liked them all. I've always loved the size and the ease of use. It's also super easy to download your images and video. Can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Don't Hesitate
Reviews.Author: Julie Mader
Reviews.Content: This style of camera was given to both of my daughters for Christmas and we are amazed by the clarity of photos, the quick response of the on button and the wonderful zoom lens. The fact that it also has video/sound ability just adds to the fun!  Luckily my birthday is in March because I would like to have the same camera for myself and I don't want to have to wait long for it :o)

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Someone or another
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift, and I am thrilled with it. With clear pictures, a sleek design, and some amazing features, I couldn't be more happy. However, I will admit it took a whole lot of fiddling around to figure out how to change all the settings until it was tweaked the way I like it. For example, the mute button is not exactly easily accessible, and if you want to click around and press as many buttons as I did, muting is a necessity. So, if you want a nice small point and shoot with high quality pictures and you have time to poke around and test out the different settings, I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Perfect pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Super Buyer
Reviews.Content: Great pictures! easy to use, perfect for even the least tech savey people.I got it as a gift when my baby was born, it's always in the diaper bag ready for the perfect picture moment.

Reviews.Title: best price
Reviews.Author: deborah dusseau
Reviews.Content: Amazon had the best price for this camera because it included a memory card and free shipping.  The camera is great and my daughter is thrilled

Reviews.Title: Great little camera .. overpriced on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Mark S. Spahr
Reviews.Content: Bought this nice little camera for my wife and have no complaints about the camera. It is small, light weight, and takes excellent pictures for a compact digital. I believe it is everything the average person  needs for great holiday and vacation snap-shots . It will be used on it's automatic settings 98% of the time and I am sure 9 out of 10 pictures with be just fine for us. So far I can tell you the photos taken are very nice and the video works well . My only dissapointment was when I bought this about 3 weeks before Christmas it immediately went on sale in every electronic store here for 20.00 less than Amazon merchants. I called Amazon and they told me there was no price guarantee and I would have to return it if I was dissatisfied . As Christmas was close and I was busy I did not return it. So, next year I will wait until the last possible minute to order electronics and try my local electronic stores FIRST ! In general Amazon is a good place to shop but you are not always getting the lowest prices. Camera A+  , Amazon B .

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: It is a perfect point and shot camera! Easy to use, good pictures and no hassel! Also, I bought it when it was on sale for $109..... WOWWW!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I Wanted
Reviews.Author: J. Slaker "OBXTrader.com"
Reviews.Content: Bought for my adult son as a Christmas gift and he has used it for 4 days straight with no problems.  Says it's exactly what he needed for a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Point-and-shoot pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Charles W. Weesner "cwwees"
Reviews.Content: Excellent point-and-shoot camera.  Small for pocket use.  The LiIon battery is unique, but lasts a long, long time.  Quite happy with Canon - chosen for short lag from pressing the button until shutter snaps.

Reviews.Title: best camera I have every owned!
Reviews.Author: Tova
Reviews.Content: BEST CAMERA EVER!!! VERY QUICK, CLEAR AND A VERY FLASHY COLOR!! I LOVEE IT!! AND I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA TO ANYONE!you will not regret getting this camera~

Reviews.Title: Great photos and reliability
Reviews.Author: B. Madison
Reviews.Content: This is the third of these cameras that I've bought for members of my family.  I love it.  It's extremely reliable, has great battery life, and produces awesome photos.  It's perfect for carrying around when you don't want to lug your SLR, but still want to get some photos.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Ivan Felix
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a few YEARS now and I have enjoyed every year! I bought this when it was not too expensive and it has been working great. My favorite qualities about it are the options it gives you for messing around with effects. The few problems I have come across is again its fragility. Because it is small it is an item you don't want to be carrying around from a string, it is something you are going to want to buy a little pouch for when you travel with it. IT is easy to use and I have used it for multiple occasions: birthdays at home, hiking trips and everything. IT works great, the quality is superb, and even its video taking capabilities should be applauded. All in all I am very impressed with this and hope others go out and see what I and many others here are talking about. For the price, this simply cannot be ignored. Oh and by the way, like someone else said, be sure to buy a pretty good memory card for your camera, as few come with one, or if they do its pretty small. Do yourself a favor and get yourself a good 1 gig or 2gig card so that when your camera arrives you will be able to enjoy it immediately.

Reviews.Title: Very happy customer.
Reviews.Author: Barney
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera that could take extreme close ups, this is that camera. An example, I sell on ebay and I had an item that I put on for $9.99, it went for 7 days without a bid. I used the Canon SD 1300 for some close ups and the same item went for $28.00 in the next auction. You bet I'm satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: Ahmad Taresh "A.S.A.T"
Reviews.Content: i love it,,its what i want when i go out with my family , very easy to use and perfect ...

Reviews.Title: Cute camera
Reviews.Author: Hemalatha Sundaramoorthi
Reviews.Content: It's handy and I like this shade of pink color very much. It gives picture clarity what a 12 MPx camera can do

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Jessica Gore
Reviews.Content: My parents got me this camera for Christmas after my SD1100 being stolen on vacation. I love it so far!!! It's so compact and cute. It is perfect for my needs. I am very interested in photography, but don't know a lot about it at this point. I am kind of using this as a learner camera before moving up to bigger and better Canons. I had Kodaks before my SD1100 and they were horrible!! I never had a problem out of my SD1100. I am looking forward to getting some real use out of the SD1300! So far I have only taken a few photos this morning, but all have came out to my liking! :)

Reviews.Title: A good, basic, ultracompact camera; very good value
Reviews.Author: E. Carbone
Reviews.Content: This camera, now available at not much over the $100 price point, is about as good a digital camera as one could possibly get for this amount of money. It is not a substitute for a higher end camera by any means, but at this price, it is well worth it if you need a basic point-and-shoot digital that's reliable and extremely compact. After all, what good is the mid-range or top-range camera that you haven't got with you when you need it???  This camera is very compact, can easily fit in a pocket, and is light. What makes this camera a winner is the overall combination of portability, ease of use, and good image quality.

Reviews.Title: Cute Camera
Reviews.Author: Illinois Mom
Reviews.Content: I have owned 3 of these now. Each year they get better. I liked the model before this one a little more, just because the blue casing was stronger metal. However, this one has more pixels and is lighter weight.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Noonan
Reviews.Content: Has all the features I was looking for in a pocket camera.In particular it will print the time/date which I think isabsolutely necessary.  My old camera, a Pentax would not printthe time/date!  It had a DPOF which nobody could develop witha time/date on the photo!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for an excellent price
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Johnson
Reviews.Content: Canon is known for high quality point and shoot digital cameras.  This one is no exception.  Right out of the box you can take great photos.  Once you get the settings as you want them shoot until your heart is content or until the memory card fills up.  Two complaints that are common with most point and shoots are small memory card that comes with and low light shot.  As I said that is a drawback with most of the low-end digital so I won't hold that against this one.  Having said that, great camera and even greater price.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera and it is easy to use.  Good quality of photos.  Recharger is really compact.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera is wonderful
Reviews.Author: bykrgrma
Reviews.Content: This little camera is great, it is beautiful and easy to work with.  Still things that I haven't explored but what I have are wonderful.  Picture clarity is great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Lucas Davenport "Lucas"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife as an Eid present.  She loves it, and has used it to take pictures of our newborn son.

Reviews.Title: Replaced my SD1000 and this takes gorgeous photos
Reviews.Author: JenniferZ
Reviews.Content: I also own a 30D slr camera and I love having this tiny camera with me all the time.  Very fast shooting and has a rapid shoot mode like my Canon 30D.  Very very pleased.  Great price! battery life rocks.

Reviews.Title: GF love's it
Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: So I got this camera for my girlfriend about 6 months ago, after about 2,000 photo's later I can say she love's it. It take's good pic's for the price and is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Really good camera!
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: It takes great photos, and has a lot of personalization options.  There are good photo settings, that allow more vibrant colors.  The screen is great.  There is zooming on video, which I love!  There are only a few negative aspects: the sound playback for videos is quite low!  Also, the focus can sometimes be blurry, so you always have to make sure it's in focus before taking a photo.  The pictures on the camera tend to be much better looking than on the computer :P  Might just be my computer though... lol.  The keys are kinda flimsy, but I don't see them breaking anytime soon.  Overall it was a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great Cam
Reviews.Author: LizzyB
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It is so light, so easy to navigate through, and takes great quality pics! The funky "green" color adds to my love of it :)

Reviews.Title: Nice Easy to Use Camera
Reviews.Author: AFL
Reviews.Content: I'm just a regular guy that wants an easy to use camera that takes high quality pictures and this camera gets the job done.  If you just leave it in "automatic" mode all you have to do is point and shoot, and you'll get very nice high quality pictures.  It also has an easy to use menu system if you want to get into it and make adjustments and refinements.  I also like the form factor - not too big, not too small, fits in a pocket, and feels good in your hands.  This is a great camera for a regular person that just wants good pictures without all the fuss.....

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: MUSICIAN FREAK
Reviews.Content: As a small camera it is a very good camera and takes nice photo I am not going to say it is like a big lens camera but it works greatI shoot beutifull photo of my kids with it

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: bleawil
Reviews.Content: I take a lot of pictures and have been 3 other cameras in the last 2 years.  My daughters have this and promised me I will like it and it will hold up for years.  Let's hope so

Reviews.Title: Super easy without reading a manual
Reviews.Author: Karen Faivre
Reviews.Content: My last camera was a Nikon Coolpix - until I dropped it! I needed something quick and easy and I was debating between another Nikon Coolpix and a Canon. I kept going back and forth. Since Amazon wouldn't ship a camera to my PO Box I had to buy it local. I was looking at both of them at Fred Meyer's and the clerk nudged me toward the Canon. I am very happy. I use iPhoto and Photoshop so I didn't bother loading their software and I was able to use the camera right out of the box (after I charged it, of course). I mainly use the camera for food photos on my blog. I no longer need to use Photoshop since the photos are clear and light. (My old images ALWAYS needed lightening in Photoshop.) I think there is a manual on the CD but who cares? I'm doing fine without it. When I want to improve my photos I guess I'll load the software and read the manual but until then everything is GREAT! I just point, focus, and click! I am love, love, loving it!

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Fat Dad
Reviews.Content: it's a good all-round camera. takes good pictures. wish canon still sold the old SD1000 though - doesn't seem to be a huge improvement on that.

Reviews.Title: A steathy point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Southern Pines Jarhead
Reviews.Content: I've used three Canon digital digital cameras over the last several years, and my new Powershot SD1300IS is the one that excites me the most.  I have been using a Powershot S5IS, but this new little guy, which I purchased for my wife initially, has become my favorite.  It's compactness and power house of features has made it the ideal camera for me.  Much of what is offered by the S5IS goes unused, but the features of the SD1300IS cover all of my needs, and are easier to use.  The results have been awesome, but to be fair, I have taken some awesome pictures with my S5IS. The compactness of the S1300IS is what makes it work as a point and shoot camera.  It fits handily in my pocket with room to spare, and people react differently to larger cameras with a more a negative effect on the results.  The smaller cameras are hardly noticed leading to a more candid feel about the results.  Maybe my wife will now have to order her own SD1300IS from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: ffdestroyer
Reviews.Content: This is my second compact digital camera and it is amazing! The image stabilizer really helps to keep my pics from being fuzzy and the other many options are easy to learn and understand. It really is a great camera for novice and intermediate-level photographers.

Reviews.Title: perfect in every way
Reviews.Author: S. M. Townsend "Arrowhead Steve"
Reviews.Content: We purchsed this camera for a trip to Buenos Aires. We wanted something small to fit in a pocket that would also take close up and panoramic pictures. I was worried that this camera did not have optical viewfinder but the LCD works great even in bright sunlight. The camera takes great pictures any time of day or night and close up or panoramic. No bluriness due to motion. Powers up quickly and battery holds a charge for an incredibly long time - even when using flash. We really like this camera. I would recommend to anyone who has a need similar to ours.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, smooth, sleek
Reviews.Author: manuscript_paper
Reviews.Content: This little camera is great - small and sleek, I take it everywhere with me. It easily fits in my pocket/clutch/purse. I like that it turns on and photographs quickly so when I need to capture something fleeting, I can.  That said, I'm no photographer, and the automatic features deliver great shots most of the time. I received this Canon on time and in mint condition. Overall, I had a great experience with this vendor and I'm please with my product : ) I recommend purchasing from them.

Reviews.Title: finally, i found another worthy camera
Reviews.Author: John Crim
Reviews.Content: man am i glad that i found this camera. i've been thru a few others trying to find one that would replace my old sd canon model, but i've been unhappy in all others i've tried.this one takes the cake. it has fast shot-to-shot times, takes excellent pics and is tiny! all the canon's i've had take good pics, but the biggest thing to me (with small kids) was the shot-to-shot times and this one works very well and i am very satisfied with it. and only $150 it is a great bargain as well!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Dr. Goetz K. Oertel "Goetz von Berlichingen"
Reviews.Content: This little Canon is surprisingly good at just about all except some advanced professional photography applications.  It's amazing that it all fits in such a handy and convenient package.  It has so many features that new ones seem to pop up regularly even after weeks of use.  Especially noteworthy to me is the fact that this camera worked so much better "out of the box" than the Canon A3100 IS 12.1 MP that I had ordered and (twice!) returned previously because of its uninspiring performance.  This, the SD1300IS, worked perfectly right out of the box for everything I wanted it to do.  Most impressive - though not necessarily relevant to performance - is the far superior brilliance and color performance of the "search" image of the SD1300 over the A3100.  It is as if the SD1300 is a generation or two ahead of the A3100.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Stine
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon point and shoot camera and I've loved them all.  I've only replaced the old one because of new features and so much use.  I have been very happy with the SD1300.  From my last elph they changed some of the buttons, which I was concerned about.  But after a few months of use I think the new configuration is better.  The auto feature works great for 90% of pictures and then it is easy to change to what setting you need.  Canon camera's are hardy, take great point and shoot photos and are easy to use.

Reviews.Title: My girlfriend loves it!
Reviews.Author: bfafsu97
Reviews.Content: small, light weight, takes great pictures, takes them fast in the daytime, a little slower at night due to the fact it has to focus a little more, but overall a great value and a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...but it's aqua blue, not green!
Reviews.Author: D. Hook
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera after my Canon Powershot SD1200IS went through the washer and dryer (the battery and SD card still worked though!).  I love my new SD1300IS, and it looks and works pretty much identically to 1200IS but with a higher MP and zoom.  My only comment is that the new "green" is aqua blue instead of last year's light leaf green - if color matters to you.  Overall, it's a perfect small point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Torno
Reviews.Content: This is a soild camera easy to use my 10 yr old saved his summer lawn mowing $ and invested is this camera we are both satisfied.  The focus and stability to take many shots is great.  He loves to take close up shots of bugs and other stuff out on the yard and it's ability to deliver good shots is great.  Over all I would recomend this to my frends!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pictures! Reliable little camera
Reviews.Author: Magpie
Reviews.Content: I am a die hard Canon fan. My whole family too. We all have canon cameras and especially the SD series. The lithium ion battery is very long lasting and comes with a charger so no need to remember to buy batteries.The camera is sturdy and small enough to fit in my purse. It will make an awesome gift and it's so simple to use, grandma will love it ( In fact I purchased one for my mother in law who began taking wonderful pictures of her grand kids almost immediately!)The pictures have good contrast and saturation and though I love using editing software I feel I don't have to with this camera. The pictures are always beautiful. Don't know why but people somehow look nicer in this camera's pics!The look of the camera is ok but not fantastic. The silver is a sort of dull matte silver and not the glossy silver that one might expect.I was hoping to find a deal that would make this a little cheaper though, since with camera case and sd card which you have to purchase additionally not to mention tax and shipping it comes to about $200 so it's not exactly cheap! I'm glad I paid the extra and bought this over the models especially the canon powershot A series or the Sony W310 which though about $50 less, takes way inferior pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great for concerts!
Reviews.Author: Natalie Port "cocoa"
Reviews.Content: I decided to upgrade my Nikon s52c (I had an awful experience with it)and decided to go back to Canon. I really like the body of this camera, it's small so it fits in my back pocket or bag without any problems. Also I love attending concerts and this little camera takes great pictures in usually low-lit music halls. The pics have a lot of definition and that was in auto-mode; it worked even better when I used the low-light setting in the menu. I'm not overly impressed with shutter speed, but I can live with it. Zoom (even digital which tends to be awful) is really good.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice.  You should own one.
Reviews.Author: Daniel R. Hunt
Reviews.Content: Just a very good camera.  Small and compact with a nice sized LCD screen.  Takes great pics.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Chaney
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this item that I purchased for my wife. All she now really talk about is how good she looks in her pictures. However from mt point of view this product was well with it. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot I've had
Reviews.Author: redtigermom
Reviews.Content: After spending weeks looking at all the point and shoots on Amazon and other websites, I finally settled on this one, mostly because I was missing vital months of my son's life.  I feel I made a good buy.  It works better than any other Canon I've had in the past.  And the shutter speed is pretty good for a little point and shoot.  Sure, I miss moments with my son, but the only way to seemingly avoid that, is to spend over $600 on a Digital SLR.  So for the price, this camera is fine for capturing moments of the little ones.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
Reviews.Author: Carrotsan85
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good battery life, light weight, thin, good price, crisp pictures, no red eyes.  Overall, very happy about the camera.Cons: Shutter speed could be faster and pictures should leave lesser blurs or smudges when there's less shaking.

Reviews.Title: I like my new camera
Reviews.Author: Jack A
Reviews.Content: Thanks a lot for the wonderful reviews posted on this product. I made a purchase and I really enjoy the camera. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: This is a great little camera
Reviews.Author: S. Barry
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as an anniversary gift and took on our trip to Niagara-on-the-Lake.  It is so easy to use and takes great pictures.  I love the slim design and light weight it is easy to stick in your pocket.  All 3 of my adult kids have some version of this same camera and they all love it too.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice!
Reviews.Author: onyxind "OI"
Reviews.Content: Nice, simple to use.  Intuitive function. no view finder, but not a big deal- the screen is very useful to that end.  In fairness, I would mention that the optical zoom is only 4x and I might go with a higher optical if I had it to do over again.  I have used it indoors and outdoors, for work and for fun and so far it's a little champ

Reviews.Title: Pack & Go
Reviews.Author: BeatleBangs1964
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Canon and Nikon products.  This camera is a little gem as it is light and portable.  I use a Canon for work related matters and it serves my needs quite well.  Its compact style makes it all the more appealing.If you need something that is user friendly and ready to go, then you want this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: James H. Taylor
Reviews.Content: Excellent little camera.  Very light and easy to take with on trips and such.  Takes excellent pictures and is very user friendly.  I would recommend this camera to anyone wanting a good priced camera that takes good quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: SD1300
Reviews.Author: Christphr Knaggs
Reviews.Content: The product is good and delivery was very quick.  Picture quality is excellent, but as other reviewers noted there is some manual entries that have to be made for certain conditions - the auto feature is not as good as I would like.  I miss the viewfinder, but knew it wouldn't be part of this product.  It's so small I almost forget it is in my pocket when out and about - makes it very easy to take along any time.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: N. Victor
Reviews.Content: I had previously owned the Canon SD 750, which I had for three years. I used it all of the time, and had wonderful results. Unfortunately, that camera was stolen from our room during a recent Econolodge hotel stay. Since I loved my old camera, I checked out all of the newer Canons. After comparing this camera with other Canons, and all of the Nikon Coolpix, and reading reviews for all of them, I chose to purchase this camera. I love it! It has many more features than my previous Canon, and takes great pictures. It's so small that I can easily slip it into my purse. A great camera, at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Alex Gem "Wii owner"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a worthy upgrade over my 2006 Canon pocket camera. What impresses me most about the camera is the smart software that it uses when taking pictures. Photos look noticeably more crisp than my last camera.My only minor complaint is that I sometimes accidentally turn the camera on while it is in my pocket. Thankfully the lens is a good sport and hasn't broken so far.

Reviews.Title: Working Great
Reviews.Author: David Caufield
Reviews.Content: We have had the camera for a month now and find it easy to use and takes great picture.  I say that as an owner of a Canon D50 and have found this camera is not an SLR, but compact camera is impressive.

Reviews.Title: Does not focus well
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We've used Canon digital cameras for years and have always been happy with them.  This camera unfortunately does not take clear pictures.  We had to return it.

Reviews.Title: You will be disappointed with this camera
Reviews.Author: Moochie7
Reviews.Content: I bought the Powershot 1300is to replace my Powershot A610. I like the color, big LCD screen, and the feel of the camera. When the camera arrived, I took several pictures with different settings. The pictures all came out grainy and fuzzy at the edge (with or without zoom is the same). Additionally, the image/picture viewed through the LCD screen is obviously grainy. Consider how much I have to pay for this camera, I don't think the price reflect the quality. I returned the 1300is and just bought the 1400is.  There is an obvious difference between the 1300is and the 1400is. The picture take with the 1400is is crazily clear and crisp. So I recommend to pay a little bit more to get the 1400is and stay away from the 1300is.

Reviews.Title: Pretty disapointed
Reviews.Author: picture girl
Reviews.Content: Well I waited until I had used the camera for a while before I made a final judgment.  I got the camera as a gift, but it was one of the cameras that I looked into and asked for.  I like the small size of the camera and it is easy to use, but that's about it.  I get a lot of blurry and too warm pics.  My old dinosaur of a kodak took much better pictures.  It seems to take better pics outside in the bright light, but inside- not so much. I haven't messed with the panorama stitching thing yet, but it sounds cool.  I don't think it will make up for not-so-great photos.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera but...
Reviews.Author: R. Bean "BobbyB"
Reviews.Content: As far as compact size vs fantastic photos goes, this is ONE AWESOME CAMERA.  We took it to Las Vegas and got pictures we will treasure our whole life.  It brings out the colors of the background and so much more.  It is a 5 star camera except for the fact that the automatic lens cap stopped working after just a few days use.  Eventually it started working again but I am fearful that this camera will be in need of repair very soon.  Other than that I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!!!

Reviews.Title: Compact camera with excellent quality photos!
Reviews.Author: M. McDaniel "MNM"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 3 days ago and am in love with it. My husband has the Canon Powershot D10 (which btw is HIGHLY recommended as well!)and decided I would like a more compact one (compared to the D10 this camera has a lid that closes over the lens). I takes AWESOME pictures (see photos) and the battery life is great. Its definitely "point and shoot" it has smart auto and a good amount of features. I am not crazy into photography...I just use it casually. If your more concerned about quality photos as opposed to features this camera is definitely for you. I am not hard to please and this camera meet my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, but it's a disposable camera
Reviews.Author: Happy
Reviews.Content: It comes with a "warranty" but after reading discussion boards with everyone's experiences, I discover the warranty means nothing.  In my case, the camera worked one day, didn't the next, did the next, then never worked again.  This was after 3 months of light use, and no incidents which would have damaged it.  I sent the camera back for warranty repair, and they said it had "impact damage" and would need $144 to repair it.  The salesman at the camera shop apologized and said, "yes, Canon always calls it impact damage, and there's no way to disprove it."The camera takes great pictures, but that's a lot of money for something that gets thrown away after 3 months.

Reviews.Title: Decent, if it actually worked for more than a month...
Reviews.Author: Sara Marie
Reviews.Content: When I first received this camera, I was pretty happy. For the price, it took decent pictures and the battery lasted longer than some other cameras I've used. Just under one month of owning it, I started to get the infamous "lens error" message. At first, I thought nothing of it. I just turned the camera off, restarted it, and the message would go away. After about 4 or 5 "lens error" messages, the lens froze, and wouldn't retract. I tried various fixes, but it's a goner. Don't buy this camera, unless you are a gambler. Chances are, the lens is going to freeze on you. Just google "canon powershot lens error" and you'll see pages of complaints. Invest some more money, and get something that will last you years instead of weeks or months.

Reviews.Title: It's just OK
Reviews.Author: NotAShopper
Reviews.Content: The camera's build and look/feel are great, but the quality of the pictures definitely went down after 6 months of use.  I got it on sale, and it does do a few things I can't accomplish with my phone camera, so it wasn't a waste of money.  Just wish the picture quality had stayed better for longer.

Reviews.Title: Can't get a clear photo
Reviews.Author: M. Eckert
Reviews.Content: Initially, we purchased the SD 1200 and the photos were so bad that we sent it back to Canon thinking it was defective. Canon sent us back another camera and we had the same problem. They finally sent us this SD 1300 but it is just as bad. The picture quality is so poor that you can't get a sharp photo except in bright sunlight. Even then, it is somewhat fuzzy. I should also note that the customer service from Canon was pretty poor. I spent about 20 to 30 minutes waiting for a representative to process the return each time.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Build Quality
Reviews.Author: scott
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Canon SD1300 IS in October, 2010.  Within three months the lens motor had died.  Received a replacdement camera in January, 2011.  In March, 2011, the very same problem - lens motor died.  Received a new camera in early April and I have zero expectation that the camera will survive through the warranty period.  I have purchased many Canon products in the past and this is the absolute worst build I have seen.

Reviews.Title: Time to Move On
Reviews.Author: BRIAN FELDMAN
Reviews.Content: First camera stopped working after 10 days when the auto lens wouldn't retract.  Second camera took fuzzy pictures and Picasa wouldn't recognize the file format.  Very disappointing, as we used an older version of this model for many years and were quite happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Worst of my 4 Canon Cameras
Reviews.Author: P. Ma
Reviews.Content: I've been a long time Canon customer and the SD1300 is easily the worst of my 4 Canon cameras.After 2 weeks of light use (less than 100 pictures) and delicate handling, the lens suddenly became stuck. I say "suddenly" because seconds before, it opened and closed fine. After turning it on again, the lens whirred a few extra seconds and stayed open. Based on other reviews, I can tell I'm not the only one with this problem.

Reviews.Title: No way to keep the lens from opening in your pocket!
Reviews.Author: P. Brusyo "Bruz"
Reviews.Content: Well, this camera lasted me a whopping 3 months.  The problem with it is a combination of the sensitivity of the On/Off button + the playback button being an actual button.  In older models of the Canon PowerShot, the playback option (where you can look at your photos/videos on the camera) was part of the slider.  So whenever I would keep my camera in my pocket (and these are meant to be pocket cameras), I would make sure the slider was on the playback setting so that if the On/Off button got pressed in my pocket, the lens would not come out.  Well, with this model, the playback feature is an actual button, it's not part of the slider.  If you look at the image above of the back of the camera, you'll see that - and you'll also see that the slider gives you 3 options:  automatic camera, manual camera, and video.  So if the On/Off button gets pressed even very lightly in your pocket (it's very sensitive), the lens WILL come out... which leads to the inevitable "lens error"/jammed lens.  My lens will no longer either come all the way out (so that it can focus) or go all the way back in.  You cannot blame this on my handling of it, as these ARE meant to go in your pocket (I'm a guy and so I don't have a purse to put it in).  I was even aware of this potential problem as soon as I got the camera in my possession... but instead of returning it like I probably should have, I thought I'd give it a chance & be really careful when it was in my pocket.If you plan to carry this camera in your pocket, DO NOT BUT THIS CAMERA - be sure to look at images of the back of whatever cameras you're considering and purchase one where the playback option is part of the slider!

Reviews.Title: Bargain at its current price
Reviews.Author: D. Hentze
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small, cheap, digital camera to put in my pocket when I'm traveling, and the SD1300 fits the bill. The size is perfect for what I was looking for, and at its new low price of just over $100, it's a bargain. The camera is simple to use. Most people won't need the quick start guide, or full manual that is included on the CD. Controls and menus are all pretty much self explanatory. The 2.7" screen is bright and clear. Battery life is good, and I get between 200-300 pictures before needing a charge. The image stabilization works well. Outdoors, I shoot in Program Mode with i-Contrast turned "On", and the default settings. The camera takes very good pictures up to ISO 200, and decent pictures at ISO 400. Pictures are relatively clear, and color is natural looking. Shooting indoors is where I find using the automatic settings fail to give the best results. Indoors, the camera loves ISO 500 no matter what the lighting condition is, and the flash is turned on. This results in pictures that are more noisy and grainy than they need to be. When I shoot indoors, I use Program Mode, and set the ISO to 200. It results in much better pictures than when I let the camera chose the ISO. All in all, I find the Canon PowerShot SD1300IS to be a very good all around camera, and a great value. As long as you have reasonable expectations from a camera that packs 12MP into a tiny 1/2.3" sensor, you should be happy with it. I give it a solid 4.5 stars.Pros:InexpensiveEasy to use controls and menusGood results under most conditions outdoorsGood battery lifeGood image stabilizationAuto Mode works well outdoors28mm wide angle lensCons:Excessive noise at ISO above 400Camera uses higher than needed ISO, especially indoorsUSB cover is very flimsyAbsolutely no internal memory/storageBasic VGA video.

Reviews.Title: decent camera, BUT one major flaw for a subcompact
Reviews.Author: L. Doong "ugarugger"
Reviews.Content: as some people have already mentioned, the on/off button is WAY too easy to accidentally push.  For anybody like me who wants a subcompact camera specifically for the ease of carrying it around (in their hip or jacket pocket), this is a HUGE annoyance - almost reason enough to look for a different camera.  I am constantly afraid that I will continue to accidentally push the ON button while it's in my pocket and damage the lens motor.  I purchased this as a replacement for a broken SD1200, and I never had this problem with that model.One way to get around this is to keep it in a carrying case, but if you get one, make sure it's a firm case - like the Canon PSC-55 case, not one of those soft neoprene cases.  The obvious downside of such a case is the additional bulk.otherwise, the other aspects of the camera seem to be fine, it takes decent pictures for my personal snapshots.  I have not yet used it enough to notice any issues, but I will update this review if I do.UPDATED (July 2012)a few major problems have caused me to trash this camera...- the battery/SD card release door doesn't work properly anymore.  long story short, the camera won't turn (or stay) on unless I hold the camera door closed very hard.- autofocus doesn't work consistently, it takes way too many blurry photos that have to be retaken- I got really frustrated with accidentally taking video when I wanted photos - I realize this is MY fault, and I need to remember to change the mode switch, but I found another camera which seems to prevent this problem.If you have the same complaints as I do, try out the Panasonic Lumix DMC FH-8 (or presumably any other camera by Panasonic in the same family?) - I just bought it a week ago and in this short time, I like it a LOT.  the problems with the power button, the battery/SD card release door, and the accidental video taking are all SOLVED by the design differences in the Panasonic.  much less frustrating.

Reviews.Title: not like my old canon powershot
Reviews.Author: CanonGirl
Reviews.Content: Not like my old SD700. Not impressed. Pictures were ok, thought I would have better stabilization or at least the same. The most disappointing is the slow response to take a picture and maybe that's linked to the stabilizer. It takes so long to actually take the picture that I believe the stabilizer doesn't work as well.Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: flashback30
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera, it takes nice pictures and it will fit in your pocket. Great camera for the price

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: skip
Reviews.Content: Great camera, produces fantastic pictures even in dim light conditions.  What you see in lcd view is what you get.  For years I've heard all the raves about Canon cameras, now I know why.  I owned an older Fuji s7000 which I really liked, but it's too bulky, making it impractical for most trips.  Plus the technology is old, so I needed to take many shots to get correct pix under different lighting conditions.  This camera took out all the guesswork.Pros- separate battery charger.  can charge battery leaving camera for use.- what you see in viewfinder is what you get.  this is what i love the most about this camera.  takes all the guesswork out and you can be guaranteed perfect lighting even if you ask a stranger to take your photo.  can set your lighting, iso, ev, etc. and just point and check.  no need to take 10 pix just to get the settings right like older cameras.- many modes for different lighting conditions.  I use all these modes to compensate for incandescent, flourescent, etc. Works great and what you see in view window is what the results will be so no guesswork.  This means that if you turn off flash and press shutter button halfway to focus, it will show you what the results will look like even before you take the picture and the results are practically the same!  That is amazing!- Program modes - love this feature!  Program modes takes much better picture than auto if you know how to use it well.  It's easy to figure out since you can see the expected results just by pressing the shutter halfway.  Most of my pix are taken this way and you can control the lighting.  i use iso 100 most of the time to produce best pix.  but you need a steady hand and stationary objects in lower lighting conditions.- EV setting.  I use ev to adjust lighting to make pictures more or less exposed and the results were fantastic.  again, no guesswork - you see the results in view screen even before picture is taken.  Great for producing- many resolutions to choose from- takes GREAT pictures.  In a trip, a stranger asked me to take a picture w/ a compact flat camera (i think sony brand) and the results came out horrible both times (not focused).  I'm glad I own a canon.  all my shots were always well focused and great color.- very efficient on battery life.  I took pix for many days on one fresh battery.  I keep a generic spare battery in same case and it adds almost no additional weight.- small form factor. so small, my case has so much extra room.  fits easily in my front pant pockets.- so easy to view pictures.  by using zoom dial, you can view entire album in memory.  rotate your camera and pix will automatically adjust for portrait or landscape.- good video quality.  no complaints there.Con- a bit difficult to grip, but that's probably bc it is small.- for some reason, I always accidentally press the power on button.- wish it has a longer optical zoom, but 4x is already pretty innovative at this point in time.- no manual focus, but atm, always seems to focus correctly on it's own.- kind of slow between shots.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with Purchase!
Reviews.Author: Jan Gortler Small "junkjewels"
Reviews.Content: We lost our Canon Camera and needed a replacement quickly.  I am very pleased with the photos and I find that this camera is easier to use then the older model we had.  I highly recommend canon cameras for the good customer service and the beautiful photos.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!!
Reviews.Author: Patman "PGB"
Reviews.Content: I have owned several Canon ELF cameras. I like the power button layout and the menus are similar to my other Canon cameras.  I don't like carrying around a large camera and am willing to sacrifice some features and functionality for convenience.  However, I don't feel like I'm giving up much as this camera takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera...sleek & easy to use
Reviews.Author: archristine
Reviews.Content: Just recieved it this past Saturday...Very happy with the product, packaging, etc. I recieved a free 4GB memory disk from amazon with the purchase and was able to use it right away. It was a lot more sleek and smaller than I expected which makes it great for taking it anywhere. Love the brown color, very modern look. It was super easy to turn on and started taking pics right away. All the buttons and settings are easy to find and figure out their function without even looking at the manual.  As a previous reviewer mentioned, make sure to update the picture quality setting, you have about 5 different dpi options so the higher the number the better quality pics. Definitley wouldn't leave it on the 'S' Setting. Video quality is great as well. Only gave it the 4 stars because I haven't had the chance to fully explore everything. Before you take the photo the live screen shots show a little fuzzy on the screen but after you focus and take the pic, it's a great quality.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Matthew Jk Hill
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use with lots of great features and settings.  Admittedly it sometimes feels too small, but that's just a personal thing.  The pictures that come out are very nice.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Regina "ibi-ubu"
Reviews.Content: I have been taking pictures with this camera ever since I got it to get a "feel" for it.  I really can't come up with something negative to say about it!  I took motion pictures at a baseball game; shots inside and outside, and all came out very well. I love the size as it is easy to carry in my purse.  The instructions that came with it were very clear.  I have had several Canon cameras and they do not disappoint me.

Reviews.Title: Lens Malfunction
Reviews.Author: Julianne Sharratt
Reviews.Content: Initially, I loved this camera. Great photos. I went to use it one day and the screen read, "Lens Error."  End of story.  To get it fixed cost more than a new camera.  Too bad.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot sd1300 is 12.1
Reviews.Author: gail k
Reviews.Content: these cameras are very fragile and although i am a careful person they just do not last at all. i would never buy another small digital camera like this ever again. they are inexpensive, but not built to last more than a year.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely great for what its worth
Reviews.Author: Holly Pascarelli
Reviews.Content: this was my first camera, i have a canon rebel now, but this little pocket sized camera was super great, i dropped it a ton and it still worked fine, it takes SUPER good close up images and its quick and easy, great for teenagers. i gave this to my 6 year old cousin and even he could figure it out. it has a self timer and flash. great lil camera

Reviews.Title: Bad choice
Reviews.Author: desu
Reviews.Content: I was originally pretty happy with this camera. Took very good pictures, easy to use. However, after a year or so, a dark spot developed on the pictures. After reasearching, I found out Canon has a tendency to have this happen as small particles somehow get inside the camera and land on the lens. Also found out it is cheaper to buy another camera than to take the camera to a repair shop to have it fixed. Shortly before my camera got the spot, I bought the same model for my son and his camera had the spot when he used it the first time. I would not recommend Canon, at least not the Powershot.

Reviews.Title: Great for the casual photographer
Reviews.Author: Emma
Reviews.Content: Perfect little camera for taking fantastic photos. Photo quality is superior to competitor point-and-shoot cameras my friends use. Small enough that it fits in my jeans pocket. As a result, I carry it everywhere! I've been using it for several years now without a single issue. It's intuitive and easy to figure out all the features. In fact, I have yet to open the instruction manual.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in this camera.
Reviews.Author: Proud to Speak English
Reviews.Content: I miss the old automatic cameras of years ago - no multitude of adjustments required, just point and shoot.  The only thing I like about this camera is the ability to download pictures to my computer and forward them by email.  I really don't like this camera; every time I go to use it I have to relearn all the features again so I can work myself thru it.  And in the end, the pictures are not as sharp as I'd like.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1300IS 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical
Reviews.Author: Bette Sinclair
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera - compact and easy to carry.  Takes great pictures.  Holds battery life for a long period of time.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: C. Jackson
Reviews.Content: Good camera, small but was good for Grandma.  Missed the SD card did not come with it, cost me extra $ to go get that before she could use it.

Reviews.Title: a lemon?
Reviews.Author: betterlifetechnology
Reviews.Content: This thing died on me 2 months later. It's not the battery. I never dropped it, and it was new in original wrapped package. There was all kind of of electronic glitches and failure in function controls. Sucks that I wasted my money on this. Very unusual though since Canon makes really good cameras.

Reviews.Title: long time now
Reviews.Author: Daniel L. Gagner
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few years now and it has served me well. The little plastic door will break off where the computer cable plugs into it but it still is fine without it. Takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good quality photos.
Reviews.Author: Cathie Freeman "wildone"
Reviews.Content: This small camera has lots of options for taking great photos.  Easy to carry to occasions in one's purse or pocket.

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Barras "kb2007"
Reviews.Content: we purchase these cameras all the time for our office.  The are very reliable and reasonably priced and we use them daily

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Shallon Fricks
Reviews.Content: We have purchased 5 of these cameras and they are the very best and simple to operate. I am sure we will buy more in the future.

Reviews.Title: Greatest Camera ever!
Reviews.Author: KMCKAY
Reviews.Content: BEST CAMERA Ever! REally takes the best pictures ever! I totally love it. Recommend it for everyone :) It is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: Getting Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Prasad Nagaraja
Reviews.Content: This was one of my dream camera. I have always used Canon cameras. I still have SD750 working exceptionally well. I love Canon's picture quality and simple navigations. I got SD1300 and presented to my brother. However within first 8 months i first got lens error. Got it fixed and got the same error after next 2 months.Got it fixed again and it got the same error after 2 weeks. Have never used since. Canon has dissaponted its customers and fans in the recent times.This is a good camera if it works or you are lucky. You will regret buying this Camera if you get Lens/System Error.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use out of box. Excellent Photos
Reviews.Author: Bayshore Beautiful
Reviews.Content: I use this daily at work, taking about 20 photos/day. We use the Eye-Fi to immediately upload photos to the desktop. Very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: John S.
Reviews.Content: Our last Canon PowerShot SD1300 finally broke after accidently being dropped for the umpteenth time.  It was an amazing camera so we bought another one like the first.  We're still totally happy with Canon products and would recommend them over all other camera manufacturers.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and excellent pictures
Reviews.Author: Laurie Dryden
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to mess with manual settings, this is a nice easy camera to use.  With 12 MP you get great shots and can easily crop pictures to suit your taste.

Reviews.Title: hot shot
Reviews.Author: cohunter
Reviews.Content: great quality pictures from this tiny little package. this is a great camera for vacations or just having on hand in your glove box for the sudden photo ops.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1300 review
Reviews.Author: Pitotube
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.I also have a Canon T3i DSLR that I use and but the SD1300 is my carry with me all the time camera. I had one previously that I dropped into the lake on a fishing trip. I had it for several years and used it on all my fishing trips to capture the moment and beautiful landscapes, sunsets etc. It is small easy to carry and use. It has enough options that you can do  some manual mode work with it. Videos come out great, even flying down the lake at 2am in pitch black. I loved it so much that I could have bought a newer version of the camera but went on a search for the exact same camera. That should tell you how much I like it.

Reviews.Title: I like the produce
Reviews.Author: hawkeyeljk
Reviews.Content: The product was suggested to me by friends and the price was right.  I would suggest this product to others.

Reviews.Title: Fast ship
Reviews.Author: Melanie W. Guinn
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th Canon camera--Lost two to the lake(fell off boat) :(:(  Cracked screen on one and one was bad BUT Canon replaced free of charge. Good price.

Reviews.Title: Great, but returning!
Reviews.Author: Dominica M.
Reviews.Content: Great product, cute color and good camera. just lots of signs of use (not like new which was offered) and not what I wanted. Returning

Reviews.Title: Good for beginners
Reviews.Author: Claire Ward
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gist before going on a trip overseas. I know nothing about cameras and don't consider myself to be a good photographer. However, I have taken some truly stunning pictures with this camera. I mostly use the automatic mode, which seems to work well for almost any environment. I would recommend this camera for anyone who needs a camera that's easy to use, light and not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: Not Happy
Reviews.Author: D. Smith
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon PowerShot SD870 IS for several years and was very happy with the quality of the pictures. I purchased the Canon PowerShot SD1300 expecting the same quality and have been disappointed. I find the the pictures are consistently over exposed. I sent it in for repair and was told "thats the way the photos should look" and that over exposure is what is popular now. I would not purchase this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD1300 IS
Reviews.Author: Theresa Guay
Reviews.Content: Haven't had much chance to use it yet but I am looking forward to using it for my grandchildren's graduation coming up soon.  Thank you.  God bless!

Reviews.Title: Sucks
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: This camera has horrible sound quality and video quality. It take nice pictures, but if you want good quality videos then this is not the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: lauren
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Takes really good pictures. Price isn't too bad either. Bright colors and decent moving pics. I have no experience but I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: GOOD
Reviews.Author: fminor
Reviews.Content: - great camera- great quality- nice screen- fast processor- easy to use- battery lasts forever

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Judith E Giovanini
Reviews.Content: Very easy to load the pictures on the computer and they come out great. I have never been a "picture taking person" but now I always remember to take the camera.

Reviews.Title: the best camera
Reviews.Author: moish
Reviews.Content: My name is moshe and I am glad I baut a canon sd1300 with 12 mp. Its the best camera.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Lars
Reviews.Content: Decent Canon P/S. Pictures come out with a Blueish tinge compared to my DSLR, other cameras and even cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot = Good Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Kinsinger
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I needed a basic point and shoot. This camera isn't anything too special but for the price it takes good pictures and served it's purpose. If I was looking for another point and shoot I'd probably buy another Canon. It's been almost 2 years now and still works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Ernie Fordham
Reviews.Content: I really love this little camera.  It fits into my shirt pocket while I am out and about and takes great pictures.  My only complaint would be that the auto focus does not work while zooming in the video mode.  Other than that, a really good small inexpensive camera. Easy to use and, as mentioned, takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera.
Reviews.Author: vicabi
Reviews.Content: This is a nice pocket camera, takes great daylight photos but the ones that you take with flash dont look very clear I have tried in AUTO and MANUAL but the results are the same. If you need a little camera for those sunny days buy it.

Reviews.Title: muy buen producto era todo lo que esperaba y mas me parecio una buena compra excelente producto muy bueno bueno
Reviews.Author: Rodolfo Noguera
Reviews.Content: muy buen producto era todo lo que esperaba y mas me parecio una buena compra excelente producto muy bueno bueno

Reviews.Title: nice digicam
Reviews.Author: Maveek Pilapil
Reviews.Content: I've been using this for more than 2 years,the price was just $106 ;) still works and take pictures perfectly. Just 1 time the lens got stuck, but after a few googling of solutions, I was able to fix it.

Reviews.Title: Durable
Reviews.Author: so cal dad
Reviews.Content: This P&S; survived trips to locations where there is looooots of sand, dirt, running, dropping, things that go boom, and not so gentle handling. Never had a single hiccup.  Beyond that, it even takes really surprisingly good pictures.

Reviews.Title: My day-to-day camera
Reviews.Author: Kadels
Reviews.Content: I have a DSLR and a shock-proof/waterproof camera.  But this Canon is so light, compact, and easy that I use it often.  Great pictures and super easy to use.

Reviews.Title: replacement point and shoot
Reviews.Author: bklnfan
Reviews.Content: this camera was agood buy for me. I rarely use it now, because my smartphone takes such great pictures. better to put your money there...

Reviews.Title: slow shutter
Reviews.Author: Sarah A. Gainey
Reviews.Content: Even for a point and shoot camera it was disappointing. I have since bought another point and shoot camera from Cannon and it was REALLY worth the extra $100! I will never go back to a camera in this price range. If not really careful, the pictures were blurry IF I was able to capture them at all- AND YES I did read the manual on how to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  We are very happy with the quality of Canon and the features of this camera.  Won't go in to details but there isn't a single negative thing we've noticed.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: CAS
Reviews.Content: I have purchased four of these cameras for family members ages 10 to 60.  They are easy to use, the pictures are top drawer, and the small size is perfect for grabbing on the go

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Steve Stacey
Reviews.Content: Gave the camera for a gift - I have three similar Canon cameras and love all of them - this model it great because of the ease of getting outstanding quality pictures with low level light - or just plain Bad Light.  Great product, fast shipping and great packaging.

Reviews.Title: "used" digital camera
Reviews.Author: mark stoga
Reviews.Content: Camera is just like new, just as it was advertised... o o o o o o o o o o

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera with decent features
Reviews.Author: M. E. McCutcheon "MEM"
Reviews.Content: It's a good mid-range digital point and shoot though it has a lot of issues shooting in low light. The image stabilization feature is a joke though - my iphone definitely takes better pictures in a lot of situations.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: poor quality, is not durable in your pockets- lens got fuzzy after a couple months just from normal wear and tear/being in my pocket

Reviews.Title: Bad pictures!
Reviews.Author: K Long
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd canon camera and I will not be buying more. My first canon lasted for 4 years and was good for an inexpensive camera.  I was a photography major in school and Canon was a great brand back then. I bought this camera based on that experience. I have bought 2 cameras for my mother and two for myself.They are easy to use, but they just don't last. I am not a major picture taker any more, and for the little use these cameras recieved they die way too soon. This however, died  after only a 1 year and 10 months. Also compared to my first camera the 1300 takes crappy little pictures. I should have known for the price.There are just too many versions of the same camera and it is difficult to tell what does what. A few less features and more time on basic picture taking would have been nice. Anyway I will be buying a more expensive and reliable camera and it will not be a Canon.  Too bad!

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera
Reviews.Author: Toni
Reviews.Content: This camera is slim, light, and easy to use.  I take it with me when my SLR is too heavy or bulky.  Great image quality and a pretty fast shutter response.  Takes decent low-light photos.

Reviews.Title: A great quality product
Reviews.Author: Andrea Casarubbia "Andrea33139"
Reviews.Content: I bought this one for my sis, I have the old model and still works perfectly.  If you like to print pictures as I do, resolution here is very good.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: cds1987
Reviews.Content: Great quality and great price. It takes wonderful pictures. I am very pleased with it. It also takes video which is another big plus, and if you mess with it enough you can alter many of the settings.

Reviews.Title: nice toy
Reviews.Author: KC California SJ
Reviews.Content: Canon is always quality pictures, it small but great functions that Canon build,I still use it for every day picture, and even,

Reviews.Title: POWER SHOT
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my honeymoon.  Worked very well for how small it was.  As is the case with most cameras I noticed that the pictures look even better off the screen.

Reviews.Title: It's just ok
Reviews.Author: C. Vanech
Reviews.Content: Pictures are not as clear as I would like, but it's ok for general pictures, not for anything artsy or detailed.

Reviews.Title: excelent
Reviews.Author: suelyepp
Reviews.Content: compact, beautiful and take excelent pictures! it could have more modes to modify the image, but it works very well, especially to take pictures in moviments.

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot great little camera
Reviews.Author: KP
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a small camera that was easy to use and took good pictures. This little camera takes really good pictures regardless where I am. I got it after seeing pictures that a friend had from the same type of camera, so it sold me on it.

Reviews.Title: Only worked for 2 years
Reviews.Author: Cheryle
Reviews.Content: I was given this gift as a Christmas present in 2009.  I was very pleased with the picture quality, I thought it took some great shots.  I kept this camera in a case and it wasn't used all that often but it was carefully stored.  About 6 months ago I went to take the camera on a trip and as I powered it up the lens came out to take a shot and then froze in the open position.  Nothing can get the lens to go back into place, thereby rendering the camera useless.  It only comes with a one year warranty and I was told it would cost around $105 to fix!  It really is a shame because while I liked the photo quality I won't pay to have this fixed at such an outrageous price and now I'm leery of getting another Canon.

Reviews.Title: black spots
Reviews.Author: pdlm
Reviews.Content: We have had this camera for 2 1/2 years now and the flash has somehow created black spots in the center of every picture I take.  I know it is the flash b/c when you push the button half way down and the red light goes on the dots are shown in red on my screen.  Loved it till then.  Need to call Canon and complain.  I have always used Canon and this is the first problem I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: Amazing pictures for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jessica M. Oehmsen
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on several cameras before I decided on this one. I'm on a budget, so I can't just buy another camera if I don't like the one I chose. This camera surpassed all my expectations! The pictures are crisp and capture the smallest details. My husband is in a band and plays smokey bars. I take pictures of the shows with this camera and have gotten album quality pictures. The only downside to the camera is the delay between pushing the button and the camera actually taking the picture. Also, if you don't use the flash, I've noticed that the pictures tend to be more blurry. I am an amateur photographer, so it could be something I'm doing. I am more than satisfied with my camera and would recommended it to anyone looking for a camera for general use.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Generally very pleased with camera. Takes nice photos without much effort. Haven't used the video mode. Very good battery life, re-charges quickly also.Only thing I don't like is the small plastic slider switch for auto/program/video modes. It's very flimsy and I can envision the switch breaking easily. Time will tell. Otherwise a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Pictures are nit of good quality and it does not record all movies
Reviews.Author: Magnlia
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera several  months ago and cannot return it. It does not take clear pictures anymore and it seems to be recording movies but they are gone when I upload to IPhoto. I am very disappointed as they are of my grand daughter and cannot be replaced.  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0035FZJLC/ref=cm_cr_rev_prod_img

Reviews.Title: Love
Reviews.Author: Bmc
Reviews.Content: Consumer reports reccomends it and they should. So easy to use and wonderful pics to cherish forever.  The kids and pets setting seems to be all around best setting.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be more pleased~
Reviews.Author: phenomqueen
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a Cannon Elph to replace my old one. I was able to get the same model I'd previously had, it looks brand new and performs that way as well! The seller 'ange13aby' even threw in a brand new 4G sd card! I was hesitant initially because they did'nt have any reviews but the experience was absolutely wonderful, fast and professional! I would purchase from them again in a heartbeat and as alwasys I enjoy and appreciate my shopping experiences with Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Suzee
Reviews.Content: My daughter uses this camera for everything! She loves the look of it, the color, and the features. What I can say is I am amazed at the quality of her photos when she posts them online. They are crystal clear and beautiful. Expensive camera quality in a small inexpensive Canon. I'm very glad I made this purchase. GREAT camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Kelmel23
Reviews.Content: This camera is better than I expected! The pictures are beautiful!Shipped fast too!  I would definitely recommend purchasing it.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Heather J
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after reading lots of different reviews. I seem to have a bit of bad luck when it comes to cameras. They seem to break on me, not my fault though. This camera is lightweight and can fit in your back pocket or a small purse if needed. It has a rechargeable battery, which you plug into an outlet! It is the easiest thing ever! The battery life is amazing. It will hold a charge for quite a while. I don't use my camera on a daily basis, but I think I have only had to recharge it a handful of times. It also comes with the USB cord, so downloading to your computer is a breeze. It has a lot of different settings, although you really need to do some test shots with each. I am still working on the low light/indoors. I haven't gotten it quite right, because they keep coming out a little dark. Overall, I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot is great
Reviews.Author: Dennis Galligher
Reviews.Content: Love the size, feel and quality of images.  Had other compact cameras this is by far one of the best

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ms. Wright
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are very pleased with this camera. It takes GREAT photos and I just happen to get it on sale so it makes it all the sweeter.

Reviews.Title: good for distance, NOT for close up nature photos
Reviews.Author: magoo55
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera as  a back up to my canon SD100 that takes amazing macro photos but is no longer affordable .. the SD 1300 was offered at a great price .. it does NOT meet my needs . Tho it takes great  long distance, wide angle photos, the macro feature produces blurry photos .. no detail ... great in a pinch when yhu want to have a camera but not hapy with the wuality of most of the photos i have taken .

Reviews.Title: Very good camera, perfect for a wide range of experience and use
Reviews.Author: Mark Edwards
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend bought me this camera in Dec 2010 and I had it for 18 months before some thieving piece of excrement mugged her and stole it from her.I wanted a replacement as it is so good.  I struggled hard to justify not replacing it with something similar or slightly better but in the end have gone with the Canon 100HS ELPH.The SD1300 IS is a magnificent piece of technology and I will miss the camera greatly but it's probably best to let it and all the negativity go with it.For anyone else, I can't fault it.  As a relative novice to photography, this thing was so handy and practical, sleek and stylish and it had great functionality.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Canon is always excellent
Reviews.Author: Jay H. Colborn
Reviews.Content: I concur with other reviews.  I'm not a camera buff, but I find this easy enough.  I bought a very expensive Canon 5 years ago; great reviews, but too much for me to handle.  This camera is better for most people than those with so many more features that most never use.  I had the same problem with DVD player, top of the line Canon.  Only after I got rid of it, did I realize I even had all  those features (I got rid of it only because the hold for the DVD seemed to have prematurely, perhaps because of lack of use for a few years).  I replaced with cheapo Sony, which has a better picture (important to me), but without any features.  It seems lite and small and cheaply made, but it works  -- time will tell how durable it is.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: C.H
Reviews.Content: This item stopped working and was un-reliable.I dont recommend it. I just returned it. Get a different product! Good camera but not great. Over priced!

Reviews.Title: pocket digital camera
Reviews.Author: linda
Reviews.Content: The pictures come out very clear.  We are not professionals, so the camera works great for our family pictures.  Downloading onto computer is very easy.  My daughter uses the video to film our horse running and it comes out clear.

Reviews.Title: Replacement
Reviews.Author: Michelle M
Reviews.Content: I had another one of these cameras before. It got broken and was beyond repair. Unfortunately best buy didn't have another, so I bought a new one from amazon. I like this camera so much that I bought a new one. It's a really easy to use point and shoot and we even have the underwater case for it, which also works great. It was worth buying a new one to replace my broken one.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the money
Reviews.Author: AESD
Reviews.Content: I picked this up after reading a few reviews on CNet. I'm used to using an SLR with film so switching to a digital point and shoot seemed like a bit of a stretch for me. I decided to pick this up because it was pretty straight forward as it gets and I knew I could just put it on the automatic settings and take pictures or whatever I needed without too many settings adjustments. This is a good value as far as quality goes for the price. I think my next camera will be a DSLR though because sometimes when people or things are moving in my pictures the autofocus doesn't work as well and there's a bit of a blur.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 10 hours and then quit.
Reviews.Author: Chicago
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera and have used it periodically since then. At most, I have used this for 10 hours in total. It just quit working one day. No recourse either. What a bummer!

Reviews.Title: Poor Camera
Reviews.Author: Doc
Reviews.Content: I have been a Photographer for 20 plus years and bought this for my wife. It seemed like it would be a good replacement for her older model SD630.Unfortunately she doesn't use it and went back to her older model shortly after getting this one.- 99% of photos are out of focus or are soft and playing with the settings, lighting don't seem to make a difference-100% of the video footage is out of focusI would not recommend this model to anyone!Canon makes a good camera so that is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Best deal ever!
Reviews.Author: Jojo
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera almost 1.5 years ago for about $100 and it came with a memory card too! Definitely worth every dollar spent! Compared to my Sony camera, which I paid almost 3 times more the price, this camera is amazing! Easy to use, dependable and most importantly, takes wonderful photos. My pictures never come out blurry! I love that as soon as you click the shoot button, it takes the picture with no lag. Absolutely LOVE IT and wish I bought one or two more to give to friends and family!!!  I searched for it recently, and it's almost $140 which is weird to me since i bought it over a year ago... It should be almost free by now! Shows how awesome this camera is!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Pictures
Reviews.Author: New Sony Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera takes beautiful pictures indoors and out.  It video records but the only thing about the video recording is the volume is low while recording and there isn't any way to turn it up.  That is my only complaint about this camera, other than that I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Chani
Reviews.Content: I ordered a Canon digital camera from this seller. The product arrived quickly and was in perfect condition. No problems were encountered.

Reviews.Title: OK while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Betsy Jones "AtlantaMom"
Reviews.Content: Initially, the camera was OK.  Pretty much average for a point and shoot.  After 10 months the memory card mechanism broke (the card would not stay pushed in).  I sent it to Canon since it was still under warranty. They sent me a replacement camera ( not sure whether it was new or refurbished).  After 3 months the lens closing/opening mechanism broke.  Initially it would open but it wouldn't close.  After a while it would not open at all.  Of course, by now it's not under warranty anymore.I would definitely not buy it again.  It lasted just over a year.  I had my Sony camera for over 10 years and it was great and never gave me any problems.  I've also had a Sony video camera for over 10 years and it's been performing really great.  I'm going to stick with either Sony or Nikon cameras.

Reviews.Title: Another good Canon point & shoot
Reviews.Author: NH8511
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Canon SD11XX camera.  It replaced an SD1100 IS which was unfortunately dropped and my wife has an SD1200 IS.  I opted for the SD1300 rather than going for the newer model because these cameras take great photos and videos.  The anti shake software is absolutely terrific and the video is as good as it gets from a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: ISFfan
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!  I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend because I like the one I have so much.My boyfriend uses it all the time and says it's easy to use and takes great pictures.  His 9 year old daughter enjoys using the camera to take videos.My sister has bought three cameras this same Canon model: one for herself, then she lost it the same day, so she bought another one.  She also bought her daughter one for her birthday.So here are many happy customers!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE This Camera!
Reviews.Author: happygirl
Reviews.Content: This little baby is awesome!  I was stunned at how fantastic the picture quality is and even more amazed at how well the SOUND quality is when using it as a video camera.  My friend asked me to shoot some pics and vids of her rock band and the result was professional looking and sounding.  She and her bandmates and myself could not believe the sound quality that came out of this camera.The macro setting is amazing and I've taken many macro pics of flowers and insects.  I've only just now discoverd that the full auto mode is just as awesome and takes amazing photos both normal and macro.  I can't say enough about the Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS.  If you're in the market for a point and shoot camera with professional output, you can't go wrong with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Broke after just two uses, takes horrible quality pictures. Not at all like other prior Canon Digital Elph cameras
Reviews.Author: skimoore
Reviews.Content: I bought this digital camera after extensive research with friends, family and online to determine what would work best for my needs.
