I've never owned a Canon before but most my friends and family have had the Elph line in the past and have only had great things to say, plus they seem to last forever which was important to me b/c I tend to buy cameras that don't last long for some reason or another.  I used the camera once after I first bought it and was very disappointed with the grainy/poor quality images.  They didn't seem at all like the clear images I've seen from other cameras.  I then moved and didn't need to use the camera again until 6 months after I purchased.  AFter about 10 shots the camera totally stopped working and the lens won't even open.  I am too late to return the camera and now have a worthless piece of junk that I spent a lot of money on.  My advice is to wait until Canon has done more to add quality to this Elph before purchasing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Etta
Reviews.Content: So easy to use great pictures Had this camera for almost a year it got damaged in an accident so I went right out and purchased another the same exact camera  Really really like it.

Reviews.Title: canon SD1300  - disappointing
Reviews.Author: Rooney
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera with high hopes, yet have been disappointed.  My biggest gripe is when I am taking photos indoors.  They are very poor quality.  The outdoor pictures are very good.  The lag time is unacceptable.  I am purchasing a different camera because I have wasted so many photos.  my older Canon camera was much better quality.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Color
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: As a professional photographer and a die hard Canon user/supporter, I have to say this camera is extremely disappointing. I purchased one for my wife, one for my mother and one for my cousin and all three of them have never taken good photos. The color and white balance settings make all indoor pictures look terrible. Camera's sit in the drawer, our cell phones take better pics.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon camera I have bought.  I love Canon cameras, such great quality and the price is not bad at all.  The best price was here at Amazon, I went to Target, Wal-Mart and Sears and Amazon had the exact one I was looking for and the best price.

Reviews.Title: Giving up on Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: wspsatisfed
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th Canon PowerShot.  But I'm done.  From what we have observed, the photo quality has declined in the last 2 PowerShots with the 1300IS being the worst.This camera cannot seem to recognize different light sources and many photos are completely washed out.This one in particular has a very bad design flaw.  The power button is not recessed, therefore it constantly turns on when it's in my pocket or my wife's purse.  Our lens finally got jammed to the point of no longer being able to use it.I've owned nothing but Canon cameras for 15 years now, but it's time for a change.

Reviews.Title: I never got it.
Reviews.Author: Island Boy "Island Boy"
Reviews.Content: The supplier refunded my money because they were unable to deliver the camera due to some unexplained shipping problem.I was purchasing this one as a gift for my son.  I actually already have this camera and love it.  It is small for my ultralight backpacking and takes fabulous pictures. It would have been nice to also get one for my son at the price advertized, but it didn't work out.

Reviews.Title: happy customer
Reviews.Author: ksam
Reviews.Content: This is great camera. I take lot of quality pictures with this. It is very handy and is easy to operate and transfer pictures in to my computer to share pictures with friends and family.I will strongly recommend this product to any one who needs a good quality and simple camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Theo
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera for a trip I had planned with my sister.  It came on the nick of time. It's so easy to use, and very compact. The pictures are of good quality.  Love this camera and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: K. Allford
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. It is very compact and takes great pictures. I don't miss the viewfinder, as I thought I would. It's probably just me, but I am still trying to figure out how to take good up-close pictures. I think I need better lighting :)

Reviews.Title: good value for the price
Reviews.Author: bang for your buck
Reviews.Content: good camera for those who want a simple point & shoot that you can carry around easily.  only issue is when using the zoom, the picture in the viewer is grainy.

Reviews.Title: Lens jams
Reviews.Author: Charles Llewellyn
Reviews.Content: Purchased my original SD1300 IS in December 2010 to replace a Canon I had been using mainly for underwater photography.  Also purchased the Canon underwater housing (which is only good for that model and cost more than the camera).  After a few uses of the camera, the lens jammed in the open position as the on button is a bit large and the camera turns itself on when it shouldn't. I contacted Canon and they gave me excellent service in replacing the camera as it was still in warranty.  I also felt that I better get a backup camera for diving trips, and found that Canon no longer sold them directly, but found another new SD1300 on Amazon from Quality Photo (which cost more than the original). That one arrived quickly, but the lens jammed on the first day.  I contacted Canon service again, and they sent me a replacement right away. So, now I have two working cameras (plus 4 batteries and chargers, as they came with the replacements).  I like the camera, and will take extra special care to keep these from jamming, but can not recommend anyone else purchase this model, which is being phased out anyway.  It is not a pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Momof3
Reviews.Content: I am not a great picture taker but this camera allows me to have wonderful pictures without knowing really how to do it.  I just use the auto feature and the pictures turn out great.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: Valerie Byrne
Reviews.Content: This camera is an OK point-and-shoot, but I've definitely had better.  It often has trouble focusing, and the shutter speed is very slow.  For example, taking a picture in a bar takes 20+ seconds, which makes for awkward standing-together-when-is-the-flash-going-to-go-off pictures.  A lot of my pictures turn out blurry, so there must be something out of whack with the auto focus.Pros:Connects nicely and quickly to my computerNice screen for viewingEasy to turn off flashCons:Takes blurry pictures / has trouble focusingLong shutter speedsFlash can totally white out details and facesLots of red eyesI would definitely shop around before considering this model.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures and battery life but has some flaws
Reviews.Author: glow11
Reviews.Content: Canon elph camera build quality seems to have diminished a bit with this latest model. The camera still comes with a metal shell which is good but the controls are less durable. Pictures and movies look better than ever but I have two big problems with this model. One is that the mike for picking up sound compared to previous models is vastly inferior. I take a lot of movies and the sound is terrible. I need to press my ear against the camera speaker to hear the sound after a recording. The sound pick up on this camera is so bad that I do not even use it for movie recording. Previous Canon camera models did not have this problem. The other issue I am having is the control panel. The on screen feature selections and settings once again are no where near as good as previous model elph cameras. Because of this I cannot recommend this camera. I believe that Canon may have fallen into the same category of other companies that sacrifice quality of some aspects of their product for price. The pictures are great but overall not good camera for me. I have gone back to using my old camera and keep this as a secondary.

Reviews.Title: Good things come in small packages
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: The CannonPower Shotn SD13001S has it all.  It's easy to use, the quality of the pictures are clear, and I can carry it in my  pocketbook at all times so I don't miss an opportunity to take a picture of a special moment.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for point and shoot
Reviews.Author: JCK "Jimmy K"
Reviews.Content: I was bummed when I broke my old Canon Camera, but happy to have this new one. Canon has the best point and shoot camera's. This one takes great pictures, is small and compact and simple to use. It takes great pictures. I bought it a month ago and have already used it on two different weekend vacations. People have pointed out how nice the shots turned out.

Reviews.Title: Why a new battery size?
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my broken Canon SD2000 ELPH. The camera itself is very good.  However, I am annoyed that the battery is not interchangeable with my old Canon. It is nearly the same size, but neither battery fits the other camera.  Since my wife still has her SD2000, we will need to carry extra batteries and a second charger when we travel.

Reviews.Title: Nifty cam!
Reviews.Author: Sam I Am
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use. Takes excellent photos in low light. Battery life is excellent. Great camera for the price.I take this camera everywhere!

Reviews.Title: Excellent pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Squire
Reviews.Content: The seller got it to me quickly and just as advertised - new in the box.The camera is outstanding in features and photo shooting.Great focus points and really good stabilization.One of the best pocket cameras I have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Good Little Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: B. A. Chaney
Reviews.Content: I consider myself to be an avid photographer.  I own a DSLR and a bag full of lenses, and I can often be spotted carrying around my big camera and a lens or two.  But there are sometimes when carrying around a big black camera will not do, or when I'm out somewhere and see something that I want to catch but I don't have my camera with me.  Those are the times when I use my Canon PowerShot, which I've found to be a great little camera for the size and price.I've found that this camera takes pretty good pictures, especially when it is used with good light.  The colors are closer to life than with other point and shoots I've owned, the image quality is pretty good except for in low light, and the optical zoom is enough for some short range zoom action.  The camera does not have a particularly quick response time for a point and shoot, which makes it hard to use with moving subjects (like little kids) but if the object isn't moving too fast, the pictures turn out reasonably well.  The autofocus with facial recognition also seems to work well for quick shots.  Finally, the size and price are the biggest selling points for me on this camera.  It's small and light enough that I can throw it in my purse and carry it around all the time.  And it's inexpensive enough that I don't mind taking it places I wouldn't want to take a DSLR--like to a day on the beach, a theme park, or handing it over to a kid for some fun photography.This is a good camera for someone looking to capture snapshots.  It's not a fine photography camera, but it does its job!

Reviews.Title: Great on the Trail
Reviews.Author: Charlie2l8
Reviews.Content: Customer's wife reviewing - My husband bought this for me to use on the snowmobile trail. The camera is small enough to keep in my Carhartt bib pocket where it stays close to my body. This keeps the battery warm and viable. Have some excellent shots on the trail and have since used it in many settings from picnics to boating excursions to Engineer's Day at the Soo locks. Good product; easy to use; great back-up camera to my Canon digital SLR.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Heather/Chad Anderson
Reviews.Content: We have stuck with this camera for years, buying the newer version when it is time to replace our camera (cameras last long even with us so hard on them).  Great features, easy to use and excellent picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: sshodgie
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a friend for her birthday and she loves it.  It is great quality and performs well.  The color is great (be aware that the sides are a burgundy color and not pink).  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Not the best cannon product
Reviews.Author: AnaB
Reviews.Content: I have had a lot of point and shoot camera's over the years, and when my last one broke I was excited to find this one on sale. I have owned precious Cannon PowerShots, but this one was a real let down. Although the interface and settings are great (which is why I liked my previous Cannons) the picture quality is much less than desirable. While the camera works great outdoors on a sunny day where there is little contrast in the picture, the moment you take it inside it has great troubles with white balance. And, this may be a problem with the particular camera I received, but it also takes a lot of pictures out of focus. Also, the colors in the picture are not true to life, especially where purple is concerned - everything purple looks blue! It was a letdown, but I guess that's what I get for expecting great things out a $100 camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: rlt7272
Reviews.Content: We (wife and I) had an ealier version of this camera that we used when we did not want to bring along the digital SLR.  However, my 2 boys decided to break that camera against the nice hard sidewalk.  It was a no brainer getting another powershot.  Keep in mind that this camera is used mostly as a point and shoot quick grab camera so I have not gotten into any of the advanced features.  That said, it takes a great picture, is compact and has done exactally what we expected it to do.  My one complaint is that it did not use the same batteries as the older camera.

Reviews.Title: Great CAmera
Reviews.Author: Ingsoc84 ""Your a thought criminal""
Reviews.Content: Great Camera..thoroughly loved it..until my wife dropped it..and it died....lesson...if you buy one for your wife..teather it to her neck..or just dont buy one for her!

Reviews.Title: The Best Value for Money
Reviews.Author: DK
Reviews.Content: *** My First Camera  ***.  I purchased this camera few months before and this is truly money worthy and easy to use camera. Thanks to CANNON.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!!
Reviews.Author: E. Sander
Reviews.Content: I got this camera after I got rid of my last canon powershot sx110 For some reason the pictures kept coming out grainy on that camera and I didn't like so I decided to get a new one. I was debating between nikon and canon for a long time but finally decided on canon and I'm glad I did!! I love this camera it takes great pictures! And so far no grainy ones :) I've had it for a couple of weeks and every picture has come out good. I deffinitely reccomend this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Cool Camera
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife, and she loves it! It fits easily into a pocket or small purse and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but not as good as canon powershot sd1000
Reviews.Author: M. J. Schinkel
Reviews.Content: The camera simplifies some of the regular tasks but at the expense of its ability to take low light photos and shutter speed for action shots forcing you to miss shots.  In ideal conditions it is a better camera, but that is a rarity for me.  The video is far better than my old SD1000 camera with more frames per second with better resolution.  I also loved the frame stepping option which was wonderful when taking video of lightning.  However with photos, I was able to do far more with the SD1000 to adjust for shot conditions.  The resolution is far better which helps when zooming (which in optical zoom simply crops the photo and enlarges using the unzoomed resolution) because of the 12.1MP is much better than the old 7.1MP with the SD1000.  With shutter speed, it is best to take a picture first to prime the focus (and keep your finger on the button) then it will take pictures quickly.  However, this does not help when you have to wait over 2 seconds for the initial photo forcing you to miss quick photo opportunities.  I was able to adjust exposure but I found the light sensitivity poor compared to my SD1000.  A night vision option would be a welcome improvement.  A good option is the bulb like setting allowing the shutter to stay open.  Overall I feel it is not an improvement over the SD1000 but it could have been if they only used the same features (except for video, use the SD1300) and improve the resolution to 12.1 or higher.  Still a good camera but I will keep my SD1000 too and use this one for video, ideal condition photos and as a good back-up camera.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Mae
Reviews.Content: I went abroad a while ago and my roommate had this same camera. We always used her camera for group pictures because it had the best quality. I got online and purchased my camera less than a week after getting home, and it has been wonderful. Image quality is great, videos are clear and beautiful, and there are enough modes to keep you playing and taking great pictures. I also get compliments on how cute it is all the time, which is never a bad thing.

Reviews.Title: I love this little camera
Reviews.Author: amanda23
Reviews.Content: I own a Canon digital SLR camera, but wanted a small point and shoot to carry with me in my purse (especially since I hate the camera on my Droid phone). This one has exceeded my expectations.It is smaller than I thought it would be when I took it out of the box, but now that I'm used to it, it's perfect.The battery life is really good, even considering the LCD viewfinder.I love the shutter-speed. I have used my mother-in-law's camera at family events and the shutter lag is AWFUL on hers. I am going to be buying her this camera for Christmas this year.I don't use the video capabilities on it, so I can't speak to that.But of the features that I've used, I don't have anything bad to say about this camera...

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: McKinzie12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this camera for our recent trip to Disneyland.  It took amazing quality pictures and was lightweight and easy to carry.  We are more than pleased with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Affordable Decent Quality Digital Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Kiran Vemuri
Reviews.Content: As a basic camera to carry with you for quick and easy point and shoot, this is an excellent camera, outside of that, if you are looking for the quality, choices and control over the camera like you do with an D-SLR, think again about purchasing this camera. As for the image stabilization, it works as predicted but can be slow at times, dependent on the amount of light that is available. Along with that, there is also a problem with whites being washed out esp. if the flash is turned on and you are taking close up shots. In the end though for the price, this camera operate as one would expect and is great for the casual photographer and the student that will probably beat this camera up.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for the money!!
Reviews.Author: KG
Reviews.Content: Excellent product for the money!! Battery life is ok, but loved the 16x zoom. The video quality is good as well. Would definitely recommend the product to friends.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera ever
Reviews.Author: Panda
Reviews.Content: Cute color, very compact and fits in my purses & even my tiniest clutches! Its very easy to use & convenient. I love the zoom, crisp quality pictures. And the desktop feature is easy to use, when your transfer pics to your PC.

Reviews.Title: Great Value For Price
Reviews.Author: Ryan McWilliams
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a camera that was from 2004 and I was very happy with the upgrade.  The feature I like the best is (I don't know the exact technical name of the feature) how the camera can automatically balance the picture if you are moving or the camera is slightly shaking.  This is perfect for when you are in a crowded room, bar, party or other social gathering with people all around you and you are trying to take a picture and getting jostled from all sides.  I also like how "crisp" the pictures came out.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price.
Reviews.Author: MountainDave
Reviews.Content: This camera is astounding. Whatever we could think of that we'd want in a camera of this size and price range is present in spades. It is easy to use, easy to connect to a PC, takes great moving and still pictures, works exceptionally well on full auto,(i.e. idiot), mode over a wide range of lighting conditions and subjects, but still has enough photographic options to play with when you want to try mildly creative shots. We haven't shut up about this camera since we got it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Buy and Experience
Reviews.Author: Jerry Long
Reviews.Content: The Canon products and cameras have always been an excellent experience and this one makes a good travel camera when needed. Compact  and very easy to use for great photo results.

Reviews.Title: The Len was stuck outside and cannot get back in after 6 months of usage
Reviews.Author: HW4318
Reviews.Content: I purchase this camera in last December. The quality, as a product from canon, really let me down. The camera len got stuck outside and cannot get back in while I was adjusting the focus several weeks ago. Now the camera as a dead one lying on the desk in my dorm. Going to return this item, either for fixing the len issue, or getting reimburse.

Reviews.Title: Its ok for me
Reviews.Author: Ann-Marie Lefaivre
Reviews.Content: I am not an avid photographer, but I love to take pics everytime I go out with friends.  The durability of the camera is good. The original battery does not last long at all. Must buy the extended one online.  The flash is just okay. Pictures still come out pretty dark at night.  And you have to hold the button 1/2 way down for the camera to focus everytime before you take the shot or it will come out blurry everytime.  This is very annoying when you give the camera to someone to take a picture and forget to tell them to hold it 1/2 way down. They almost always have to take more than 1 shot.  Don't like.

Reviews.Title: It is a very nice camera
Reviews.Author: angel
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my daughter as her college grad gift. I compared with many cameras,it uses rechargeable battery, it saves a lot. The price is reasonable. She loves this camera very much. She said this is a very good one, the pictures are shape, but for some reason, the color on the screen turn to be quite yellow. Anyone knows why? And she likes the color( green) too.

Reviews.Title: PowerShot SD1300IS
Reviews.Author: Michael H. Stasiak
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, just got back from a vacation in Italy. Great pictures in many different conditions,including near dark and low light (not using the flash). Did Great!! Hard to find an easier to use camera.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: M. Huelman
Reviews.Content: Do NOT purchase this camera if your main intention is to shoot photos of children, pets.....anything that moves around a lot.  Actually, just do NOT purchase this camera period.  This camera has the slowest picture taking time (I read 2.9 seconds somewhere) and you'll miss all of your photo ops, very frustrating.  I thought I had researched everything thoroughly when purchasing a new camera, this camera had good reviews, so I bought it, and..... hated it instantly.  I decided to give it time...took it on a vacation to try out, thinking maybe I needed to adjust to a new camera. Unfortunately I am now stuck with it as I am 2 days past the return date.If you are shooting landscape scenes.....in fact, anything that is stationary, this camera is good for that. You can point and shoot still life like a pro...but DO NOT buy this if you take a lot of photos of people.  I actually get embarrassed at how long my subjects have to wait for the photo to be taken...it's that awkward pause...like 2.9 seconds of frozen smile..then finally it takes the picture. I've also never taken a lot of blurry photos...sure I'd have a couple of bad ones...but I swear that 30% of the photos I take with this camera are turning out blurry.  I am making a conscious effort to be very still when taking the picture...and god forbid I have someone else try to use the camera and take a picture of me.  I really would not recommend this camera to anybody, unless you want to buy mine and get it off my hands.I've resorted to using my 8 year old Kodak model, which takes pictures quickly and accurately, just doesn't have as bright of a flash.And don't get me started about the user manual...not helpful at all.  I've tried to look online for helpful tips from other canon users, I don't think it's fair that I should have to put this much effort into camera use.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot.
Reviews.Author: Anne Evans
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera a lot.  Only thing I've noticed that isn't great is that if you zoom all the way, the picture is blurry.  If it's not going to take a clear picture at that zoom, why even bother having the capacity to zoom all the way in?  However, it's very user friendly and does take great pictures within a reasonable distance.  Love the big screen and the size.  Overall, I think it's a great point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Grampa
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my grandaughter. I've owned a few Canon's in the past & am very happy with them.  A Canon camera is the first camera I look at when I am buying a camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but slow on the take
Reviews.Author: T. Thorpe "Tarapaper"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera when our old Canon Elph died. We had that camera 5 years and LOVED it. We have 2 children and it never missed a shot. So, we decided to upgrade our model to get this camera and we are disappointed in the clarity. It is not as quick to take the shot and many of the shots come out blurry. we never had this issue with our old camera. It is a good camera if you are not looking to take action shots, like fast moving children. Plus, it doesn't seem to have all the same features, like a snow setting. We will stick with it for now but not too happy.

Reviews.Title: Too Slow
Reviews.Author: David Zablocki
Reviews.Content: I love Canon..... my two current point and shoots have been damaged by my kids - had to buy a new one, and gave this 1300 a try, but hated it.  As some other people wrote, it is just too slow to take pictures of fast moving kids (had no issues with my Canon 780) and the overall picture quality was poor.  I have returned it, and I am goint to give Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 HS a try.  I hope its better.  (never thought I would write a bad review on a Canon !!)

Reviews.Title: I thought Canon would do better...
Reviews.Author: LT Review
Reviews.Content: Considering the fact that Canon was known to be a top selling camera brand, it made sense to purchase one.  I bought it about one month ago and within the first week, it kept on reading a "Memory card error" message.  I checked the card to make sure it wasn't locked and that it was functioning with my other digital camera.  It was fine even after I formatted it.  The same error appeared over the course of two weeks and then one day the lens just froze.  It would not wind back to its original shut down position so I called Canon which was just a pain because you have to pay the shipping fee plus a week or two to get your camera back.  I just returned it to Amazon for my full refund.  The older models for Canon works well, but I would not recommend this model.  I believe a few others have had this problem that rated this product a one or two.  But unfortunately their warranty was over.  So be careful when you purchase this, I was lucky to be able to return this for a full refund.  Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Not like the old Elphs...
Reviews.Author: usuallyhappy
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed in this Elph's performance.  This would be my third Canon Elph and I have to say not very happy.  I love that it is small and takes great outdoor pics.  I always keep this camera in my purse to take pictures and videos at the park, zoo, vacations, etc.  I have never been happy with how slow it takes pictures and the indoor pictures are horrible.  The main reason I bought another one was the price for a good outdoor camera.  But the one main problem is I can no longer keep in my pocket.  Any movement causes the power button to be pushed (sticks out now, other ones were flush with camera body) and the lens comes out.  Once this happens the lens has an error and shuts off.  After 3 months, my camera stopped working and I had to send to Canon to fix.  It was under warranty and they sent me back a refurbed one.  If you are looking for a camera to take in your pocket, this is not the one.  You have to buy a case and carry it in your hand the whole time.  Takes great outdoor photos and videos of the kids.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot but beware of audio distortion
Reviews.Author: The K's
Reviews.Content: I do some amateur Dig SLR shooting but still need the trusty slim point and shoot for my pocket.  Enter this guy for $107, a great price.  I can be somewhat of a vampire so low light is important and this canon rocks those pics.  You can turn the flash off, hold her steady in your hand and get some amazing pics for a point and shoot.  It doesn't take long to be ready for the next shot, always less than 3 seconds.Unfortunately I had to return it for the audio quality on the movie mode.  It takes great vids, good frame rate and it certainly DOES ZOOM IN AND OUT during movie mode.  The audio sounds awesome if you are just talking and does a great job of taking out wind noise...BUT....if you ever plan on shooting video in a concert environment with a lot of sound and especially a lot of bass....your audio will be distorted.  :(  So bad you can't hear anything but distortion.If you never plan on shooting video in that situation BUY THIS CAMERA!  It's an amazing value and the features are just unmatched.  Way more clear photos than Nikon, Panasonic, Sony, etc with NO FLASH.  Very smart camera....kinda scary!  I'm actually probably going to purchase again and just get a flip for video.  For around $100 it's an amazing point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Simply superb for the price!!!
Reviews.Author: Nagaraju Rajuri
Reviews.Content: I bought two pieces from Amazon one for 179$ in May 2010 and the other for 99$ in Dec 2010. Both the pieces are working fine. I like the clarity of the pics and video too. Thanks Canon and Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: not happy with it
Reviews.Author: robinesp "RobinESP"
Reviews.Content: I am a Canon fan. I have always had different kinds of Cameras for the last 30 years and this is the worst mostly because of how long it hesitates before taking the picture. I had an older Canon Powershot 1100 and I loved it but it was dropped several times and gave up the ghost.  I should have returned this one.

Reviews.Title: My Last Canon
Reviews.Author: Derek R. Greene "D. R. Greene"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for a 6 month old 780 that had failed. I should have known better. It died after 10 weeks of light use. The display screen started showing stripes, the camera began to sound like it was shorting out, then it ceased working completely. This all happened in a period of about 10 minutes. Both of the cameras took beautiful pictures while they lasted, but I really need cameras to last longer than that. I may buy another bad camera, but I won't buy another bad one from Canon.

Reviews.Title: I bought two and I I already had one
Reviews.Author: AlecWS
Reviews.Content: Actually, I already had an SD1200.  I use these cameras for work.  Nothing beats the usability of the Canon interface in my opinion.  I've had 4 Canon cameras in the last three years - the last three have been the SD1200 and 2 SD1300's.  All three of the last cameras are still working.  I love how easy it goes in and out of my pocket and how fast in focuses and takes the pic when the button is pushed.  It slows down quite a bit after a few dozen pics with the flash on but that's understandable - it just takes time to charge the flash.In short, I love the Canon SD's.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Daisy
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a christmas present for my mom and we both love it.The Clarity of the pictures are amazing. The size is perfect, it's very slim and small and can fit anywhere.The set up was extremely easy.I definately recommend this camera as a must have!

Reviews.Title: no sd card included
Reviews.Author: Luna 1 "Luna 1"
Reviews.Content: the camera is nicely compact and handsome with a good size screen. the shutter is quick and it is easy to use. It produces nice crisp photos.we were however surprised that no memory card was included.

Reviews.Title: Poor Camera
Reviews.Author: hdsumm
Reviews.Content: This is my third digital camera.  I have made my living in Photography for over 45 years.  My major field delt with the Quality of Camera Images.  I had a Canon G-2 camera that went sour (Something in the switch system) and I wanted to replace it  with a camera that was small and easy to carry around.  Hence:  the Canon SD1300IS.This camera was a whiz to use - - - but the image quality is poor.  The image is in focus (no front or rear focus) but the image lacks both resolution and acutance.  The pictures look as if they were shot throu a bucket of water.  A 4x6 print is not even exceptable (while I got fine 11x14s from my G2 with only 4 Mega Pix).After more than 50 images of a viarity of subjects, this camera is going back in the morning.

Reviews.Title: Expected a faster camera
Reviews.Author: Jello
Reviews.Content: I had the older version of this camera that my wife dropped and broke. It wasn't the best camera but it was faster than this one. The old one was 8 or 10 megapixels and this one is 12 so I guess the extra pixel processing makes it slow. I hate to give this just 3 stars since it is so amazing how much awesome technologies they can get into these small devices. but if I miss a shot because it is slow I would accept the limitations of  haveing less pixels, no face recognition and a smaller screen.

Reviews.Title: Great pics, easy to use, cute
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my 13th birthday (In July) and I've had absolutely no problems with it since!  My sister had a digital camera and I really wished I had one too to capture memories!  I originally really wanted a Nikon Coolpix but the price and reviews were turnoffs (Almost everyone said something with the lens kept breaking and it wasn't replaceable).  This one had great reviews, and very minimal people had problems with it!  I practically bring it everywhere with me!  It has produced GREAT pictures and I've been nothing but thrilled with it!  One of the things I didn't like on my sister's camera that I was afraid this one would come with too, is that the "Erase all" is right next to the "Just erase one picture" button.  And one time my sister accidentally hit the "Erase All" button and lost all her pics!  So when this camera came, I checked that out and the "Erase" buttons aren't near each other.  In fact, you have to go to "Menu" to get to the "Erase All" so it's not even close just the "Erase".  I keep mine on Auto instead of Program.  When on Program, it sort of produced yellow pics if the lighting was bad.  It's an easy-to-use camera, cute, and takes pretty good quality pictures!  My sister has told me several times that she wants my camera!  I would definitely recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: IS1300
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my GF for Christmas and she has taken a lot of pictures since then, but honestly the vast majority are not that great.  They are blurry, under exposed, over exposed, they run the gamut of photographic problems.  Surely most of this could have been corrected with a change in settings but honestly I did not by her this to play around in menus that even I, an epic gadget geek; find cryptic and difficult to decypher on the fly.  She is just a point and shoot girl and I thought that is what the primary selling point of this camer was.  She has only used the auto mode so maybe I am expecting too much.  The bottom line is that it didn't meet my expectations for an entry level camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing for the price of it.
Reviews.Author: Samiix3
Reviews.Content: This Canon PowerShot SD1300IS [in Blue] is absolutely worth the price! It's affordable, easy-to-use, takes good pictures, and uploads to your computer in a reasonable amount of time. (:

Reviews.Title: Great Camera but lens stuck
Reviews.Author: Cesar
Reviews.Content: This is a great Camera but Canon needs to work more on it.  After three months of use the lens stuck> I sent Canon for repair and I get a refurnished camera that again show the same problem after a month. Again sent to Canon and They sent me back another refurnished. Until today it still working but Iam worried about the warranty. I will pay the next time due the warranty wil expired. Please Canon fixed the problem.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: G.V.
Reviews.Content: A worthwhile camera but probably not for serious users. It does everything expected except I find that indoor pictures come out particularly yellow when the camera is set on automatic.  Changing the setting to manual and adjusting the setting to 'Indoor' photography helps to reduce the yellow in the photos quite a bit.I like the camera greatly, but would probably not buy this particular model again because of the yellow-ness of indoor photos.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power shot Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Lorenz
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I was looking for. Very timely delivery. all items arrived as ordered and in great condition. would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Very good video; better than Sony W350, Nikon S3000
Reviews.Author: Ivan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a pocketable video recorder + camera to complement my DSLR and camcorder. I wanted something that I could have with me when I didn't feel like or think I needed to take my larger camera and/or camcorder. I especially wanted to be able to take short video clips of my children since they are at that young age where everything they do is cute and adorable. I ruled out the Flip video as a unitasker: unable to take pictures, no optical zoom, limited recording memory, no resolution other than HD (1280x720). My old computers stutter and choke when playing back these high-res files so I can live without HD.I bought and tried the Sony W350 as well as the Nikon S3000. I returned them both. This was not an apples-to-apples comparison, but close. I didn't play with the Nikon much when I realized how poorly it encoded video - soft, lacking in detail, and lots of visible encoding artifacts. The Sony was very attractive based on its specs, and I had high hopes for it. Unfortunately, it also had disappointing video performance. The Sony appears to use a shallow depth-of-field and so it relies heavily on its auto-focus to keep the subject sharp, near or far. However, the focus was slow, many times it would not focus on my intended subject. Even with stationary subjects, it would focus and then _lose_ focus. When it was in focus, the recording was lacking in detail and texture - I attribute this to noise reduction or the encoding smearing or smoothing them. The optical zoom worked while recording, but the microphone picks up the sound of the zoom motor. As a camera, the Sony was pretty good. It felt a little snappier than the Canon, the face detection locked in more robustly, and the smile detection worked and was fun to use. There is optical distortion on the left and right hand sides of the image. It tended to apply noise reduction very aggressively above ISO200, resulting in soft and smooth images. At IS0200 or less, the images were still softer than I'd like, and under bright daylight conditions, the colors were too saturated and a little unnatural for my taste. The flash was uneven. For standard mug shots, it exposed the subject well. For anything else, it was a crap shoot - either underexposing, or blowing out certain details of anything that was too close.The Canon SD 1300 surprisingly made far superior video recordings even though it only recorded at VGA (640x480). (Basically, the Sony's bigger numbers, 1280x720 vs 640x480, sadly didn't result in better quality.) I think it used a larger depth-of-field so more things were in focus. It never lost focus the way the Sony did, and when it had to refocus, such as going from near subject to far subject, it did so quickly. The encoding also retained much of the detail and texture. (And because it records only at VGA, it plays smoothly on my old computers.) In both cameras, exposure and white balance was very good. The video noise was comparable between the Sony and the Canon - a truly subjective opinion and a bit unexpected for the Canon. Unfortunately, you cannot operate the zoom while recording. Audio is mono, not stereo, but I don't think I matters because I find it hard to believe that you can get good stereo sound from two mics that are mounted as close as they are on these compact cameras.As a camera, the Canon was in many ways the opposite of the Sony: no optical distortion, very detailed and sharp at low ISO, reasonable at higher ISO, the flash was more even under all conditions. It didn't always recognize faces, but it still focused accurately. It doesn't have smile detection - not a big deal. It doesn't have a panorama mode - again, not a big deal. In both Sony and Canon cameras, I found the metering to be very good, and rarely blowing out highlights or shadows. Both were comparable at wide angle White balance was also very good. The camera starts up and focuses quickly. It's not as fast as my SLR, but good enough.I like the Canon's user interface, though it has some small issues. I appreciate the flexible playback modes: you can view the histogram and file info or zoom in. (I'm accustomed to doing this with my SLR to ensure good exposure and focus and make adjustments to my shooting if necessary.) The D-pad is multi-function with direct access to flash setting, timer, focus mode, and exposure compensation. I did wish I could substitute ISO setting for focus mode. Sometimes if I move too quickly or double tap a button, I end up in the general function menu instead of the direction specific ones or vice versa. However, I do appreciate all the functionality in the D-pad, I just have to be more deliberate. I like being able to set the volume for different sounds it uses. I like how it fades between pictures in playback mode.  I've accidentally turned on the camera in my pocket because the power on/off button is relatively large, raised, and easily depressed.At the time I bought this from Amazon (Dec'10), it was being sold at a great price so it was also very good value.

Reviews.Title: Great pics, but you definitely have to "pose"
Reviews.Author: BV
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the qualiy of pictures.  But there is a definite delay between pressing the button and the flash going off!  Happy with the camera!  Great price.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot
Reviews.Author: Erika Marti
Reviews.Content: We love this camera. It has picture and video capabilities and it's so easy to downoad to my computer. We get excellent quality of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Useful
Reviews.Author: LucyL
Reviews.Content: It's convenient and useful.I take it during my trip to LA and LV.To me any small camera is almost same.but this one, i think with a good price and quality.PS:You need to protect it very well,from crash and water.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: AshleyL
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Canon Powershot after my previous model Canon Powershot was stolen. After doing much research on the internet for a new camera to purchase, I ended right back at the Canon Powershot.  The reviews were great, it was highly ranked, & as a previous owner I figured I couldn't go wrong.  I love the quality of pictures this camera takes, especially the options available. I am very satisfied with my purchase and would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Shlomo
Reviews.Content: What a camera !! the pics are beautiful and the options are amazing , this is definitely the best of non-touch screen , digital camera.The design is also nice and the size is perfect .

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot, case recommendation
Reviews.Author: N. Lee
Reviews.Content: Im not going to review the merits of this point and shoot camera. Other reviews pretty much echo the pros and cons. We find it a great portable point and shoot camera. The "wide angle" aspect really makes pictures look like they are encompassing more area compared to my previous cameras. I would recommend that users looking for a small sleek and fitting case get the Caselogic UNZT-2. We got it and fits wonders. Check out my review on that product for more details. Caselogic UNZT-2 Compact Camera Case (Blue/Compressed Flower)

Reviews.Title: slim size w/ nice features
Reviews.Author: eranha
Reviews.Content: This camera is quite easy to use.  I like that this camera also fits in your pocket - this was especially handy when we were on a family trip - I could slip it into my shorts' pocket between shots (and keeping track of the kids), without it being too bulky.  I also like the zoom capabilities, and it's easy enough to use - even my kids can take nice shots with it. I've had the camera for a month now and am still pleased with this purchase. An extra feature that is fun, but not necessary is the baby blue hue. Oh, and with the purchase of this camera, I received a sturdy leather case and SD card free of charge.  This was a nice incentive, and I love this protectiveness the case provides - (I don't remember which case it is specifically, but it was around $14/$15 regularly).

Reviews.Title: great pictures  but now has problems
Reviews.Author: A. Tosky
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my daughter for a gradaution gift.  She had it for one week and the pictures were excellent.  She now has developed a problem with an S shaped image on the pictures that gets larger when you zoom.  it is not on the lens  so we have had to send the camera back to canon.  Have not got the camera back from them yet so do not know wha t the problem is.  I am sure it will be fixed but frustratin g that only one week in we developed a problem

Reviews.Title: Conventient and smart little camera!
Reviews.Author: J Thomp "drinkmorecoffee"
Reviews.Content: My Dad bought me this camera recently. I am a fifth grade teacher and the size is perfect to have for class trip and activites. I'm not a professional photographer, so the fact that it is so user-friendly is wonderful. The quality of the pictures is better than any point and shoot camera I've ever had. I bought a 4G card, and I have never come close to filling it up with pictures and video. My ideal camera is one that is easy to use, doesn't take up much space, and takes great photos quickly. This is the perfect camera for me!

Reviews.Title: i'm disappointed
Reviews.Author: mom in jersey
Reviews.Content: this is my 3rd canon camera and the first time i'm sorely disappointed. i had the sd800 is and it worked way better than the sd 1300is. my 2 chief complaints is that this camera is just SLOW to take pictures, and often takes BLURRY shots. it's extremely frustrating trying to catch shots of my 2 and 4 year olds. the build and feel of this camera is nice, but what is that worth if the pictures are bad?

Reviews.Title: Complete Garbage
Reviews.Author: P. Spalding
Reviews.Content: I don't know if this camera is defective, or the whole model line is bad.My 5 year old POS camera takes better photos than this.  All the pictures from Christmas morning are awful.  I used all the different settings (smart auto, program mode) nothing could take good pictures inside.I currently am trying to return this to amazon, but I waited past my window since we were on vacation...

Reviews.Title: Love the camera...Hate the seller
Reviews.Author: Brooke L. James "BJames"
Reviews.Content: The Canon Powershot is one of the easiest to use and most reliable cameras on the market.  The seller, however, was not so easy or reliable.  I bought the camera to replace one for a friend, who had already purchased one.  I never even opened the box and the company charged me a restocking fee!  Super lame.Buy the camera, just not from the seller I did.

Reviews.Title: Muy bueno.
Reviews.Author: Edwar
Reviews.Content: Muy buena camara, la entrega fue en la fecha indicada. la podia llevar a todos lados y tomar todas las fotos que quiera.

Reviews.Title: I would go no stars if I could
Reviews.Author: Gunni
Reviews.Content: This is the second elph I purchased, and both crap, shortly after buying the lens would stop retracting periodically, till finally stopped all together, same thing with my other elph sd450, I called Canon and guess what just out of warranty, then I researched a little on the web and low and behold seems tons of folks are having the same issue with these elph camera's, so now I am stuck with 2 dead camera's, I would recommend to stay clear of all this series of camera's, there all defective with no support from Canon.

Reviews.Title: shutter is butter
Reviews.Author: Becky s
Reviews.Content: I liked the pictures and it fit all my needs as far as backpacking places and taking great pictures.But be careful with never messing with the zoom and shutter because after 9 mos mine is broken but amazon was more than accommodating with my return. I then bought the elph 100 which has a bigger screen and better features to play with...go with the 100, its cheap and worth it and will see how the lens holds up.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Laura L. Stryker
Reviews.Content: This is my second Powershot Canon in 2 years. Both of these cameras have malfunctioned with the lens opening and closing. And as soon as you buy one the next is suppose to be better and more features for better pictures and zoom in ranges are closer with focusing improved. But don't buy Canon! The money for one year and then the hassle of dealing with the warranty is not worth the trouble.So I will not purchase another Canon and not another warranty with Square Trade!This camera will let you down at the worst moment for me Christmas Day. And now all the hoops I have to deal with to get my warranty purchase. SAVE EVERYTHING if you have bought this camera!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Was ok but stopped working
Reviews.Author: Darkside
Reviews.Content: Received about four months ago, was working good even though was not to happy with the picture quality especially indoors as I've always been a Canon fan up to now.  I still have an eleven year old Mini DV camera that works flawlessly however seems that their newer products are garbage.  The camera recently stopped working completely!  Thought maybe it was the battery had gone bad, tried putting in a new battery and still nothing.  The thing won't turn on at all.  Canon customer service was no help at all so pretty much it's going out in the trash tomorrow.  Thanks Canon.

Reviews.Title: Camera toast after 8 months
Reviews.Author: A Jones
Reviews.Content: Had this camera 8 mos. Turned it on and picture in LCD window double exposure, camera making funny little clicking noises, snapped picture to see what would happen and got no picture, just a milky sepia colored screen with some strange lines in it. I am really ticked off. $150 for a 6 month camera? Previously I had a PowerShot SD 400 (was fine) but got this because I wanted more MPs, I'm disgusted. Also the colors on this camera are horrible. Last but not least, there is NOWHERE to go to find out what might have caused this camera to go weird on me. I didn't drop it, didn't take it for a swim, and lightening did not hit it. Piece of junk. My next digital will NOT be a Canon.

Reviews.Title: GREAT RESULTS
Reviews.Author: Faroq Khan
Reviews.Content: I liked the camera. went to Dubai after I bought it and had wonderful results with the very handy camera.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is poor
Reviews.Author: Soupson
Reviews.Content: I had an sd850 that I really liked so when it died I bought the sd1300. I really think the picture quality is poor compared to other cameras. All my outdoor pictures are washed-out it doesn't matter what type of light they are taken in. The Color on the photos if awful, I'm very disappointed I guess I will not be buying a cannon again

Reviews.Title: Got bad camera twice
Reviews.Author: vishal
Reviews.Content: Ordered cannon digital camera , got the bad camera ( lens of camera got stuck immediate after starting it first time). Ordered the replacement for this bad camera. Got the camera again within time. But this second camera had the same problem.I want to order the same camera  again. But not confident that this time also i will get the defective camera. I will really appriciate Amazon, if they can test the camera and then ship it to me again.

Reviews.Title: Not that good of a deal after all
Reviews.Author: Damian S. Dunsmore
Reviews.Content: Disapointed by the lack of versatility for this camera.  I've come to expect at least moderate performance in low-light conditions, outdoors, etc. from the Elph line.  This let me down in any condition other than what would be considered 'optimal'.

Reviews.Title: Great quality for the price!
Reviews.Author: Twbrand
Reviews.Content: This camera worked beautifully. For the sale price, the images taken were fantastic. Is one of the higher end camera choices for the price range. My only complaint is the image on the LCD screen is horrible before the picture is taken. For example, the image is fuzzy, lights look like minature suns an the quality looks like it's from a 1.3 megapixel camera. However, once the photo is taken, the image is amazingly high quality and all of those problems go away. Overall, if you are looking for a simple and inexpensive camera, this is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Glad i got it
Reviews.Author: Claudia S
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new camera to replace my old Cannon and I'm pleased to have chosen this one. It is really easy to use for the basic features, but I'll need the manual to understand all of the camera's capabilities. It is great for day to day use, the zoom is fantastic and it is so small I now carry it everywhere with me. I found the images on the screen to be a little yellowish, but since I haven't printed any of them yet, I don't know if they'll turn out the same. Overall, a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Easy and practical
Reviews.Author: SGH
Reviews.Content: I love the brown color and that is really small and weightless. But the main reason I love this camera so much is the feature that allows you take pictures in low light.The only down side I found so far is although you can zoom when video recording it loses its focus.

Reviews.Title: cannon powershot minus memory stick
Reviews.Author: alleycat
Reviews.Content: I currently own a Cannon Powershot from 5 years ago and am still very pleased with it. So much so that I purchased this one for my daughter. Strangely enough, it does not come with a memory stick. My experience with digital cameras has been that a memory stick is always included; even a minimal one. So if you buy this camera, don't forget to buy the memory stick to go with it. Or go to Costco like I did so I wouldn't have to wait for delivery in 10 DAYS!!!!

Reviews.Title: photo quality is disappointed
Reviews.Author: Beagle Master
Reviews.Content: This is my first Canon camera. I bought this because of Amazon's promotion. The photo quality is not impressive at all -  the color is not sharp, which makes pictures looking "foggy". My old camera is the 7-year old Olympus-miu 300-pixel (I know it's like an "antique"), so after doing some online reviewing search, I thought maybe Canon is a good option to try something new. However, this Canon SD1300 gives me a negative impression toward Canon's camera; the color quality is not even close to my antique Olympus. The Olympus really produces very sharp color, presenting vivid pictures! I'm not sure whether current lines of Olympus still hold such quality, but I surely won't consider Canon camera again for awhile.Final thought: though I feel disappointed with the photo quality that this Canon SD1300 delivers, it's a good deal if you need an average camera - I bought it @ $109 with a free 4G SDHD memory card - still a good buy, I guess.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with video shooting in dark background
Reviews.Author: F. Sun "taurusmines"
