Very disappointed with Canon's quality now. Did the exchange through Amazon and the 2nd one has the identical issue. Well, it's on its way to Amazon thanks to Amazon's best return policy.

Reviews.Title: Multiple Issues.... Blur, lens and macro button
Reviews.Author: Kammy
Reviews.Content: I love Canon, usually.  But this camera didn't seem to preform as it should have.  I had delayed photos, which caused numerous blurred images right from the start.  I changed setting many times to see if I just set it wrong.  So night time images or low light, do not seem to turn out well.I ordered this camera  from Amazon and received a broken camera right out of the box.  It was replaced quickly and I enjoyed it for a short time before the Macro button stopped working.  And now, less than 6 months later, the lens keeps getting error messages.I am disappointed in the quality of this camera.  I owned a Canon SD 600 for years and was very happy with that.  It was much sturdier and dependable.  I am sad to say, this is not the best option out there for this price.

Reviews.Title: not impressed
Reviews.Author: Kevin Chan
Reviews.Content: I thought Sd1300 and Sd1400 uses the same lens/engineSd1400 image quality is noticeably better (though it has its own issues of blurry pics)Takes good picture in daylight but low light pics is below industry standard in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Miss my SD880
Reviews.Author: H.W.
Reviews.Content: Accidentally broken my Canon SD880IS, I was looking for sth to substitute. I though the SD1300 should be more developed than its ancestor. Yet I was proved wrong. The SD1300 qualifies for a mid-low level pocket cam: low price, light weight, wide angle and the pic is stabilized as described. But it is VERY inconvenient to use compared with SD880. The available program modes are much less than SD880: only portrait, night shot, kids&pets;, indoor. In the old 880 there are tons of others like beach, snow, sunset, as well as stitch etc. The knurled ring on SD880 is also handy for selecting  the best mode when outdoor. All these are missing in SD1300. Leaving just the cost-saving & cheap-looking plastic concept that is not designed to draw appreciation. It also seems tricky to me that the size of the 12M pics are all of file size around 2M when uploaded on PC, while my old 10M SD880 pic has average file size 4M. I would seriously consider buying something close to SD880 for double the price of SD1300, but I really could not find anything within the SD family at this moment.

Reviews.Title: Turns on in her purse
Reviews.Author: Seattle Matt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend and she does like it.  It's very easy to use and takes good pictures.  One thing I don't like is that hitting the play button (to view pictures) turns the camera on.  This button seems to be getting pushed in her purse (even in a soft case) and turns the camera on.  She is constantly finding the battery dead.  Also the screen, while large, is not very impressive.  Pictures always look crapping on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Excellent image
Reviews.Author: Michael T Boyd
Reviews.Content: I really like this for the picture quality that it takes.  I just wish that the camera came with the Canon leather hand bag that it recomends on the canon website.  Just look at it because it fits well and you will not regret buying something cheap quality for about the same price after shipping costs.

Reviews.Title: Dream Cam
Reviews.Author: K. Paul "TOPAZFIRE"
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. People have been telling me about Canon for years and I am sorry I didn't listen sooner! I will never go back to Kodack! We took pix out the car window while moving! They did not blur one bit and it looked like we were right in front of the things we were snapping, instead of hundreds of feet away. Thanks so much Canon!

Reviews.Title: Didn't like a much a the Cannon SD1100
Reviews.Author: Buyer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after losing my camera on a trip - (Accidentally threw it away) I wanted another Canon since all my cameras are and have been.  This camera is ok - The night shots are not as good as the 1100..  I do not like the box that comes up around faces - throws me off when I'm trying to take pic b/c it is not always centered on what I want..  It's a good camera to keep in your pocketbook for when you need that pic.  I keep my digital rebel for the moments I really need good shots.  All in all - Satisfied - I have taken some really nice pictures w/it.

Reviews.Title: Review of Cannon PowerShot SD1300IS 12 MP with 4X OpZoom
Reviews.Author: MV_Florida
Reviews.Content: Okay, so bottom line - overall, its just average. Which is very disappointing for the price that I paid for it.I had a Cannon PowerShot SD720 - that thing was amazing, bought it right when it came out, never had any issues, best pictures, etc...Then one day my friend dropped it down several feet onto concrete. All good things must come to an end, right?Now I had a Fuji Film prior to my Cannon PowerShot, and I was so impressed with Cannon that I knew that there was no competition as to what brand of camera I was going to purchase as a replacement.After doing a lot of research and trying to keep within my budget I decided on the Cannon PowerShot SD1300IS.Pros: Cannon's durability, Bright Cool Camera Colors, 12 MP, crisp images, program modes [especially helpful for indoor or night time shots], rechargeable battery.Cons: 3x Optical Zoom (competitors for a lower price exceeded this), slow to take shots (delayed), frustrating wait time while changing programs.It doesn't compare to my previous Cannon, though its new perks make it fun. If I had to do it all again, I should have gone with a Nikon or waited for another PowerShot to go down in price. But that's what Black Friday is for, right?Its a pretty average camera for a very above average price. For me, it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: S. Thompson "HappyMom"
Reviews.Content: I did some research before purchasing this camera.  Amazon had the best price on the internet and Amazon has been GREAT to deal with- as I returned the camera.The camera was sleek and simple enough to use for basic picture taking.  However, as the mother of a one year old, I need a camera that captures pictures of action.  (What one year old sits still for longer than 2 seconds?)  I could not capture clear pictures when my son was the move.  My husband felt that the zoom feature was slow also.Going back to another Kodak model.

Reviews.Title: Love my new camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Chen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before studying abroad in Europe. I wanted something small, but still takes excellent pictures. This camera is fulfilling my two criteria. Love it!

Reviews.Title: very disappointing outside shots
Reviews.Author: Wold
Reviews.Content: I had a previous canon powershot that was great for hiking trips and captured nature scenes very nicely, but it finally broke down. I bought this camera a few months ago and had the first chance to really use it outdoors in Maine on hiking trips. It was extremely disappointing. The camera was unable to capture the scenery in a realistic way. Some specific examples: while hiking in Acadia, there are many views of the ocean that are obvious to the eye. The camera did not capture the ocean in the distance, but whitened it out in many cases. Again, hiking around the Beehive on Mt Desert Island, there were many brilliant views of the pink granite cliffs. The camera produced dull views. Finally, on top of Sergeant and Gorham mountains and other vantage points there are great distant views of oceans and islands-- all washed out. The whole point of this camera was therefore lost for me.  I can't recommend this for outside shots, but it seems to work ok for indoor shots.

Reviews.Title: Nothing like a Canon!
Reviews.Author: Mr Blister "Mr. S"
Reviews.Content: Having owned many of these canons, I can say that by far they beat the Sony and other models. They are easy to use, take great pictures without having to fiddle with settings, and in general offer a non pro a great lightweight option.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD1300
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey H. Arkley "Kiwipop"
Reviews.Content: Optical image stabilization works WAY! better than digital does. Very happy with my change from Sony. Purchased eight Sony's and my Son convinced me to try Canon this time. Glad I did.

Reviews.Title: This camera takes lousy pictures.
Reviews.Author: Chittapoo Usnabhiraks
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for about 6 months now.  I have to say that i am very disappointed.  I previously owned 2 earlier version of Canon Powershot SD series.  They were great.  This one take bad pictures in low lighting.  It works well out in the sunlight, but if you try to take pictures indoor or at night, the color is off.  The point-and-shoot camera should take acceptable picture with everything set to auto/default.  This one does not.  I probably will buy a different one soon.

Reviews.Title: Keep Looking
Reviews.Author: Brian Walker
Reviews.Content: Lasted about 2 months and then got the lens error I now see everyone else talking about. Mine won't retract. I should have read the reviews. It's also slow but pictures seemed OK (the few that I took). Don't buy it, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Check out Wal-Mart online!!
Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: I was looking at this camera online at walmart.com and want to tell you the price there is the best so far.I haven't anything to say good or bad about this camera, just shareing the info of where to look.

Reviews.Author: SD Cook "SD Cook"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes horrible pictures. I got it to throw in my purse. We took it on our out of town getaway and am so disappointed in the quality of pics this camera takes. My iPhone 4 takes way better pics. I wish I could return it, because, I would. Save your money and put it toward a better quality camera.

Reviews.Title: A Pretty Paperweight: The Dreaded Lens Error Strikes
Reviews.Author: Christopher Owen Sieber
Reviews.Content: I purchased the light blue Canon SD1300IS for my wife as a gift. A few months later, it spills from her purse on to our kitchen table. We experience the dreaded, and apparently common, fatal LENS ERROR.Scouring the internet reveals accounts of this error too numerous to count.I regret buying this fragile camera, and the repair will cost nearly as much as rebuying. Perhaps that is the business model after all? Let the buyer beware, lest you bump your camera or a hearty gust of wind puts your lens into error mode as well.

Reviews.Title: Very pretty, but not very fast
Reviews.Author: Crazy Cat Lady
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to get a new multi-purpose point and shoot that would replace an old one with a broken zoom, but this one only serves half the purposes I wanted. The colors turn out great for a little camera, but it's very prone to blurry pictures if you just move a little bit. So it's nice for landscape pictures and still pictures of people, but if you're trying to capture a moment when anyone or anything is the least bit moving, better try a different camera. I was mostly attracted to the exterior of the camera; it's very sleek and easy to use. There aren't too many features, but then again, there are fewer unused buttons. All and all a mixed review.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1300IS
Reviews.Author: Thaddeus Ferrer
Reviews.Content: I have not used the product very much yet, but I was very satisfied with the previous two models I have of the Canon PowerShot.  What I like about the old models before was it used only two AA batteries.  This one has it's own charger (since it is an elph -- tiny), so I have to make sure I bring the charger with me when I use it extensively.

Reviews.Title: Luck of the draw
Reviews.Author: Joseph Skidmore
Reviews.Content: This camera was supposed to be a Christmas gift.  We opened it Christmas Eve and charged the (camera specific) battery so we could use it Christmas morning.  After the battery finished charging (about an hour and a half) we turned on the camera to take practice shots.  The lens came out and the screen went blank and told us that there was a shutter error and it was going to restart.The shutter was stuck in the out position and would not go back in.  After a few tries we decided to exchange it for another one.  The following Monday (just in time to miss great photo opportunities with my daughters first Christmas) a new one arrived and did the exact same thing.  At least it happened before we got attached.  Sorry Cannon, you lose.

Reviews.Title: very dissapointed
Reviews.Author: davjau "davjau"
Reviews.Content: Extremely dissapointed with the quality of photos.  Did an extreme amount of researching because I was trying to find a basic point and shoot to accompany my Nikon SLR but this definitely doesn't fit the bill.  I sent this back after 2 days.I went with the Panasonic FP-1.  Cheaper, better quality, and surprisingly does well.  Don't waste your time on this or be fooled by the brand name.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but Don't Drop it
Reviews.Author: Chloe
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. The image quality is fantastic and I love the picture settings. However, I dropped it once and the whole left side of the touch screen stopped working. I had to send it in for repair which ended up costing $160. If you've got the warranty, great. If not, be careful with it or don't buy a touch screen.

Reviews.Title: flash problem
Reviews.Author: anichak
Reviews.Content: i brought this camera for my brother. the camera looks great and has nice features. but indoor photography is awful. any photo taken in flash comes out with a nasty yellow tint. the processor cannot render correct white balance, sharpness and color

Reviews.Title: Im not a big fan...
Reviews.Author: annac
Reviews.Content: Im not a big fan of this camera and will be returning it.My main complaint is that because the power button is not recessed - but actually sticks up a bit - the camera turns on inside a purse or pocket (even while in a case).  Because of this, the lens extends while in the case and this actually caused the lens to get stuck and the camera to stop operating.I also didnt think the image stabilization was that great.  Some pictures came out blurry with unsteady hands.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Unhappy Grandmom
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but I felt this item deserved one.This camera is a HUGE disappointment.  I bought this for my daughter in the States, to take pictures of my first grandson since we are in the military, stationed in Belgium.  Within day of receiving this camera it suddenly stopped working for no apparent reason, she was able to return it and have it repaired which was great, now 3 months later the camera has stopped working again, it fell of the couch, approx. 1 ft to the floor, landed on a carpet and the metal around the lens dented.  Now the camera wont work.  Doesnt sound like a very durable camera to me! The picture quality is great, battery life seems okay but COME ON!, cameras should be able to take a little tumble on to a soft carpet without breaking!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I've had 2 Kodak Easyshare cameras for years, that have held up to traveling half way around the world, shoved into jean pockets by teenagers, thousands of pictures, tumbles, drops, bangs etc....  the quality of the photos may not be quite as sharp as the new Cannon but at least they are reliable and durable.

Reviews.Title: Almost a good camera
Reviews.Author: Mike "TruthLover"
Reviews.Content: This camera has quality construction, feels solid and heavy for the size, and it seems to work good. But I took several pictures indoors and out and the pictures are not good and clear. They appear reasonably clear to the untrained eye but when you zoom in to 100%, which is how it will be when you make a print from the digital images, it is not clear and sharp. Unless you are a kid taking pictures of your dog, this is not the camera you want. I took it back to office depot where I bought it on sale last week for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Order from PCNation
Reviews.Author: Meritt
Reviews.Content: Do not order from PC Nation. They have the most restrictive return policies ever: you have to request a return approval; they charge you a 15% return processing fee; they will not recoup the full amount paid if the item is now on-sale; they require you to ship via UPS or FedEx, which is expensive; and they give you a small window of time once you've put in your return request to actually send in the item. I received this item as a gift and am now basically stuck with it thanks to PC Nation/Amazon. I'm done with both!

Reviews.Title: Dead After 8 Days
Reviews.Author: W. Choi "zinja"
Reviews.Content: I have had this item for 8 days.  During this time I have taken pictures and videos for only 5 days.  Today tried to turn the unit on and it made a beeping noise and gave a "lens error" and then shut down.  I recharged the batteries and looked for a few fixes online, including the vendor website.  All diagnosis point to this unit being dead and needing repair (after 8 days!).  I am returning this unit to Amazon and am going to try my hand at a Lumix for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: Don't like this camera!
Reviews.Author: JB ""Jessica""
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace the older version of this camera since my original one broke.  So frustrated with this camera.  Auto mode is terrible - too slow to focus on subject, color is always off and lots of blurry and grainy photos.  I've been trying to learn how to use the program settings, but that takes too long when trying to capture buys kids on camera.  Outdoor shots are okay, but indoor are terrible.  I want to throw this camera away and not even consider canon again.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Noisy images - Nuf said!
Reviews.Author: Tanvi B. Shah "vegan princess"
Reviews.Content: Extremely nosiy images even in good light with and/or without flash - and in auto modes as well. I do not expect this of a Canon model. And I saw the same issue with not one - but two units. Bah! The search for a decent point and shoot continues.

Reviews.Title: Will not buy a Canon Again
Reviews.Author: trail
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mid 2010.  I was very exited to have bought it.  I paid over $200 for it.  The camera broke in early 2012.  I only used it three times from the time I bough it on vacation trips.  I called Canon and they told me the camera only had a one year warranty.  I now understand why they only carry a one year warranty.  They are not good products.  I will never buy a Canon again.

Reviews.Title: Does not work
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Camera shuts off after about a minute with an error message.  I called a camera repair and it will cost me as much as the camera to get repaired.  I did some research and it seems to be a common problem with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nothing fancy,just a really nice camera.
Reviews.Author: jamestime1 "J.H."
Reviews.Content: This camera is just a nice, was not really looking for anything fancy but very very happy with this product know shots at night yet but can't wait.

Reviews.Title: OK.
Reviews.Author: Rubberduckysabc
Reviews.Content: This Camera is ok.  And when i mean ok i mean ok.  My iphone 4 has a better camera than this one and my phone was only a little bit more than the camera money wise.  This camera has a slow shutter lag.  Maybe 3 seconds.  If you are looking for a cheep camera to get the job done and not high quality photos this is your camera.  Has a decent flash.  Should be a great first camera For kids.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, if only it wouldn't break!
Reviews.Author: ssalava
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera but it is unreliable.  It continues to malfunction and after returning the first one as defective for a replacement, now the second one is acting up.  We've used instructions from Canon's website  […] to fix it initially but it's just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: A Delusion for Canon
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I love Canon as a brand. I have owned various Canon Powershot Cameras so far. The previous one I had was a SD 400 which I loved. Unfortunately, we had to bury it cause my 2 year old slammed it to the floor and broke the lens. I thought the newer model would have what my beloved SD400 had and more; but NO, that wasn't the case. I am used to carrying my camera in my pocket and take pictures of my bouncing little one whenever I see a cute pose. This one has a great design and smooth surface and buttons and interface are very advanced just as expected from a Canon. But the quality of the body plastic is poor this time, it gets nicks and scratches from just being in my pocket and believe me I don't carry it in the same pocket with my keys or any other hard object. Focusing was a big issue for me. I could do careless snapshots with my SD400 and they all came beautifully sharp and clear. With this one I spend time to sit and focus and most are blurry or grainy. I also use macro a lot.  I had to press the button a million times before I could get a focused and detailed close-up shot. Like I said, when I purchased it I was relying on the ongoing trust for the Canon brand but I think this is a miss.

Reviews.Title: not very reliable
Reviews.Author: L. luttrell
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a Christmas gift because of the revues and the canon record of reliability. It worked as advertised for a short while, but after it sat dormant for a couple of weeks, refused to turn itself on again. Made sure the battery was charged, even tried a new battery, but no action. Now I'm stuck with 2 new batteries for a camera that I thought would be a member of our family for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Not buying Canon again
Reviews.Author: M. Santiago "Mr Dynamite"
Reviews.Content: I had one Canon a while back and it worked very well, until I broke the LCD screen by leaving it in a backpack. That was a good camera. I bought this one and was completely disappointed. Why?- Camera looks like a toy. It is very ugly and the color on it fades quickly, making it look old.- It is bigger than my OLDER model. How did this happen?- Lens got stuck after a couple of months of use and now I have an expensive paper weight. Apparently this happens to a lot of canon cameras and they don't offer warranty on this specific problem.- Buttons are not placed well. The on/off button tends to press itself if you put the camera in your pocket. So the camera tries to turn on and pushes the lens against your pocket. Not good.

Reviews.Title: Cute--But Program SUCKS!!!!
Reviews.Author: justjess
Reviews.Content: Not the camera I would have chosen, but since it was a gift and I needed a camera badly and after being laid off couldn't afford one... I am happy enough.Upon opening it I was very upset there was no memory card, I mean come on really? How lazy and cheap are you Canon?? Go the extra mile and customers will come back.Secondly, the first time I uploaded pictures I was unexpectedly pulled away and left the camera on. Instead of shutting off after a while it sat there and drained it's battery. Which I do love that it as it's own rechargeable vs. going through batteries or constantly screwing with a regular battery charger.I am not sure what they were thinking when they designed the program to get the pictures off the camera, but what a joke!! I used to have a Kodak Easy Share camera(which I lost, but plan on replacing ASAP) and the first time I plugged it in to upload pictures it was easy, I never even glanced at the directions. Working with this program is like trying to read another language to me. It is not even remotely user friendly. I find it to be a big pain in the ass. I dread uploading photos!! I uploaded all my photos, and thinking they were safe on the computer, I clicked "delete pictures on camera", since I could only afford a 1 GB card. All my photos are forever gone.I am impaired when it comes to technology, so for me this camera is a waste of money and time. It will probably take me hours of reading this stupid manual and still the program will be hard to use. For such a cute little camera it is too bad the program is absolute crap.Last Canon I will EVER own!!!

Reviews.Title: Don't see how this can be so highly rated
Reviews.Author: gmashoff
Reviews.Content: I returned this camera. I bought it, based on the reviews here, as a camera for travel and snapshot use (my primary camera is a digital SLR). Good shots in auto mode were most important to me due to its intended purpose. Unfortunately this camera often takes terrible pictures in auto mode, especially indoors. It often has trouble focusing, especially with the face detection mode if further than a few feet away; if the flash didn't go off the white balance was horrible; if it did, the picture was very washed out. Most of the pictures taken indoors turned out blurry, out of focus and yellow tinted.Although I am probably pickier about picture quality then the average snap shooter, I can't imagine anyone being happy with the photos that resulted. Others here have made similar comments. Maybe we all just got defective ones.On the plus side: it takes decent pictures using the P (program) mode and in natural daylight using Auto mode. The macro setting takes incredibly detailed pictures. It is very small (easily fits in pocket or purse) and yet all the buttons are large enough to operate easily. The menus and settings are easy to navigate. It also takes fairly good quality video if the lighting is good (although you can't zoom during video shooting).

Reviews.Title: Good camera not so good battery
Reviews.Author: Ronald sanderson
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera which takes excellant pictures with or without the zoom which is good. However the battery only takes about a 100 pictures before having to be recharged. Our old camera with AAA bateries would take up to 500 pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera; some focus problems
Reviews.Author: D. Staas
Reviews.Content: Has some problems with autofocus; some pictures are out of focus.  This is noticeably worse than the last Canon point-and-shoot we owned.  Otherwise, it's great -- the shots that are in focus are good, and the flash does a good job.  Specialized battery (does not take AA form factor batteries), but it is replaceable/removable.  The size of the camera is great.  Very fast powerup; you can take pictures almost instantly after turning the camera on.  Video quality is remarkably good.  If it weren't for the autofocus problem, it'd get 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: SD1300
Reviews.Author: Frank Lee
Reviews.Content: Had a unrecoverable lens error after the first use. Returned to Canon and they replaced it with another camera. Otherwise, it is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Hmmmmmmm
Reviews.Author: BL
Reviews.Content: The seller got the product shipped, and there were no problems.  I've had a Canon camera before and just loved the pictures.  This camera disappointed me.  The pictures are not as vibrant and sharp as I expected them to be.  Of course the camera arrived 1 day before my vacation, so I did not have a chance to test it out. So needless to say, my vacation photos are just plain flat.  Maybe I should of spent another $40-50 for a better one.

Reviews.Title: Cannot zoom, pictures is grainy, low qualify even with max resolution setting, video is off color and also can't zoom
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: I have had Canon, and this is the worst.  The pictures are very oft-color, the background would be greenish even if taken in a room full of yellow lamp.  When zoomed in to subject, the pictures get blurry right away, even at 2x or 3x zoom.  Past Canon produced sharp pictures at low level zoom but this one give blurry pictures every time.the same thing with video, if I zoom in just a little bit, the video becomes blurry.  Also, at auto setting, the video looks like it is shooting in a low light environ even if the room is actually in full sunlight.  Something is wrong with the color setting of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love my Canon Powershot.
Reviews.Author: mw "mw"
Reviews.Content: My daughter had been through a camera she did not like and therefore researched before purchasing the Canon Powershot.  I took her recommendation and love this camera!  User friendly, versitile, dependable.  Movie clips are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Good Quality
Reviews.Author: King Leonidas
Reviews.Content: Over the years I am owned may cameras, but this one bets them all.  It has very good picture quality and works extremely well in dim light.

Reviews.Title: Very poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: JoHa
Reviews.Content: I carefully read several reviews for this camera and most were positive.  I wanted a small camera with average picture quality. This camera does not take very good pictures at all.  It makes poor choices about lighting, flash, focus, "film" speed/grain, aperture, and exposure on auto.  The manual mode is slightly better but still provides many out of focus or fuzzy pictures.  I don't know if I have a bum camera or what, but I'm going to replace it soon.  I have previously owned the Cannon Powershot A630 and loved it.  Beautiful pictures every time.  It broke after multiple drops on concrete (not Cannon's fault).  Before that I owned Sony and Olympus point and shoot type cameras.  Both were ok but did not compare to PowerShot.  It would seem that not all Cannons have the same quality standard where it counts, picture clarity, every time for the moments that cannot be repeated.

Reviews.Title: Be Aware--No printed manual comes with the camera
Reviews.Author: slshopper
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera a few days ago to serve as a back-up camera for me while I send my Canon SD870IS out for service as well as be something my daughter can use as she gets more involved in taking her own photos.  So far, this seems to be a pretty good camera and many of the features I was already used to using on my other Canon are there, but some are not as easy to locate as they are on the SD870.  That's where reading the detailed 148-page users manual will come in handy.  Unfortunately, despite reading quite a few positive reviews about the camera before purchasing it, I never noticed anyone mention the fact that Canon is no longer providing the PRINTED copy of the 148-page users manual in the box.  It's great that it is provided on a CD and is easily loaded to your computer, particularly when you have misplaced the printed copy and need to look something up, but that's not very convenient for when you are a new owner and are trying to learn to use the camera or don't have access to your computer and need to find out how to do something. I definitely want to have a printed copy of the manual, so I now have to decide if I am going to print it myself or buy a copy of the manual from someone online who sells camera manuals.  This is an unexpected expense and unexpected delay in getting up to speed on taking advantage of the capabilities of the camera.  It's only been 2 1/2 years since I bought my last Canon camera--and it came with a printed manual--so I was not aware of this obvious cost-cutting step that Canon has taken with it products.  I'm still glad that I have the camera, but I don't appreciate having to get my own copy of the printed manual.  I would have preferred to pay a bit more for the camera in order to have the manual there in the box.  FYI...If you lose the Canon CD that your manual is on and no longer have it on your computer, you can download the manual from the Canon web site and can read it online just fine, but if you have to print it out from a download you get from the Canon web site it will print with the word 'COPY' in a medium-gray color across each page.  You can, however read through the medium-gray 'COPY'.

Reviews.Title: can i do better for $200?
Reviews.Author: Jason "Jason"
Reviews.Content: I get that this is a compact point & shoot, and i'm not a photographer, I don't own an SLR. This is my nicest camera. I had a canon before and loved it, but this one seems to consistantly give me blotchy skin tones, poor portraits, and makes editing some of the basic features (red eye, exp) harder to get to than the old one. I find myself fussing with them constantly and never getting the desired shot in certain lighting.Not sure if this is standard fair with higher MP camera's- you see the blemishes better and the fine settings are more important? I don't know. I will be going back to return it and give the Nikon S570 a try. Hoping for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: Takes good pictures when it focuses and DO NOT DROP!
Reviews.Author: Hmmm....
Reviews.Content: When it focuses, the camera takes good pictures. However, a lot of the time it thinks I want to take a picture of a "flower" and my images won't focus. I'm not even close to the subject. This is my second Canon Powershot SD....IS camera. I like the size. It's my second camera because the first one I was on a trip and asked a person to take a picture of our group and when they gave the camera back to me, dropped it. The lens was out and bent, it would have cost $150 to fix it...the camera costs that much! So, I ordered another one, a newer model. Took it to a party, asked a friend to take our picture, he dropped the camera on the wood floor from about 4 feet and presto...the lens is bent, won't go back in and I know the drill...right! Either have to buy ANOTHER one of these cameras or move on to something more durable! So frustrating!!!

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: tloh88
Reviews.Content: no problems.  the only thing disappointing was that the batteries from my previous powershot camera didn't fit into he new camera.  i'm sure thse have gotten better over a couple of years.  i spend $80/ea and got two for the last camera and now they are obsolete.  now i have a hand full of older digital cameras that are too expansive to fix.  what to do w/ them?

Reviews.Title: good but check other sites too
Reviews.Author: aks
Reviews.Content: Great handy camera you would wanna carry with you everywhere, only drag for me is the price went down by $40 just a few days after a bought it.

Reviews.Title: Okay, but....
Reviews.Author: K. Mara Piel "mara99"
Reviews.Content: I will make this short and sweet. I bought this mostly to take pictures of my kids, including twin toddlers. It takes so long to take a picture mostly I get pictures of the back of their heads or sometimes it is so slow they aren't in the shot at all. It is lightweight and does great for my 8 yo when she wants her picture taken but if you have moving targets, don't even try this camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera i not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Tau
Reviews.Content: It is an okay camera. Not to my expectation with clarity of pictures. Can take a lot of blurry pictures and the pictures  aren't the best quality.

Reviews.Title: average camera
Reviews.Author: Susan L Elbertson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a second to my kosak that ihave had for 8 years because of the wide angle lense. No difference at all. Color quality does not compare to my modal. Both cameras are of point and shoot types.

Reviews.Title: Great, simple camera
Reviews.Author: Ms. S
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, great buy... cheap, but so simple and effective. It takes quick, crisp pictures. Perfect for concerts.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Image quality
Reviews.Author: Viet Le
Reviews.Content: I bought the SD1000, and SD1100. Love the first two. Got the SD1300 for my parents, and the facial features are blurry. Actually, anything that's fine featured or delicate will be blurry. Images taken via holding or on a tripod, similar results. Don't know what they did to cheap out on the lens, but it's crap! SD1000 or the SD1100 is far superior to this new one.Very disappointed in Cannon. I've bought 5 cannons in a roll before this one. My next purchase will be Nikon. If a camera yields bad photos, it's a bad product, no matter how good it looks or how well it's built. Hence the 1 star.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Arun
Reviews.Content: A pretty good camera in this price range. Photos were nice but are not exceptional compared to other cameras in same range..

Reviews.Title: The worst point and shoot I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: Felicia Hart
Reviews.Content: I have owned Canon cameras before. They were always wonderful! I know two people that have this exact same camera as me and have the exact same issues.I have read the manual which is dreadfully vague.I get red in the corner of a lot of my pictures (not fixable. Even went to a camera shop to get them to try to fix it.)VERY slow shutter speed!  (Unless you are outside and it is on continuous)Blurry pictures occur way to often.This camera had good reviews and it was a canon so I bought it. Not a good choice on my part. It seems to me thatCanon is just making garbage now and using their good name to sell their garbage. I know a lot of people that own Canon SLR cameras that are breaking easy. Be careful everyone on buying future Canon's.

Reviews.Title: Poor Photos
Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the high ratings for this camera. My 4 1/2 year old Sony DSC-W5 at 1MP takes better photos than the SD1300 at 12MP. I tried both the Smart Auto and Programmed AE modes.Indoor photos with and without flash are washed out compared to the scene and what the DSC-W5 captured using the same field of view. The W5 produced sharper, better focused pictures than the Canon SD1300. Outdoor daylight color balance also seems to be off compared to the W5.The mode switch is difficult to operate, it is very easy to go from Smart Auto to Movie mode when you are trying to switch to the Programmed mode.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera Review
Reviews.Author: razzledazzle
Reviews.Content: The shipping was fast and the computer came in good condition with all the listed pieces included.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD 1300IS
Reviews.Author: M. Wehrenberg
Reviews.Content: First of all, the camera did not arrive when specified so I phoned Amazon customer service whereupon they sent me another camera expedited shipping immediately.  The replaced camera arrived in 2 days (I have still not received the original ordered camera to this date)  so,  can only deduce the camera was lost in the mail.  Delivery by both methods was USPS.I really like this camera.  The photos are beautiful and the camera is easy to use.  I like the silvery blue color of the camera as well.  It is light and I take it everywhere for superb shots.Amazon customer service is truly concerned for your satisfaction and I felt went the extra mile to make sure my case was taken care of -- to my delight!

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: sree
Reviews.Content: This is one of the Worst ever camera i had,  I had a CANON REBEL XTI DSLR camera which i am using from last 6 yrs. and i bought this camera for my pocket in time shoot as i can't carry my CANON DSLR all the time, coz it's bulky.. This camera sucks in photograps, i did not get any clear photos until today,  after using it for one month,  zoom and shutter stopped working.  i have no choice to buy a new camera again.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot SD1300IS
Reviews.Author: Barbara Lefcowitz
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that the above camera came with no memory card, which I had to purchase separately.  Nothing about this was noted in the Amazon information. Quite misleading.

Reviews.Title: Cute but worthless
Reviews.Author: JW
Reviews.Content: Well I am back on Amazon hoping for better luck in the camera department. After buying this one in the chocolate brown, I thought it looked great and very stylish. It worked fairly well the first dozen times I used it for a basic point and shoot but I did have a lot of frustration with blurred pictures. A LOT. But what really made me feel like I wasted money on a cheap toy was when my friend accidentally dinged the lens and it was forever broken from such a minor scrape up. It gave the Lens Error warning and wouldn't open from that day on. She felt so bad, she replaced the camera for me and not but two weeks later as I was taking it out of my purse I dropped it on the table I was sitting at. Not even 4 inches at most and once again there goes the Lens Error message and it was actually bent. WOW. unless you hope to keep this camera in a glass box surrounded by soft cotton, I would say don't bother. My old camera took way more abuse and lasted 2 years...no more Canon cameras for this girl.

Reviews.Title: clanlon review
Reviews.Author: James S. Flannery
Reviews.Content: Good value.  Better than the brick and mortar.  First Canon I had lasted 6 years so hopefully this one will do better.

Reviews.Title: It is good, however, I have losted thirty dollar
Reviews.Author: Jacky Tang
Reviews.Content: Frankly, it is good thing, which is cute, works well.However, after several days later I received it, the price has droppedalmost thirty dollar, now that I have only bought it with 120 dollars.Sigh........

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: TPippin
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera fast, and got this one, it is nice and gives nice quality pictures, the only thing I think could improve is the shutter speed, other than that it is great!

Reviews.Title: the camera is just OK, but the service from Amazon is nice.
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I returned this camera immedeately after I received. It was said to be 18 shooting modes with the camera. However,I could just find. The LCD seemd not as good as my "old" canon SD880 IS, which I have loved a lot. Also, the outer shell of the camera was made of a kind of plastic, instead of metal. It is a cheap camera, so do not expect too much of this one.Anyway, the return service from Amazon was awesome. I got all my refund shortly.

Reviews.Title: replacement
Reviews.Author: redfrog
Reviews.Content: gave 1100 to daughter this one is a little better to view the screen but it really doesnt seem as rugged as its shell is aluminum as compared to stainless in the older model

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: Brooke's mom "Erin"
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot camera. Easy to use, great pictures and I love the blue.  Very cute and sleek.

Reviews.Title: Sad offering from Canon.  Some Executive should be fired
Reviews.Author: dnoyeB
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my girlfriend because my previous Canon camera performed incredibly.  Why spend time hunting and evaluating stats.  Its a Canon, and its adjustable.  Make the purchase.Wow, what a mistake!This camera takes worse pictures than the scrap Samsung I let my son play with.1. It can't light a scene properly.  Looks like it requires too much light so it always flashes and washes stuff out.  Or it can't meter its flash or something.2.  It colorizes things weirdly and inconsistently within a single frame.  Turned me and my GF on the red side (we are Black people.  She is dark and I am light.)3.  Colorized a patch of light that was shining on a wall behind the subject.  Took me a while to figure out why the wall had that strange blob on it.  Then I could see the light shining on the wall there.  Don't know why it did that.4.  Screen update is choppy.  This must use a very underpowered CPU.  The screen update is VERY slow and choppy and just not what I expect from a +$100 camera.5.  ISO adjustment used to be a top level menu/button choice.  Now its buried in a sub-menu and not obvious to find.After experiencing all of this crap from a camera that should have been top notch, I went looking for the mark of the beast.  Wouldn't you know it!  My previous camera was made in Japan.  Guess where this one is made!?

Reviews.Title: Second Canon Powershot with Lens failure ??
Reviews.Author: H. White
Reviews.Content: My SD 1200 had a lens failure at 9 months old, it took some back and forth but Canon did repair it under warranty.  Now my daughters SD 1300 had a lens failure 2 weeks into a 4 week trip in Italy, so no camera for 2 weeks of her trip, it was 6 months old.  Canon would not repair under warranty, they want $100 because the lens was 'bent or loose', being a compact I am not sure how the lens would get bent, there were no signs of a drop, being loose should have been covered.Updated 3-8-11Since at the time Canon would not agreed to repair the camera I asked to have it sent back to me, in it's place they sent back a refurbished camera same model and color which satisfied me. I suppose the break down in part was the CSRs read the repair report, it said bent or loose lens not covered so that's the answer I got when I called in. Maybe after my third call in on the subject someone looked at the camera again and decided either it should have been fixed or it was a good will gesture, either way I feel Canon did the right thing.I retract my 'Do not buy' statement.

Reviews.Title: It's Canon...it's good!
Reviews.Author: B. Newport
Reviews.Content: Bought this Canon because...well, because I like Canon products.  My other Canon Digial Elph was taken on my last trip to the UK. This one will be used for the same purpose this summer.  The photos are exceptional....and it is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: canon camera
Reviews.Author: David M. Wilson
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived quickly and was in fine condition.  Took a few pictures, and am pleased.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD 1300IS
Reviews.Author: J. Pecoroni "John"
Reviews.Content: This is a very small camera.  It is the first one I have had without a view finder.  It takes a while to get use to taking pictures without a view finder.It takes great pictures even in low light.This camera does not come with a flash card.  I bought an 8 gig flash card at Radio Shack.

Reviews.Title: David slays Goliath
Reviews.Author: Jess Duboy Inc. "Jess Duboy"
Reviews.Content: The first camera I ever remember was a Kodak Brownee. Tells you how old I am, huh? As my kids grew through their early years at home, an Argus C3 was my mate. Nothing automatic on these cameras. I could set my camera to produce what I could see in my mind. Never using a light meter, I missed the mark sometimes, but other times my efforts resulted in astonishingly original photos that captured the beauty or the love or the pathos of the moment. All these years later, my Cannon (fully automatic) seldom lets me down. It has a David price with a Goliath delivery in clarity and texture. In my novel "Wings of Forever", on the covers and on many interior pages are images captured by this camera. I could have paid several hundred dollars more, but I'm glad I didn't. It just wasn't needed.Author Jess DuboyWings of Forever

Reviews.Title: Horrible focus, produced blurry pictures time after time
Reviews.Author: K. Clark
Reviews.Content: We had this camera throughout the holiday season and could not get it to produce clear pictures but a handful of times. I am a professional photographer and am used to manually adjusting my SLR settings as I go. I figured with a quick point and shoot I could use the auto mode no problem but boy was I wrong. This camera was aweful and not even worth the sale price I got it at. The flash was underwhelming and the pictures never had a crispness to them. Needless to say I returned it before it was too late. I'm thinking of trying a Lumix instead.

Reviews.Title: Horrible product
Reviews.Author: DJJ
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera as a replacement for an older Canon Powershot the day before going on a trip. ALL the pictures came out blurry...really, really disappointing. I have since taken the same exact photo with this camera and the old one - its like night and day. Everything is either slightly out of focus or blurry - and its not user error! Just not sure how Canon can sell this shoddy quality equipment. Worst experience ever - never buying Canon again.

Reviews.Title: No Memory card???
Reviews.Author: Dave Wilson "and Gizmo the Cat"
Reviews.Content: I think it's really stupid that no one tells you there is no memory card that YOU NEED to use this. I know there are reviews that tell you this but who reads 30 reviews to find this out? So I just received this camera, charged the battery, went to use it and.... WOW you don't have a memory card??? Wished I had known that before hand. Then I would have ordered that with it so I can use it...... Stupid MF's

Reviews.Title: Missing part of camera causes loss
Reviews.Author: Doranna Howard
Reviews.Content: I received the camera and it worked fine.  However, the wrist strap was not included in the shipment and thus I had no way to carry it with me.  There was no neck strap also.  The wrist strap was listed as a part ;of the camera in the accompanying booklet for users.  So I lost the camera somewhere in the country of Jordan or Israel and had no way to record memories of my trip.  Can you send me another camera just like the one I had but including the wrist strap?  I feel this missing strap was responsible for the loss.

Reviews.Title: Can't get the software to install.  No trouble shooting help
Reviews.Author: Goya Morris
Reviews.Content: When was the last time you had software that didn't install?2000?1995?1990?The software seems to install correctly, but when I plug the camera in and turn it on:A Vista message:Driver software was not successful. Please consult your device manufacturer for assistance getting this device installed.Digital Still Camera - Failed.This is frustrating enough, but then to find absolutely NO information on what might be wrong in the Canon manual or even a website to contact to figure it out what might be wrong, is enough to as Amanda Cross wrote "make me want to howl and chew the carpets"Even tried searching the net for a solution and couldn't find anything.Wish me luck and avoid this camera.

Reviews.Title: SO SAD, I can't find an image to shoot
Reviews.Author: gerry straatemeier
Reviews.Content: I always put a camera viewfinder right up to my very corrected glasses (I am 69 y/o with astigmatism).  There is no viewfinder.I love taking pictures, working with them, I am almost in tears that I can't use the camera.  Someone told me no cameras will have viewfinders any more, so I guess us old people will have to stop taking pictures.The window in the back is useless.  It is blurry through all three lenses of my trifocals.  If I have to turn it a little and it's like the computer screen next door - black or shiny, no image.  By the time I have the camera far enough away to actually see what's in the window, I no longer have any control of the image, can't even find a picture on a wall jn my bedroom, and it goes in and out of being blurry besides.Plus, by the time the camera is a foot or 18" away so that I can see the window at the back of the camera, and hope to see something focus in it, my arm is shaking so bad, the picture is a blur.Please tell me I can still find a camera with a vewfinder by my eyeballl.

Reviews.Title: Question
Reviews.Author: JennyPenny
Reviews.Content: Can someone please tell me if this camera has a date stamp option? I have been researching but can not find the answer. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: 1 Star is for the 1 hundred plus dollars you will lose on this item
Reviews.Author: Dav1d "Dav1d"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this item and now it is so messed up that I have to sell it to a recycling site for a fraction of the price I paidThe reason for this is because the thing is cheaply painted. I took this camera to Prom and had it in a padded pouch in my tux pocket when I wasn't using it except for once when I dropped it, but it was still in the padded pouch. When I got home I discovered that it had at least four places where the paint had been chipped off the camera. Why? I had no idea until I held it in my hand and realized that even touching it some paint was coming off! This would not have been so bad if it was the only problem with the camera, but it isn't.Other things wrong with this camera:The Iso: As one reviewer pointed out, the Iso on the default setting of this thing is very high. That is an understatement. the Iso is through the roof! the only way to take decent photos with this thing inside and out, is to go to programming mode and set the Iso differently for every different situation you are in. Not very convenient.The shooting speed: When taking a picture, it takes almost two seconds to process and display the picture you are taking. that is very slow compared to some cameras  half the price of this one. it also becomes a huge problem when you are taking pictures of a fast moving object, like an animal or car.Blur: Any time you take a picture of someone with this camera, you have to have your subject completely still! any sudden movements will cause a blur that will ruin the whole shot. For instance, when I took a picture of one of my friends dancing, the image was completely blurred!Rotating a picture: Canon is well known for allowing the user to rotate a picture by rotating the camera. On this model, when you rotate the camera, the picture either doesn't rotate or it rotates very late.Menus: The menus are very confusing. For instance, when I was looking for the Iso setting in the programing mode, I actually had to do alot of guess work before I found it. Even then the function was not named "Iso Setting" but something different. I can understand needing to read most of the instructions for a more advanced camera. but this is supposed to be a simple Point and Shoot. you should be able figure out at least the basic functions without them.Zoom: When you zoom in on your subject you are very limited on the distance you can zoom in. You either have  very wide view, midrange view, or very close view. there is almost no in between. the same goes for when you are browsing pictures in playback mode.I hate to be so negative, but these are my true experiences with camera and I want to warn other buyers before they throw away almost $200 on this product. I have heard many good things about Canon's quality, but bottom line is this camera does not contain any of it. hope you find this review helpful. As for me, I am about to go buy a Nikon Coolpix S3000. hopefully will have better luck with it.

Reviews.Title: NO MEMORY CARD INCLUDED!
Reviews.Author: Scott  C. Trees
Reviews.Content: Beware!  Don't let the low price fool you.  THERE IS NO MEMORY CARD INCLUDED with this camera!  Guess the saying is correct, 'You get what you pay for!'.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Camera
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the Canon PowerShot camera.  However, I was not happy with this purchase since a memory card was not included with the camera.  The advertisement was misleading and a gift that was meant to be used for a very special occasion was not used since there was no memory card.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Mikey
Reviews.Content: Very nice small compact camera. Takes very good quality pictures. The only thing I didn't like, I gave it to my wife on christmas eve and discovered you need a SD card to take any pictures. Was never so upset christmas morning when we couldn't take pictures!! If I'd known, I would have bought a SD card with it.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera was good to me
Reviews.Author: Bobby W. Barker
Reviews.Content: I receieved the digital camera.  Easy to set up straight out of the box.  Does what I want.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: William L. Richards, Jr.
Reviews.Content: This product was purchased as a gift. The recipient liked and has used the camera, but hasn't given me enough information that I feel I can write a meaningful review.

Reviews.Title: defective
Reviews.Author: catlover888 "catlover888"
Reviews.Content: The first few test shots were fine, but the photos got lighter and lighter, to the point where they all ended up like a white cloud.  So I cannot tell you how good or bad the product is.  I am returning this and will report back once I get its replacement.

Reviews.Title: Canon sd1300 Does NOT disappoint!!
Reviews.Author: Lauri Schultz-watson
Reviews.Content: So far, I LOVE this camera!! Very easy to use and the pictures have been great so far! Please check out my full 'review' at [...].

Reviews.Title: memory card
Reviews.Author: cmcatkearny
Reviews.Content: can't use it so can't recommend it. why don't they tell you it doesn't come with a memory card. crazy.
